poem: Watch who you call friend, because friends are the same ones that will leak your business to everyone after yall not friends anymore
author: Ritu Ghatourey

poem: Time alone can prove the worth offriendship. As time goes by we losethe the false ones and keep thebest. True friends stay when all therest are gone
author: Ritu Ghatourey

poem: I've got more respect for someone who comes out and says they don't like me than for the ones who act like they do but talk bad about me when I'm not around
author: Mitchell Perry

poem: A friend who stands with you in pressure is more valuable than a hundred ones who stand with you in pleasure
author: Edward G. Bulwer-Lytton

poem: Keep talking about me behind my back, and watch God keep blessing me in front of your face
author: Author Unknown

poem: Every coin has two sides, just like most people have two faces
author: Author Unknown

poem: I used to think enemies were the worst people in the world, but that was until I met fake friends and realized that they're a lot worse
author: Author Unknown

poem: The same person that speaks highly of you will be the same person that downs you. Be careful who you call friends
author: Author Unknown

poem: Better to have an enemy who slaps you in the face than a friend who stabs you in the back
author: Author Unknown

poem: An enemy, who is honest and shows his/her hate openly is better than a friend who is liar and putting you down secretly
author: Author Unknown

poem: First best is falling in love. Second best is being in love. Least best is falling out of love. But any of it is better than never having been in love
author: Maya Angelou

poem: Sometimes you break your heart in the right way, if you know what I mean
author: Gregory David Roberts

poem: You will always fall in love, and it will always be like having your throat cut, just that fast
author: Catherynne M. Valente

poem: When you fall in love, the natural thing to do is give yourself to it. That's what I think. It's just a form of sincerit
author: Haruki Murakami

poem: Falling in love is the best way to kill your heart because then it's not yours anymore. It's laid in a coffin, waiting to be cremated
author: Ville Valo

poem: Don't find love, let love find you. That's why its called falling in love, because you don't force yourself to fall, you just fall
author: Hannah

poem: Falling in love isn't a choice, it's a reaction. If it happens it happens. Your best bet is to fall and don't look back up
author: Annabell

poem: Have you ever watched a leaf leave a tree? It falls upward first, and then it drifts toward the ground, just as I find myself drifting towards you
author: Beth Kephart

poem: Never love anybody who treats you like you're ordinary
author: Oscar Wilde

poem: Never rush into falling in love, because love never runs out; Let love be the one to knock at your door. Besides true love is worth waiting for
author: unknown

poem: Gravitation is not responsible for people falling in love
author: Albert Einstein

poem: Fall in love when you're ready, not when you're lonely
author: unknown

poem: The first time you fall in love, it changes your life forever, and no matter how hard you try, the feeling never goes away
author: Nicholas Sparks

poem: When you are missing someone, time seems to move slower, and when I'm falling in love with someone, time seems to be moving faster
author: Taylor Swift

poem: As he read, I fell in love the way you fall asleep: slow, and then all at once
author: John Green

poem: Falling in love is great. It colors your whole world and makes your days inspiring. But for some reason, some people find it too scary. They decided it's to better hold that part of their feelings
author: Ces Peta

poem: Love is but the discovery of ourselves in others and the delight in the recognition
author: Alexander Smith

poem: Falling in love doesn't fall by itself. There is always a desire to take the plunge. Just make sure that love sticks around, to pick you up when you fall
author: unknown

poem: To fall in love is awfully simple, but to fall out of love is simply awful
author: Anonymous

poem: A guy knows he's in love when he loses interest in his car for a couple of days
author: Tim Allen

poem: Falling in love consists merely in uncorking the imagination and bottling the common sense
author: Helen Rowland

poem: I don't know how to say this, or even if its true. But I love the way you make me feel, and I think I'm falling for you
author: Nicole Kinder

poem: Everybody makes mistakes. I also make them. But the biggest mistake I ever made was falling for yo
author: unknown

poem: You always fall for the most unexpected person at the most unexpected time and sometimes for the most unexpected reason
author: unknown

poem: Falling for someone is easy, getting back up after the fall is the problem
author: unknown

poem: We do not fall in love with the package of the person, we fall in love with the inside of a person
author: unknown

poem: Trying to make someone fall in love with you is about as pointless as trying to control who you fall in love with
author: unknown

poem: This thing about you that you think is your flaw - it's the reason I'm falling in love with you
author: Colleen Hoover

poem: Falling in love with YOU was never my intention, but it became my ADDICTION
author: Abhishek Tiwari

poem: To fall in love is to create a religion that has a fallible god
author: Jorge Luis Borges

poem: A man falls in love through his eyes, a woman through her ears
author: Woodrow Wyatt

poem: You know you're in love the moment you can touch the stars without reaching
author: Melisa M. Hamling

poem: You know you're falling in love when the feeling of falling actually feels like you're floating
author: Rashida Rowe

poem: To fall in love is easy, even to remain in it is not difficult; our human loneliness is cause enough. But is a hard quest worth making to find a comrade through whose steady presence one becomes steadily the person one desires to be
author: Anna Strong

poem: He that falls in love with himself will have no rivals
author: Benjamin Franklin

poem: When you fall in love with someone, you give them your heart. When you find out they love you too, you get it back, times two
author: unknown

poem: Falling for him would be like cliff diving. It would be either the most exhilarating thing that ever happened to me or the stupidest mistake I'd ever make
author: Hussein Nishah

poem: Falling in love is easy. Falling in love with the same person repeatedly is extraordinary
author: Crystal Woods

poem: To fall in love with someone's thoughts - the most intimate, splendid romance
author: Sanober Khan

poem: I have always been quite good at falling in love, but I don't pretend to know anything about literal happily ever afters
author: Jennifer Harrison

poem: I fall into him like one would fall into a dream, ready to submit to your subconscious's inner most desires and your deepest fears
author: Stephanie Binding

poem: Always try to come back to your senses when in love, because that's the moment you become almost carried away by sensuality and sentiments
author: Michael Bassey Johnson

poem: He is my unicorn, though... That's how I felt falling in love with him, as if I'd found a creature of myth
author: Rivka Galchen

poem: To fall in love is a legendry action that doesn't need any explanation
author: Auliq Ice

poem: Because if I fell any deeper for the way his eyes crinkled with his smile or his habit of tapping on his nose to emphasize a point, my ship would be sunk
author: Katherine McIntyre

poem: It's easy to fall in love. The hard part is finding someone to catch you
author: Bertrand Russell

poem: A successful marriage requires falling in love many times, always with the same person
author: Mignon McLaughlin

poem: Don't fall for him to notice him, notice him to fall for him
author: Eva Vasquez

poem: Falling in love is a subtle process, a connection sparked by attraction, tested by compatibility, and forged by memory
author: Jay Bell

poem: A brother may not be a friend, but a friend will always be a brother
author: Ben Franklin (1706-1790)

poem: A crab walks, so walks his children
author: African proverb Kpelle Tribe

poem: A father's a treasure; a brother's a comfort; a friend is both
author: Ben Franklin (1706-1790)

poem: A house divided cannot stand
author: Bible (Matthew 12:25)

poem: Be it ever so humble there's no place like home
author: unknown

poem: Blood is thicker than water
author: German Proverb

poem: Charity begins at home
author: Tobias George Smollett (1721-1771)

poem: Children are a poor man's riches
author: English Proverb

poem: Children have more need of models than critics
author: French (on parents and children)

poem: Give an extra piece of cake to a stepchild
author: Korean (on parenting and children)

poem: Home is where the heart is
author: J.J. McCloskey (1870)

poem: Like father, like son
author: Asian Proverb

poem: Like father, like son
author: unknown

poem: One father is more than a hundred schoolmasters
author: George Herbert (1593-1633)

poem: The apple doesn't fall far from the tree
author: Asian Proverb

poem: What children say, they have heard at home
author: Wolof (West African (on parenting and children)

poem: You can do anything with children if only you play with them
author: German (on parenting and children)

poem: It is not flesh and blood but the heart which makes us fathers and sons
author: Johann Schiller

poem: We all grow up with the weight of history on us. Our ancestors dwell in the attics of our brains as they do in the spiraling chains of knowledge hidden in every cell of our bodies
author: Shirley Abbott

poem: You don't choose your family. They are God's gift to you, as you are to them
author: Desmond Tutu

poem: An ounce of blood is worth more than a pound of friendship
author: Spanish Proverb

poem: What greater thing is there for human souls than to feel that they are joined for life - to be with each other in silent unspeakable memories
author: George Eliot

poem: Families are the compass that guides us. They are the inspiration to reach great heights, and our comfort when we occasionally falter
author: Brad Henry

poem: Families are messy. Immortal families are eternally messy. Sometimes the best we can do is to remind each other that we're related for better or for worse and try to keep the maiming and killing to a minimum
author: Rick Riordan

poem: Each day of our lives we make deposits in the memory banks of our children
author: Charles R. Swindoll

poem: Home is where you are loved the most and act the worst
author: Marjorie Pay Hinckley

poem: That's what people do who love you. They put their arms around you and love you when you're not so lovable
author: Deb Caletti

poem: Feelings of worth can flourish only in an atmosphere where individual differences are appreciated, mistakes are tolerated, communication is open, and rules are flexible -- the kind of atmosphere that is found in a nurturing family
author: Virginia Satir

poem: Having children makes you no more a parent than having a piano makes you a pianist
author: Michael Levinve

poem: The most important thing a father can do for his children is to love their mother
author: Theodore Hesburgh

poem: To put the world right in order, we must first put the nation in order; to put the nation in order, we must first put the family in order; to put the family in order, we must first cultivate our personal life; we must first set our hearts right
author: Confucius

poem: It is a wise father that knows his own child
author: William Shakespeare

poem: All parents damage their children. It cannot be helped. Youth, like pristine glass, absorbs the prints of its handlers. Some parents smudge, others crack, a few shatter childhoods completely into jagged little pieces, beyond repair
author: Mitch Albom

poem: Bringing up a family should be an adventure, not an anxious discipline in which everybody is constantly graded for performance
author: Milton R. Saperstein

poem: Parents are like God because you wanna know they're out there, and you want them to think well of you, but you really only call when you need something
author: Chuck Palahniuk

poem: Parents were the only ones obligated to love you; from the rest of the world you had to earn it
author: Ann Brashares

poem: The bond that links your true family is not one of blood, but of respect and joy in each other's life. Rarely do members of one family grow up under the same roof
author: Richard Bach

poem: The strength of a nation derives from the integrity of the home
author: Confucius

poem: A mother is not a person to lean on, but a person to make leaning unnecessary
author: Dorothy C. Fisher

poem: When you educate a man you educate an individual. When you educate a woman you educate a whole family
author: Robert M. Maciver

poem: The best inheritance a parent can give to his children is a few minutes of their time each day
author: M. Grundler

poem: The children despise their parents until the age of when they suddenly become just like them - thus preserving the system
author: Quentin

poem: When any trouble comes in home, all family members takes it as its own and this is called family love
author: unknown

poem: Home is people. Not a place. If you go back there after the people are gone, then all you can see is what is not there any more
author: Robin Hobb

poem: A daughter without her mother is a woman broken. It is a loss that turns to arthritis and settles deep into her bones
author: Kristin Hannah

poem: The informality of family life is a blessed condition that allows us to become our best while looking our worst
author: Marge Kennedy

poem: We cannot destroy kindred: our chains stretch a little sometimes, but they never break
author: Marquise de S_vign_

poem: This was the trouble with families. Like invidious doctors, they knew just where it hurt
author: Arundhati Roy

poem: While we try to teach our children all about life, our children teach us what life is all about
author: Angela Schwindt

poem: Families ties are cherished things, forged in childhood days, by love of parents, deep and true, and sweet familiar ways
author: Terri Burritt

poem: This is part of what a family is about, not just love. It's knowing that your family will be there watching out for you. Nothing else will give you that. Not money. Not fame. Not work
author: Mitch Albom

poem: We create our fate every day we live
author: Henry Miller

poem: Fate leads the willing and drags along the unwilling
author: Seneca

poem: No power or virtue of man could ever have deserved that what has been fated should not have taken place
author: Marcellinus Ammianus

poem: Fate is nothing but the deeds committed in a prior state of existence
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

poem: Fate is for those too weak to determine their own destiny
author: Kamran Hamid

poem: Men are not prisoners of fate, but only prisoners of their own minds
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

poem: Sometimes our fate resembles a fruit tree in winter. Who would think that those branches would turn green again and blossom, but we hope it, we know it
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

poem: Wherever a man may happen to turn, whatever a man may undertake, he will always end up by returning to the path which nature has marked out for him
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

poem: Accept the things to which fate binds you, and love the people with whom fate brings you together, but do so with all your heart
author: Marcus Aurelius

poem: Each player must accept the cards life deals him or her. But once they are in hand, he or she alone must decide how to play the cards in order to win the game
author: Voltaire

poem: Many men would take the death sentence without a whimper to escape the life sentence which Fate carries in her hand
author: T.E. Lawrence

poem: We may become the makers of our fate when we have ceased to pose as its prophets
author: Karl Popper

poem: How a person masters his fate is more important than what his fate is
author: Karl Wilhelm von Humboldt

poem: When an inner situation is not made conscious, it appears outside as fate
author: Carl Jung

poem: As we move through life, the force of fate creates events that we only appreciate when we reflect on our existence
author: Ronald Harmon

poem: One meets his destiny often in the road he takes to avoid it
author: Proverb

poem: Nothing happens by chance, my friend... No such thing as luck. A meaning behind every little thing, and such a meaning behind this. Part for you, part for me, may not see it all real clear right now, but we will, before long
author: Richard Bach

poem: Whatever the universal nature assigns to any man at any time is for the good of that man at that time
author: Marcus Aurelius

poem: Man is manacled only by himself; thought and action are the jailers of Fate
author: James Allen

poem: You cannot be lost on a road that is straight
author: Proverb

poem: I do not believe in a fate that will fall on us no matter what we do. I do believe in a fate that will fall on us if we do nothing
author: Ronald Reagan

poem: We are spinning our own fates, good or evil, never to be undone
author: William James

poem: Man does not control his own fate. The women in his life do that for him
author: Groucho Marx

poem: Fate's sentence written on the brow no hand can e'er efface
author: Bhartrhari

poem: Maybe Fate isn't the pond you swim in but the fisherman floating on top of it, letting you run the line wild until you are weary enough to be reeled back in
author: Jodi Picoult

poem: Fate is not an eagle, it creeps like a rat
author: Elizabeth Bowen

poem: We seal our fate with the choices we make
author: Gloria Estefan

poem: Lots of folks confuse bad management with destiny
author: Kin Hubbard

poem: Failure and success seem to have been allotted to men by their stars. But they retain the power of wriggling, of fighting with their star or against it, and in the whole universe the only really interesting movement is this wriggle
author: E.M. Forester

poem: al(ez_write_tag([[250,250],'wiseoldsayings_com-medrectangle-3','ezslot_5']));“ I will seize fate by the throat; it shall certainly never wholly overcome me
author: Ludwig van Beethoven

poem: Fate laughs at probabilities
author: Edward George Earle Bulwer-Lytton

poem: A door that seems to stand open must be a man's size, or it is not the door that Providence means for him
author: Henry Ward Beecher

poem: Again, you can't connect the dots looking forward; you can only connect them looking backwards. So you have to trust that the dots will somehow connect in your future. You have to trust in something - your gut, destiny, life, karma, whatever. This approach has never let me down, and it has made all the difference in my life
author: Steve Jobs

poem: Fate is like a strange, unpopular restaurant, filled with odd waiters who bring you things you never asked for and don't always like
author: Lemony Snicket

poem: Fate loves the fearless
author: James Russell Lowell

poem: Once you make a decision, the universe conspires to make it happen
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

poem: Sometimes life has a cruel sense of humor, giving you the thing you always wanted at the worst time possible
author: Lisa Kleypas

poem: There is no chance, no destiny, no fate, that can circumvent or hinder or control the firm resolve of a determined soul
author: Ella Wheeler Wilcox

poem: Fate is never fair. You are caught in a current much stronger than you are; struggle against it and you'll drown not just yourself but those who try to save you. Swim with it. and you'll surviv
author: Cassandra Clare

poem: Yet it would be your duty to bear it, if you could not avoid it: it is weak and silly to say you cannot bear what it is your fate to be required to bear
author: Charlotte Bronte

poem: I can control my destiny, but not my fate. Destiny means there are opportunities to turn right or left, but fate is a one-way street. I believe we all have the choice as to whether we fulfil our destiny, but our fate is sealed
author: Paulo Coehlo

poem: There is no such thing as accident; it is fate misnamed
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

poem: What separates the winners from the losers is how a person reacts to each new twist of fate
author: Donald Trump

poem: Just because Fate doesn't deal you the right cards, it doesn't mean you should give up. It just means you have to play the cards you get to their maximum potential
author: Les Brown

poem: Knowing yourself is the beginning of all wisdom
author: Aristotle

poem: People often say that this or that person has not yet found himself. But the self is not something one finds, it is something one creates
author: Thomas Szasz

poem: Know yourself. Don't accept your dog's admiration as conclusive evidence that you are wonderful
author: Ann Landers

poem: Know thyself'' If I knew myself, I'd run away
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

poem: The only journey is the journey within
author: Rainer Maria Rilke

poem: MEN CAN STARVE FROM A LACK OF SELF-REALIZATION AS MUCH AS THEY CAN FROM A LACK OF BREAD
author: Richard Wright

poem: NOT UNTIL WE ARE LOST DO WE BEGIN TO UNDERSTAND OURSELVES
author: Henry David Thoreau

poem: One must know oneself. If this does not serve to discover truth, it at least serves as a rule of life, and there is nothing better
author: Blaise Pascal

poem: All the wonders you seek are within yourself
author: Thomas Browne

poem: I think that somehow, we learn who we really are and then live with that decision
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

poem: Should we say the self, once perceived, becomes the soul
author: Theodore Roethke

poem: Resolve to be thyself: and know, that he who finds himself, loses his misery
author: Matthew Arnold

poem: To find yourself, think for yourself
author: Socrates

poem: If a man happens to find himself, he has a mansion which he can inhabit with dignity all the days of his life
author: James A. Michener

poem: In the end you don't so much find yourself as you find someone who knows who you are
author: Robert Brault

poem: Don't spend all of your time trying to FIND yourself. Spend your time CREATING yourself into a person that you'll be proud of
author: Sonya Parker

poem: The best way to find yourself is to lose yourself in the service of others
author: Mohandas Karamchand Gandhi

poem: You've got to find yourself first. Everything else'll follow
author: Charles De Lint

poem: Don't worry about finding your soul mate. Find yourself
author: Jason Evert

poem: Whatever it takes to find the real you, don't be daunted if the rest of the world looks on in shock
author: Stephen Richards

poem: When you fight yourself to discover the real you, there is only one winner
author: Stephen Richards

poem: Sometimes we must lose ourselves to find ourselves
author: Sonny Long

poem: Someday, somewhere ' anywhere, unfailingly, you'll find yourself, and that, and only that, can be the happiest or bitterest hour of your life
author: Pablo Neruda

poem: I long, as does every human being, to be at home wherever I find myself
author: Maya Angelou

poem: Each man's life represents a road toward himself
author: Herman Hesse

poem: Knowing others is intelligence; knowing yourself is true wisdom. Mastering others is strength; mastering yourself is true power
author: Lao-Tzu

poem: First find the man in yourself if you will inspire manliness in others
author: Amos Bronson Alcott

poem: Lose yourself wholly; and the more you lose, the more you will find
author: Catherine Of Siena

poem: You've got to know yourself so you can at last be yourself
author: D. H. Lawrence

poem: Be who you are, and find yourself so you can be your own person and enjoy life with no regret
author: Bonnie Zackson Koury

poem: Your real self may be hiding somewhere, look for it within, when you find yourself, you can freely be what you want to be
author: Michael Bassey Johnson

poem: Find yourself first-like yourself first-love yourself FIRST & friendship & love will naturally find YOU
author: Mandy Hale

poem: Finding oneself and one's path is like waking up on a foggy day. Be patient, and presently the fog will clear and that which has always been there can be seen. The path is already there to follow
author: Rasheed Ogunlaru

poem: Know, first, who you are, and then adorn yourself accordingly
author: Epictetus

poem: Find the love you seek, by first finding the love within yourself. Learn to rest in that place within you that is your true home
author: Sri Sri Ravi Shankar

poem: You never find yourself until you face the truth
author: Pearl Bailey

poem: You can always find the sun within yourself if you will only search
author: Maxwell Maltz

poem: If you're being ignored, that's a good time to concentrate on finding yourself and creating your own mystery
author: Lykke Li

poem: It's not about finding a home so much as finding yourself
author: Jason Behr

poem: We lose ourselves in things we love. We find ourselves there, too
author: Kristin Martz

poem: You really have to look inside yourself and find your own inner strength, and say, 'I'm proud of what I am and who I am, and I'm just going to be myself
author: Mariah Carey

poem: Sometimes when you lose your way, you find YOURSELF
author: Mandy Hale

poem: What you have to find is, yourself first
author: Nishi De Silva

poem: The only way to find yourself is when you start being true to everyone around you
author: unknown

poem: Know thyself means this, that you get acquainted with what you know, and what you can do
author: Menander

poem: Find out who you are and do it on purpose
author: Dolly Parton

poem: Committing yourself is a way of finding out who you are. A man finds his identity by identifying
author: Robert Terwilliger

poem: One does not "find oneself" by pursuing one's self, but on the contrary by pursuing something else and learning through discipline or routine ? who one is and wants to be
author: May Sarton

poem: The fire is the main comfort of the camp, whether in summer or winter, and is about as ample at one season as at another. It is as well for cheerfulness as for warmth and dryness
author: Henry David Thoreau

poem: Fire is the most tolerable third party
author: Henry David Thoreau

poem: Fire and gunpowder do not sleep together
author: Proverb

poem: As soon go kindle fire with snow, as seek to quench the fire of love with words
author: William Shakespeare

poem: Fire is the test of gold; adversity, of strong men
author: Martha Graham

poem: Fire is never a gentle maste
author: Proverb

poem: Fire that's closest kept burns most of all
author: William Shakespeare

poem: When fire is applied to a stone it cracks
author: Author Unknown

poem: Success isn't a result of spontaneous combustion. You must set yourself on fire
author: Arnold Glascow

poem: Give a man a fire and he's warm for the day. But set fire to him and he's warm for the rest of his life
author: Terry Pratchett

poem: Fire, water, and government know nothing of mercy
author: Proverb

poem: Fire and gunpowder do not sleep together
author: Proverb

poem: Build a man a fire, and he'll be warm for a day. Set a man on fire, and he'll be warm for the rest of his life
author: Terry Pratchett

poem: The most tangible of all visible mysteries - fire
author: Leigh Hunt

poem: What matters most is how well you walk through the fire
author: Charles Bukowski

poem: Just as a candle cannot burn without fire, men cannot live without a spiritual life
author: Buddha

poem: Where there is smoke there is fire
author: Proverb

poem: The fire you kindle for your enemy often burns yourself more than them
author: Chinese Proverb

poem: Playing with fire is bad for those who burn themselves. For the rest of us, it is a very great pleasure
author: Jerry Smith

poem: Among the notable things about fire is that it also requires oxygen to burn - exactly like its enemy, life. Thereby are life and flames so often compared
author: Otto Weininger

poem: Fire in the heart sends smoke into the head
author: Proverb

poem: Fire is never a gentle maste
author: Proverb

poem: The United States is like giant boiler. Once the fire is lighted under it, there is no limit to the power it can generate
author: Winston Churchill

poem: Life is a flame that is always burning itself out, but it catches fire again every time a child is born
author: George Bernard Shaw

poem: A man can be short and dumpy and getting bald but if he has fire, women will like him
author: Mae West

poem: Words are only painted fire; a look is the fire itself
author: Mark Twain

poem: Big fires flare up in a wind, but little ones are blown out unless they are carried in under cover
author: St Frances De Sales

poem: One can enjoy a wood fire worthily only when he warms his thoughts by it as well as his hands and feet
author: Odell Shepherd

poem: If you ever catch on fire, try to avoid seeing yourself in the mirror, because I bet that's what really throws you into a panic
author: Jack Handey

poem: He who sits by the fire, thankless for the fire, is just as if he had no fire. Nothing is possessed save in appreciation, of which thankfulness is the indispensable ingredient
author: W.J. Cameron

poem: When you think about flying, it's nuts really. Here you are at about 40,000 feet, screaming along at 700 miles an hour and you're sitting there drinking Diet Pepsi and eating peanuts.  It just doesn't make any sense
author: David Letterman

poem: Flying may not be all plain sailing, but the fun of it is worth the price
author: Amelia Earhart

poem: There is no flying without wings
author: French Proverb

poem: Flying is hours and hours of boredom sprinkled with a few seconds of sheer terror
author: Gregory ''Pappy'' Boyington

poem: Sometimes, flying feels too godlike to be attained by man. Sometimes, the world from above seems too beautiful, too wonderful, too distant for human eyes to see . .
author: Charles A. Lindbergh

poem: The exhilaration of flying is too keen, the pleasure too great, for it to be neglected as a sport
author: Orville Wright

poem: Flying is more than a sport and more than a job; flying is pure passion and desire, which fill a lifetime
author: General Adolf Galland

poem: Flying is a lot like playing a musical instrument; you're doing so many things and thinking of so many other things, all at the same time. It becomes a spiritual experience. Something wonderful happens in the pit of your stomach
author: Dusty Mctavish

poem: Flying has torn apart the relationship of space and time: it uses our old clock but with new yardsticks
author: Charles A. Lindbergh

poem: Flying is learning how to throw yourself at the ground and miss
author: Douglas Adams

poem: There is no more exciting sport than flying, for if you lose, you die
author: Christopher Paolini

poem: Flying is awful, there's nothing to do when you're up in the air. I bloat up, my skin gets dry, and when we hit turbulence, I'm terrified
author: Daniela Pestova

poem: I don't have a fear of flying; I have a fear of crashing
author: Billy Bob Thornton

poem: Why fly' Simple. I'm not happy unless there's some room between me and the ground
author: Richard Bach

poem: I think it is a pity to lose the romantic side of flying and simply to accept it as a common means of transport...
author: Amy Johnson

poem: There are only two emotions in a plane: boredom and terror
author: Orson Welles

poem: Once you have learned to fly your plane, it is far less fatiguing to fly than it is to drive a car. You don't have to watch every second for cats, dogs, children, lights, road signs, ladies with baby carriages and citizens who drive out in the middle of
author: William T. Piper

poem: You haven't seen a tree until you've seen its shadow from the sky
author: Amelia Earhart

poem: The higher we soar the smaller we appear to those who cannot fly
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

poem: Angels can fly because they take themselves lightly
author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

poem: The good thing about flying solo is it's never boring
author: Steve Fossett

poem: Flying was a very tangible freedom. In those days, it was beauty, adventure, discovery - the epitome of breaking into new worlds
author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh

poem: When once you have tasted flight, you will forever walk the earth with your eyes turned skyward, for there you have been, and there you will always long to return
author: Leonardo da Vinci

poem: There are no signposts in the sky to show a man has passed that way before. There are no channels marked. The flier breaks each second into new uncharted seas
author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh

poem: That's the thing about flying: You could talk to someone for hours and never even know his name, share your deepest secrets and then never see them again
author: Jennifer E. Smith

poem: Flying can be easy at times, but with the wrong machine or the wrong person at the controls, it is the most difficult thing in the world
author: Paul Gallagher

poem: He who would learn to fly one day must first learn to stand and walk and run and climb and dance; one cannot fly into flying
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

poem: To most people the sky is the limit. To those who love flying, the sky is home
author: unknown

poem: There is no sport equal to that which aviators enjoy while being carried through the air on great white wings
author: Wilbur Wright

poem: More than anything else, the sensation of flying is one of perfect peace mingled with an excitement that strains every nerve to the utmost ~ if you can conceive of such a combination
author: Wilbur Wright

poem: I learned the discipline of flying in order to have the freedom of flight....Discipline prevents crashes
author: Captain John Cook

poem: I was sold on flying as soon as I had a taste for it
author: John Glenn

poem: Flying is done largely with the imagination
author: Wolfgang Langwiesche

poem: I have often said that the lure of flying is the lure of beauty.  That the reasons flyers fly, whether they know it or not, is the aesthetic appeal of flying
author: Amelia Earhart

poem: If you are bored flying, your standards are too low
author: Lauran Paine Jr

poem: In flying I have learned that carelessness and overconfidence are usually far more dangerous than deliberately accepted risks
author: Wilbur Wright

poem: Flying is within our grasp. We have naught to do but take it
author: Charles F. Duryea

poem: We who fly do so for the love of flying. We are alive in the air with this miracle that lies in our hands and beneath our feet
author: Cecil Day Lewis

poem: Flying alone! Nothing gives such a sense of mastery over time over mechanism, mastery indeed over space, time, and life itself, as this
author: Cecil Day Lewis

poem: [Flying] fosters fantasies of childhood, of omnipotence, rapid shifts of being, miraculous moments; it stirs our capacity for dreaming
author: Joyce Carol

poem: All my life, I've never been able to get enough airplanes. This will keep me flying every day
author: Astronaut Robert 'Hoot' Gibson

poem: Flying prevails whenever a man and his airplane are put to a test of maximum performance
author: Richard Bach

poem: Flying is inherently dangerous. We like to gloss that over with clever rhetoric and comforting statistics, but these facts remain: gravity is constant and powerful, and speed kills. In combination, they are particularly destructive
author: Dan Manningham

poem: I fly because it releases my mind from the tyranny of petty things
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

poem: Flying without feathers is not easy; my wings have no feathers
author: Plautus

poem: See driving is like stabbing someone, it's very personal. While flying is like shooting someone, it's more distant
author: Bushwick Bill

poem: Fridays are the hardest in some ways: you're so close to freedom
author: Lauren Oliver

poem: It's always difficult to keep Fridays confined within themselves..they tend to spill over.
author: Kai Sinclair

poem: For most Americans, Friday afternoons are filled with positive anticipation of the weekend. In Washington, it's where government officials dump stories they want to bury
author: John Sununu

poem: Employers are at their happiest on Mondays. Employees are at their happiest on Fridays
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

poem: Friday is like a superhero that always arrives just in time to stop me from savagely beating one of my coworkers with a keyboard
author: Rico

poem: Youth is like a long weekend on Friday night. Middle age is like a long weekend on Monday afternoon
author: Richard Nelson Bolles

poem: Some people ask the secret of our long marriage. We take time to go to a restaurant two times a week. A little candlelight, dinner, soft music, and dancing. She goes Tuesdays, I go Fridays
author: Henny Youngman

poem: Make a Friday a day to celebrate work well done that you can be proud of knowing that you just didn't put in time to the next pay check
author: Byron Pulsifer

poem: If you must have motivation, think of your paycheck on Friday
author: Noel Coward

poem: It's Friday...any plan of being a productive member of society is officially thrown out the window
author: Anonymous

poem: Welcome to Friday. In preparation for takeoff, please ensure all negative attitudes are properly stowed. On behalf of your captain, Jack Daniels and myself, welcome aboard. I expect sunshine and good attitudes today for our trip. Enjoy the ride
author: Anonymous

poem: I always give 100% at work: 13% Monday, 22% Tuesday, 26% Wednesday, 35% Thursday, 4% Frida
author: Anonymous

poem: If my boss knew how unproductive I am on Fridays, he wouldn't want me here either
author: James Johnson

poem: Things people say: It's Friday! Things self-employed people say: It's Friday
author: Anonymous

poem: Thursday doesn't even count as a day, it's just the thing that's blocking friday
author: Anonymous

poem: If you're playing World of Warcraft on a Friday night & you put your ear up to your monitor, it sounds exactly like having no friends
author: Anonymous

poem: Thursday, which is 'Friday Eve' in Optimisian
author: Anonymous

poem: Dear Radio Stations, please do not play Katy Perry's 'Friday Night' Monday morning at 8 AM during my drive to work
author: Anonymous

poem: My boss yelled at me yesterday 'It's the fifth time you've been late to work this week! Do you know what that means!?' I said, 'Probably that it's Friday?
author: Anonymous

poem: Friday. The golden child of the weekdays. The superhero of the workweek. The welcome wagon to the weekend. The famous F word we thank God for every week
author: Anonymous

poem: I'm so sad it's Friday. I wish it was Monday already' said No one in history, ever
author: Anonymous

poem: Dear Monday, I want to break up. I'm seeing Tuesday and dreaming about Friday. Sincerely, It's not me, It's you
author: Anonymous

poem: I know every day is a gift, but where's the receipt for Mondays? I want to exchange it for another Friday
author: Anonymous

poem: It's Friday! I can't wait to be ashamed of what I do this weekend
author: Anonymous

poem: I've taught fifth-year Christmas leavers last thing on a Friday afternoon. Basically, if you can face that you can face anything
author: Johann Lamont

poem: It is bad luck to fall out of a thirteenth story window on Friday
author: Proverb

poem: Your hair may be brushed, but your mind's untidy. You've had about seven hours of sleep since Friday. No wonder you feel that lost sensation. You're sunk from a riot of relaxation.
author: Ogden Nash

poem: There is a vast world of work out there in this country, where at least 111 million people are employed in this country alone--many of whom are bored out of their minds. All day long. Not for nothing is their motto TGIF -- 'Thank God It's Friday.' They live for the weekends, when they can go do what they really want to do
author: Richard Nelson Bolles

poem: Waiting for the fish to bite or waiting for wind to fly a kite. Or waiting around for Friday night or waiting perhaps for their Uncle Jake or a pot to boil or a better break or a string of pearls or a pair of pants or a wig with curls or another chance. Everyone is just waiting.
author: Dr. Seuss

poem: Why is Monday so far away from Friday but Friday is so close to Monday
author: Anonymous

poem: A real friend is one who walks in when the rest of the world walks out
author: unknown

poem: A true friend is the best Possession
author: Ben Franklin (1706-1790)

poem: Friends are God's way of taking care of us
author: nknown

poem: Friendship increases by visiting friends but visiting seldom
author: Ben Franklin (1706-1790)

poem: Friendship is one mind in two bodies
author: Mencius (c.371-289)

poem: Hold a true friend with both your hands
author: Nigerian Proverb

poem: Keep your friends close, your enemies even closer
author: Sun Tzu

poem: Keep your friendships in repair
author: Samuel Butler (1612-1680)

poem: Little friends may prove great friends
author: Aesop (c.620-560 BC)

poem: Make a friend when you don't need one
author: Jamaican (on friendship)

poem: Misfortune tests the sincerity of friends
author: Aesop (c.620-560 BC)

poem: No better relation than a prudent and faithful friend
author: Ben Franklin (1706-1790)

poem: One enemy is too many and a hundred friends too few
author: unknown

poem: Strangers are just friends waiting to happen
author: unknown

poem: The best mirror is an old friend
author: George Herbert (1593-1632)

poem: The road to a friend's house is never long
author: Danish Proverb

poem: The wise man learns more from his enemies than the fool does from his friends
author: Ben Franklin, thanks to Carl McFarland

poem: The wolf and the dog agree, at the expense of the goat which together they eat
author: Basque (on friends and foes)

poem: When I eat your bread, I sing your song
author: German (on friendship)

poem: Who is mighty? He who makes an enemy into a friend
author: Hebrew (on friends and foes)

poem: You never really know your friends from your enemies until the ice breaks
author: Eskimo (on friends and foes)

poem: One of the most beautiful qualities of true friendship is to understand and to be understood
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

poem: There is nothing on this earth more to be prized than true friendship
author: Thomas Aquinas

poem: Walking with a friend in the dark is better than walking alone in the light
author: Helen Keller

poem: Friendship is always a sweet responsibility, never an opportunity
author: Khalil Gibran

poem: A friend is someone who gives you total freedom to be yourself
author: Jim Morrison

poem: Friends show their love in times of trouble, not in happiness
author: Euripedes

poem: Sometimes being a friend means mastering the art of timing. There is a time for silence. A time to let go and allow people to hurl themselves into their own destiny. And a time to prepare to pick up the pieces when it's all over
author: Octvaia Butler

poem: Friendship is born at that moment when one man says to another: What! You too? I thought that no one but myself . .
author: CS Lewis

poem: Don't walk behind me; I may not lead. Don't walk in front of me; I may not follow. Just walk beside me and be my friend
author: Albert Camus

poem: A friend is someone who knows all about you and still loves you
author: Elbert Hubbard

poem: The truth is, everyone is going to hurt you. You just got to find the ones worth suffering for
author: Bob Marley

poem: Life is an awful, ugly place to not have a best friend
author: Sarah Dessen

poem: It's the friends you can call up at 4 a.m. that matter
author: Marlene Dietrich

poem: Most of us don't need a psychiatric therapist as much as a friend to be silly with
author: Robert Brault

poem: Friendship isn't a big thing it's a million little things
author: Unknown Author

poem: In everyone's life, at some time, our inner fire goes out. It is then burst into flame by an encounter with another human being. We should all be thankful for those people who rekindle the inner spirit
author: Albert Schweitzer

poem: A loyal friend laughs at your jokes when they're not so good, and sympathizes with your problems when they're not so bad
author: Arnold Glasgow

poem: The most beautiful discovery true friends make is that they can grow separately without growing apart
author: Elisabeth Foley

poem: Friendship is like money, easier made than kept
author: Samuel Butler

poem: There are some people in life that make you laugh a little louder, smile a little bigger, and live just a little bit better
author: Unknown Author

poem: Good friends help you find important things when you have lost them. Your smile, you hope, and your courage
author: Unknown Author

poem: The language of friendship is not words but meanings
author: Henry David Thoreau

poem: Friendship is the only cement that will ever hold the world together
author: Woodrow Wilson

poem: True friendship comes when the silence between two people is comfortable
author: David Tyson Gentry

poem: Friendship consists in forgetting what one gives and remembering what one receives
author: Alexander Dumas

poem: I don't need a friend who changes when I change and who nods when I nod; my shadow does that much better
author: Plutarch

poem: Wishing to be friends is quick work, but friendship is a slow ripening fruit
author: Aristotle

poem: Friendship is the hardest thing in the world to explain. It's not something you learn in school. But if you haven't learned the meaning of friendship, you really haven't learned anything
author: Muhammad Ali

poem: Friendship marks a life even more deeply than love. Love risks degenerating into obsession, friendship is never anything but sharin
author: Elie Wiesel

poem: As you get older threee things happen. The first is your memory goes, and the I can't remember the other two
author: Sir Norman Wisdom

poem: There is absolutely nothing to be said in favor of growing old. There ought to be legislation against it
author: Patrick Moore

poem: As we grow older, our bodies get shorter and our anecdotes longer
author: Robert Quillen

poem: A man is getting old when he walks around a puddle instead of through it
author: R. C. Ferguson

poem: I don't believe one grows older. I think that what happens early on in life is that at a certain age one stands still and stagnates.
author: T. S. Eliot

poem: The great thing about getting older is that you don't lose all the other ages you've been.
author: Madeleine L'Engle

poem: You can't help getting older, but you don't have to get old.
author: George Burns

poem: We turn not older with years, but newer every day
author: Emily Dickinson

poem: As we grow older, our capacity for enjoyment shrinks, but not our appetite for it
author: Mignon McLaughlin

poem: The older you get the stronger the wind gets - and it's always in your face
author: Jack Nicklaus

poem: As a man grows older it is harder and harder to frighten him
author: Jean Paul Richter

poem: My mother always used to say, 'The older you get, the better you get, unless you're a banana'
author: Betty White

poem: There are compensations for growing older. One is the realization that to be sporting isn't at all necessary. It is a great relief to reach this stage of wisdom
author: Cornelia Otis Skinner

poem: As we grow older, we must discipline ourselves to continue expanding, broadening, learning, keeping out minds active and open
author: Clint Eastwood

poem: As we grow older we grow both more foolish and wiser at the same time
author: Francois de la Rochefoucauld

poem: I have found it to be true that the older I've become the better my life has become
author: Rush Limbaugh

poem: One of the good things about getting older is you find you're more interesting than most of the people you meet
author: Lee Marvin

poem: Growing older is not upsetting; being perceived as old is
author: Kenny Rogers

poem: You know you're getting old when you can pinch an inch on your forehead
author: John Mendoza

poem: IF YOU'RE ALWAYS BATTLING AGAINST GETTING OLDER, YOU'RE ALWAYS GOING TO BE UNHAPPY, BECAUSE IT'S GOING TO HAPPEN ANYHOW
author: Mitch Albom

poem: BUT I'M KIND OF COMFORTABLE WITH GETTING OLDER BECAUSE IT'S BETTER THAN THE OTHER OPTION, WHICH IS BEING DEAD. SO I'LL TAKE GETTING OLDER
author: George Clooney

poem: AS YOU GET OLDER, YOU LOOK AT THINGS DIFFERENTLY
author: Brett Favre

poem: AS YOU GET OLDER, YOU'RE ALWAYS MATURING, YOU'RE ALWAYS LEARNING SOMETHING NEW ABOUT YOURSELF
author: Troy Vincent

poem: YOU DON'T GET OLDER, YOU GET BETTER
author: Shirley Bassey

poem: Everything changes as you get older - your mind, your body, the way you view the world
author: Antonio Banderas

poem: As you grow older, you learn to understand life a little better
author: Solomon Burke

poem: The older I get, the more open-minded I get, the less judgmental I get
author: Gwyneth Paltrow

poem: Aging is not lost youth but a new stage of opportunity and strength
author: Betty Friedan

poem: As I get older, I realize that the thing I value the most is good-heartedness
author: Alice Walker

poem: And in the end, it's not the years in your life that count. It's the life in your years
author: Abraham Lincoln

poem: Growing old is no more than a bad habit which a busy man has no time to form
author: Andre Maurois

poem: The great thing about getting older is that you become more mellow. Things aren't as black and white, and you become much more tolerant. You can see the good in things much more easily rather than getting enraged as you used to do when you were young
author: Maeve Binchy

poem: I actually think there's an incredible amount of self-knowledge that comes with getting older
author: Jamie Lee Curtis

poem: I highly recommend getting older! There's less tendency to people-please
author: Alanis Morissette

poem: The fun thing about getting older is finding younger people to mentor
author: Mike May

poem: The good thing about getting older is that, as you become less attractive, so you have less desire to go out and conquer everyone you see
author: Julian Clary

poem: The more you are getting older, you lose a little something. Of course there is another advantage, because of your long experience you can use it
author: Haile Gebrselassie

poem: The minute you're born, you're getting older
author: Doris Roberts

poem: Part of getting older is realizing that you can integrate all these different areas of your life, rather than the adolescent mindset, which for me lasted a long time, which says, 'It's all or nothing
author: Chris Robinson

poem: One of the pluses of getting older is you set some limits
author: Nicolas Cage

poem: Getting older is fine. There is nothing you can do to stop it so you might as well stay on the bus
author: John Byrne

poem: You can't help getting older, but you can help yourself from becoming old and infirm, in mind as well as body
author: Joan Collins

poem: It's no fun getting older. I might be wearing beautiful diamond earrings, but they can't take away the pain of losing my hearing
author: Cilla Black

poem: You know you're getting older when the candles cost more than the cake
author: Bob Hope

poem: Getting older is like riding a bicycle, if you don't keep peddling, you'll fall
author: Claude D. Pepper

poem: Getting old is a fascination thing. The older you get, the older you want to get
author: Keith Richards

poem: We don't grow older, we grow riper
author: Pablo Picasso

poem: Doing all the little tricky things it takes to grow up, step by step, into an anxious and unsettling world
author: Sylvia Plath

poem: Don't try to make children grow up to be like you, or they may do it
author: Russell Baker

poem: Even though you're growing up, you should never stop having fun
author: Nina Dobrev

poem: Everyone thinks you make mistakes when you're young. But I don't think we make any fewer when we're grown u
author: Jodi Picoult

poem: Everything I was afraid of when I was growing up, I've become. I've taken on my nightmares, like the devil and the end of the world, and I've become those things
author: Marilyn Manson

poem: For, after all, you do grow up, you do outgrow your ideals, which turn to dust and ashes, which are shattered into fragments; and if you have no other life, you just have to build one up out of these fragments
author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky

poem: Growing old is mandatory. Growing up is optional
author: Chili Davis

poem: Growing up happens in a heartbeat. One day you're in diapers; the next day you're gone. But the memories of childhood stay with you for the long haul
author: The Wonder Years

poem: Growing up happens when you start having things you look back on and wish you could change
author: Cassandra Clare

poem: Growing up is hard, love. Otherwise everyone would do it
author: Kim Harrison

poem: Growing up is losing some illusions, in order to acquire others
author: Virginia Woolf

poem: Growing up is never easy. You hold on to things that were. You wonder what's to come. But that night, I think we knew it was time to let go of what had been, and look ahead to what would be. Other days. New days. Days to come. The thing is, we didn't have to hate each other for getting older. We just had to forgive ourselves... for growing up
author: The Wonder Years

poem: Growing up is never straight forward. There are moments when everything is fine, and other moments where you realize that there are certain memories that you'll never get back, and certain people that are going to change, and the hardest part is knowing that there's nothing you can do except watch them
author: Alden Nowlan

poem: Growing up is such a barbarous business, full of inconvenience and pimples
author: J.M. Barrie

poem: I am convinced that most people do not grow up...We marry and dare to have children and call that growing up. I think what we do is mostly grow old. We carry accumulation of years in our bodies, and on our faces, but generally our real selves, the children inside, are innocent and shy as magnolias
author: Maya Angelou

poem: I had a lot of growing up to do. A lot of times, I learned the hard way
author: Allen Iverson

poem: I know that in my past I was young and irresponsible - but that's what growing up is. You learn from your mistakes
author: Lindsay Lohan

poem: I think she is growing up, and so begins to dream dreams, and have hopes and fears and fidgets, without knowing why or being able to explain them
author: Louisa May Alcott

poem: I think, as you're growing up, your emotions are just as deep as they are when you're an adult. You're ability to feel lonely, longing, confused or angry are just as deep. We don't feel things more as we get older
author: Spike Jonze

poem: I would have given anything to keep her little. They outgrow us so much faster than we outgrow them
author: Jodi Picoult

poem: If growing up is the process of creating ideas and dreams about what life should be, then maturity is letting go again
author: Mary Beth Danielson

poem: If growing up means it would be beneath my dignity to climb a tree, I'll never grow up, never grow up, never grow up! Not me
author: J.M. Barrie

poem: If your gonna screw up, do it while you're young. Older you get, the harder it is to bounce back
author: Winston Groom

poem: In this day and age, some turn 18 and think they're a man or a woman and that's it, but that's just not true. You have to establish your manhood or your womanhood with actions
author: Orlando McGuire

poem: It happens to everyone as they grow up. You find out who you are and what you want, and then you realize that people you've known forever don't see things the way you do. So you keep the wonderful memories, but find yourself moving on
author: Nicholas Sparks

poem: It takes courage to grow up and become who you really are
author: E. E. Cummings

poem: al(ez_write_tag([[250,250],'wiseoldsayings_com-banner-1','ezslot_9']));“ Most of us won't see one another after graduation, and even if we do it will be different. We'll be different. We'll be adults--cured, tagged and labeled and paired and identified and placed neatly on our life path, perfectly round marbles set to roll down even, well-defined slopes
author: Lauren Oliver

poem: Most people don't grow up. Most people age. They find parking spaces, honor their credit cards, get married, have children, and call that maturity. What that is, is aging
author: Maya Angelou

poem: No matter where you are or where you grow up, you always go through the same awkward moments of being a teenager and growing up and trying to figure out who you are
author: Aimee Teegarden

poem: One of the oddest things about being grown-up was looking back at something you thought you knew and finding out the truth of it was completely different from what you had always believed
author: Patricia Briggs

poem: Part of growing up is just taking what you learn from that and moving on and not taking it to heart
author: Beverley Mitchell

poem: Part of growing up is realizing you learn to love so many people. It's about forming those relationships and finding what will last forever
author: Dylan O'Brien

poem: Part of growing up was learning not to be quite that honest - learning when it was better to lie, rather than to hurt someone with the truth
author: Jodi Picoult

poem: Some day you will be old enough to start reading fairy tales again
author: C.S. Lewis

poem: Sometimes we're so concerned about giving our children what we never had growing up, we neglect to give them what we did have growing up
author: James Dobson

poem: Sometimes you have to grow up before you appreciate how you grew up
author: Daniel Black

poem: The trick is growing up without growing old
author: Casey Stengel

poem: The turning point in the process of growing up is when you discover the core of strength within you that survives all hurt
author: Max Lerner

poem: This is growing up, having to stomp out love, this is how people turn terrible
author: Michelle Tea

poem: Too many people grow up. That's the real trouble with the world, too many people grow up. They forget. They don't remember what it's like to be 12 years old. They patronize, they treat children as inferiors. Well I won't do that
author: Walt Disney

poem: Until you're grown-up they send you to reform school. After you're grown-up they send you to the penitentiary
author: Ernest Hemingway

poem: We grow neither better nor worse as we get old, but more like ourselves
author: May Lamberton Becker

poem: We had so many dreams as children. Where do they go when we grow? Are they swallowed up by the mundane things of everyday life? Or do we lose them, leave them behind us in the dust, for new children to find and take up
author: Helen Hollick

poem: You grow up the day you have your first real laugh -- at yourself
author: Ethel Barrymore

poem: You know your children are growing up when they stop asking you where they came from and refuse to tell you where they're going
author: P. J. O'Rourke

poem: Throughout life people will make you mad, disrespect you and treat you bad. Let God deal with the things they do, cause hate in your heart will consume you too
author: Will Smith

poem: Success makes so many people hate you. I wish it wasn't that way. It would be wonderful to enjoy success without seeing envy in the eyes of those around you
author: Marilyn Monroe

poem: It is easy to hate and it is difficult to love. This is how the whole scheme of things works. All good things are difficult to achieve; and bad things are very easy to get
author: Confucius

poem: From the deepest desires often come the deadliest hate
author: Socrates

poem: Hating people is like burning down your own house to get rid of a rat
author: Henry Emerson Fosdick

poem: Hate must make a man productive. Otherwise one might as well love
author: Karl Kraus

poem: All men kill the thing they hate, too, unless, of course, it kills them first
author: James Thurber

poem: Hatred is one long wait
author: Ren Maran

poem: Hate cages all the good things about you
author: Terri Guillemets

poem: The price of hating other human beings is loving oneself less
author: Eldridge Cleaver

poem: I have decided to stick with love. Hate is too great a burden to bear
author: Martin Luther King

poem: Hate is like water in a dry gulch. The longer it runs, the deeper it digs
author: Ken Alstad

poem: We hate some persons because we do not know them; and will not know them because we hate them
author: Charles Caleb Colton

poem: Hatred bounces
author: E. E. Cummings

poem: If you hate a person, you hate something in him that is part of yourself. What isn't part of ourselves doesn't disturb us
author: Hermann Hesse

poem: You lose a lot of time, hating people
author: Marian Anderson

poem: Hate brings to men wars and fear
author: Gertrude Buckingham

poem: Hate less, live longer
author: Terri Guillemets

poem: I imagine one of the reasons people cling to their hates so stubbornly is because they sense, once hate is gone, they will be forced to deal with pain
author: James Baldwin

poem: I think that hate is a thing, a feeling, that can only exist where there is no understanding
author: Tennessee Williams

poem: No one is born hating another person because of the colour of his skin, or his background, or his religion. People must learn to hate, and if they can learn to hate, they can be taught to love, for love comes more naturally to the human heart than its opposite
author: Nelson Mandela

poem: When we don't know who to hate, we hate ourselves
author: Chuck Palahniuk

poem: That feelings of love and hate make rational judgments impossible in public affairs, as in private affairs, we can clearly enough see in others, though not so clearly in ourselves
author: Herbert Spencer

poem: Now hatred is by far the longest pleasure; Men love in haste, but they detest at leisure
author: Lord Byron

poem: Hate is like a swordfish, working through water invisibly and then you see it coming with blood along its blade, but transparency disarms it
author: Pablo Neruda

poem: Hatred makes us all ugly
author: Laurell K. Hamilton

poem: Life appears to me too short to be spent in nursing animosity or registering wrongs
author: Charlotte Bronte

poem: Hatred is a cold fire, and it gives no warmth
author: Laurell K. Hamilton

poem: Hate misleads, fear distorts and love blinds
author: Tim Lebbon

poem: Hatred unlocks no doors in heaven
author: William F. Devault

poem: Blunted unto goodness is the heart which anger never stirreth, but that which hatred swelleth, is keen to carve out evil
author: Martin Farquhar Tupper

poem: The worst enemy is one whose doctrines are founded in hate and are thus beyond debate
author: Tobsha Learner

poem: Hatred is the atmosphere of hell
author: Martin Farquhar Tupper

poem: Hatred is like fire--it makes even light rubbish deadly
author: George Elliot

poem: It is easier to hate those we love, than love those whom we have hated
author: Norman MacDonald Maxims

poem: Hate is the consequence of fear; we fear something before we hate; a child who fears noises becomes the man who hates them
author: Cyril Connolly

poem: Hatreds are the cinders of affection
author: Sir Walter Ralegh

poem: Hate is not a good counselor
author: Victoria Wolff

poem: We have just enough religion to make us hate, but not enough to make us love one another
author: Jonathan Swift

poem: You never really hate anyone as much as someone you cared about once
author: Cassandra Clare

poem: Hate destroys the very structure of the personality of the hater.... when you start hating anybody, it destroys the very center of your creative response to life and the universe; so love everybody
author: Martin Luther King

poem: Hate is a lack of imagination
author: Graham Greene

poem: Hate is a bottomless cup; I will pour and pour
author: Euripedes

poem: Others may hate you. But those who hate you don't win, unless you hate them. And then, you destroy yourself
author: Richard Nixon

poem: Dislike what deserves it, but never hate: for that is of the nature of malice; which is almost ever to persons, not things, and is one of the blackest qualities sin begets in the soul
author: Willliam Penn

poem: Hate always sells well, but for repeat trade and the long pull happiness is sounder merchandise
author: Robert A. Heinlein

poem: Most hatred is based on fear, one way or another
author: Laurell K. Hamilton

poem: Those who hate most fervently must have once loved deeply; those who want to deny the world must have once embraced what they now set on fire
author: Kurt Tucholsky

poem: Hate is always a clash between our spirit and someone else's body
author: Cesar Pavese

poem: Hatred is self-punishment
author: Hosea Ballou

poem: A few germs never hurt anyone
author: unknown

poem: A good lather is half the shave
author: William Hone (1780-1842)

poem: A man with a cough cannot conceal himself
author: African proverb Yoruba Tribe

poem: A merry heart doeth good like a medicine, but a broken spirit drieth the bones
author: Proverbs 17:22

poem: Adapt the remedy to the disease
author: Chinese Proverb

poem: After dinner rest a while; after supper walk a mile
author: T. Cogan (1584)

poem: An ounce of prevention is worth a pound of cure
author: unknown

poem: Before healing others, heal yourself
author: Gambian (on health and wellness)

poem: Better ten times ill than one time dead
author: Yiddish (on health and wellness)

poem: Eat to live, not live to eat
author: Socrates (469-399 BC)

poem: Feed a cold and starve a fever
author: C. Morley (1939)

poem: If you would live long, open your heart
author: Bulgarian (on health and wellness)

poem: One day in perfect health is much
author: Arabic (on health and wellness)

poem: Sometimes the remedy is worse than the disease
author: Francis Bacon (1561-1626)

poem: When one is hungry, everything tastes good
author: unknown

poem: When the heart is at ease, the body is healthy
author: Chinese (on health and wellness)

poem: The foundation of success in life is good health: that is the substratum fortune; it is also the basis of happiness. A person cannot accumulate a fortune very well when he is sick
author: P. T. Barnum

poem: To keep the body in good health is a duty... otherwise we shall not be able to keep our mind strong and clear
author: Buddha

poem: Calm mind brings inner strength and self-confidence, so that's very important for good health
author: Dalai Lama

poem: To enjoy the glow of good health, you must exercise
author: Gene Tunney

poem: Good health is not something we can buy. However, it can be an extremely valuable savings account
author: Anne Wilson Schaef

poem: Good health and good sense are two of life's greatest blessings
author: Publilius Syrus

poem: Happiness is nothing more than good health and a bad memory
author: Albert Schweitzer

poem: All the money in the world can't buy you back good health
author: Reba McEntire

poem: A fit, healthy body - that is the best fashion statemen
author: Jess C. Scott

poem: The trouble with always trying to preserve the health of the body is that it is so difficult to do without destroying the health of the mind
author: G.K. Chesterton

poem: There's lots of people in this world who spend so much time watching their health that they haven't the time to enjoy it
author: Josh Billings

poem: The greatest wealth is health
author: Virgil

poem: Health is a state of complete physical, mental and social well-being, and not merely the absence of disease or infirmity
author: World Health Organization

poem: Be careful about reading health books.  You may die of a misprint
author: Mark Twain

poem: If you have health, you probably will be happy, and if you have health and happiness, you have all the wealth you need, even if it is not all you want
author: Elbert Hubbard

poem: Ill-health of body or of mind, is defeat. Health alone is victory. Let all men, if they can manage it, contrive to be healthy
author: Thomas Carlyle

poem: The ingredients of health and long life, are great temperance, open air, easy labor, and little care
author: Sir Philip Sidney

poem: To insure good health: Eat lightly, breathe deeply, live moderately, cultivate cheerfulness, and maintain an interest in life
author: William Londen

poem: A man's health can be judged by which he takes two at a time - pills or stairs
author: Joan Welsh

poem: The human body has been designed to resist an infinite number of changes and attacks brought about by its environment. The secret of good health lies in successful adjustment to changing stresses on the body
author: Harry J. Johnson

poem: As I see it, every day you do one of two things: build health or produce disease in yourself
author: Adelle Davis

poem: Health is not valued till sickness comes
author: Dr. Thomas Fuller

poem: Health is not simply the absence of sickness
author: Hannah Green

poem: A wise man should consider that health is the greatest of human blessings, and learn how by his own thought to derive benefit from his illnesses
author: Hippocrates

poem: val(ez_write_tag([[336,280],'wiseoldsayings_com-box-4','ezslot_4'])); If you don't do what's best for your body, you're the one who comes up on the short end
author: Julius Erving

poem: Health is the greatest of all possessions; a pale cobbler is better than a sick king
author: Isaac Bickerstaff

poem: The higher your energy level, the more efficient your body. The more efficient your body, the better you feel and the more you will use your talent to produce outstanding results
author: Anthony Robbins

poem: A man too busy to take care of his health is like a mechanic too busy to take care of his tools
author: unknown

poem: To become a thoroughly good man is the best prescription for keeping a sound mind and a sound body

poem: Health is a state of complete physical, mental and social well-being, and not merely the absence of disease or infirmity

poem: Prevention is better than cure

poem: For the Christian, heaven is where Jesus is. We do not need to speculate on what heaven will be like. It is enough to know that we will be forever with Him

poem: To go to heaven, fully to enjoy God, is infinitely better than the most pleasant accommodations her

poem: The way to Heaven is ascending; we must be content to travel uphill, though it be hard and tiresome, and contrary to the natural bias of our flesh

poem: Earth has no sorrow that Heaven cannot heal

poem: Heaven means to be one with God

poem: My home is heaven.  I'm just traveling through this world

poem: Heaven is a wonderful place and the benefits for the believer are out of this world

poem: Heaven is a permanent residence ? a place where we unpack our bags and stay forever. ? What a glorious thought to wake up in Heaven and realize it is home

poem: We cannot even begin to imagine how wonderful heaven is

poem: Heaven has a road, but no one travels it; Hell has no gate but men will dig to get there

poem: The love of heaven makes one heavenl

poem: Heaven is a beautiful place to be, full of beautiful people having a beautiful time

poem: The more of Heaven we cherish, the less of Earth we covet

poem: Heaven offers nothing that a mercenary soul can desire

poem: I would rather go to heaven alone than go to hell in company

poem: Aim at heaven and you will get earth thrown in. Aim at earth and you get neither

poem: We are as near to heaven as we are far from self, and far from the love of a sinful world

poem: A clear conscience is more valuable than wealth

poem: A fair exchange is no robbery

poem: A friend's eye is a good mirror

poem: A loan though old is not a gift
author: Hungarian (on indebtedness)

poem: A man who never made a mistake, never made anything

poem: An apple a day keeps the doctor away

poem: Don't pretend to be something you aren't

poem: From the fullness of the heart, the mouth speaks

author: Ben Franklin (1706-1790)

author: Aesop (c.620-560 BC)

author: Ben Franklin (1706-1790)

author: unknown

author: unknown

poem: Pay what you owe and what you're worth you'll know

poem: Possession is nine tenths of the law
author: unknown

poem: The contented person can never be ruined

poem: The sting of a reproach is the truth of it
author: Ben Franklin (1706-1790)

poem: When a thief kisses you, count your teeth

poem: You can fool people some of the time, but you can't fool them all of the time

poem: A drowning man will clutch at a straw

poem: Every cloud has a silver lining

poem: Every jack has his jill; if only they can find each other

poem: Every pot will find its lid

poem: Hope for the best and prepare for the worst
author: Thomas Norton & Thomas Sackville (1536-1608)

poem: Hope is a good breakfast but a bad supper

poem: Hope springs eternal

poem: However long the night, the dawn will break

poem: Keep your eyes on the sun and you will not see the shadows

poem: Never give up hope

author: Native American (on impossibility)

poem: The darkest hours are just before dawn
author: English Proverb

poem: Where there's life, there's hope
author: Theocritus (c.270 BC)

poem: We must accept finite disappointment, but never lose infinite hope

poem: Hope is being able to see that there is light despite all of the darkness

author: Laini Taylor

author: Vaclav Havel

poem: Once you choose hope, anything's possible

author: Katherine Dunham

poem: He who conquers others is strong; He who conquers himself is mighty

poem: A woman is like a tea bag - you can't tell how strong she is until you put her in hot water

poem: In the depth of winter, I finally learned that within me there lay an invincible summer

poem: Confront the dark parts of yourself, and work to banish them with illumination and forgiveness. Your willingness to wrestle with your demons will cause your angels to sing

poem: Courage isn't having the strength to go on - it is going on when you don't have strength

poem: There is a saying in Tibetan,  Tragedy should be utilized as a source of strength.' No matter what sort of difficulties, how painful experience is, if we lose our hope, that's our real disaster

poem: Nobody can hurt me without my permission
author: Mahatma Gandhi

poem: Sleep is such a luxury, which i cant afford

poem: It is a special kind of homelessness to be evicted from your dreams

poem: Insomnia: A contagious disease often transmitted from babies to parents

poem: If you can't sleep, then get up and do something instead of lying there worrying. It's the worry that gets you, not the lack of sleep

poem: A ruffled mind makes a restless pillow

poem: Insomnia is my greatest inspiration

poem: Insomnia is an increasing problem. Ive become swayed that sleep disorders are conceivably the most unnoticed, ignored, underrated reason of health as well as performance problems in the place of work

poem: It appears that every mans insomnia is as different from his neighbours as are their daytime hopes and aspirations

poem: His insomnia was so bad, he couldn't sleep during office hours

poem: I want to sleep but my brain won't stop talking to itself
author: unknown

poem: Sometimes I sit up late with my thoughts, reluctant to fall asleep and leave my thoughts alone by themselves

poem: I hate it when my foot falls asleep during the day, because that means it's going to be up all night
author: Steven Wright

poem: Physical activity within four hours of bedtime and illness can also cause this type of insomnia

poem: If you tell the truth you don't have to remember anything
author: Mark Twain

poem: You have the right to remain silent, but you can never, repeat, never lie or shade the truth
