poem: You are already of consequence in the world if you are known as a man of strict integrity
author: Grenville Klesier

poem: Keep true, never be ashamed of doing right, decide on what you think is right and stick to it
author: George Eliot

poem: Integrity without knowledge is weak and useless, and knowledge without integrity is dangerous and dreadful
author: Samuel Johnson

poem: Men acquire a particular quality by constantly acting in a particular way
author: Aristotle

poem: Nearly all men can stand adversity, but if you want to test a man's character, give him power
author: Abraham Lincoln

poem: It takes less time to do a thing right than to explain why you did it wrong
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

poem: He is not wise to me who is wise in words only, but he who is wise in deeds
author: St. Gregory

poem: Power is actualized only when word and deed have not parted company
author: Hannah Arendt

poem: We should often feel ashamed of our best actions if the world could see all the motives which produced them
author: Francois de la Rochefoucauld

poem: Real integrity is doing the right thing, knowing that nobody's going to know whether you did it or not
author: Oprah Winfrey

poem: The true perfection of man lies not in what man has, but in what man is
author: Oscar Wilde

poem: Integrity is so perishable in the summer months of success
author: Vanessa Redgrave

poem: Like integrity, love of life was not a subject to be studied, it was a contagion to be caught. And you had to catch it from someone who had it
author: Lois McMaster Bujold

poem: Integrity is telling myself the truth. And honesty is telling the truth to other people
author: Spencer Johnson

poem: Whoever is careless with the truth in small matters cannot be trusted with important matters
author: Albert Einstein

poem: Perhaps the surest test of an individual's integrity is his refusal to do or say anything that would damage his self-respect
author: Thomas S. Monson

poem: Your reputation and integrity are everything. Follow through on what you say you're going to do. Your credibility can only be built over time, and it is built from the history of your words and actions
author: Maria Razumich-Zec

poem: Character is what you are in the dark
author: Dwight L. Moody

poem: To know what is right and not do it is the worst cowardice
author: Confucius

poem: To thine own self be true, and it must follow, as the night the day, thou canst not then be false to any man
author: William Shakespeare

poem: Truthfulness is the main element of character
author: Brian Tracy

poem: The integrity of men is to be measured by their conduct, not by their professions
author: Junius

poem: Once you get rid of integrity the rest is a piece of cake
author: Larry Hagman

poem: Character is doing the right thing when nobody's looking. There are too many people who think that the only thing that's right is to get by; and the only thing that's wrong is to get caught
author: J.C. Watts Jr.

poem: In silence man can most readily preserve his integrity
author: Meister Eckhart

poem: Integrity is not a 90 percent thing, not a 95 percent thing; either you have it or you don't
author: Peter Scotese

poem: A person is not given integrity. It results from the relentless pursuit of honesty at all times
author: unknown

poem: Nothing more completely baffles one who is full of tricks and duplicity than straight forward and simple integrity in another
author: Charles Caleb

poem: Integrity is the essence of everything successful
author: Buckminster Fuller

poem: val(ez_write_tag([[300,250],'wiseoldsayings_com-medrectangle-3','ezslot_5'])); The slow man with integrity will ultimately catch the swift one who has none
author: unknown

poem: If you believe in unlimited quality and act in all your business dealings with total integrity, the rest will take care of itself
author: Frank Perdue

poem: Integrity is what we do, what we say, and what we say we do
author: Don Galer

poem: If you don't have integrity, you have nothing. You can't buy it
author: Henry Kravis

poem: A life lived with integrity even if it lacks the trappings of fame and fortune is a shining star in whose light others may follow in the years to come
author: Denis Waitley

poem: Integrity is not a conditional word. It doesn't blow in the wind or change with the weather. It is your inner image of yourself, and if you look in there and see a man who won't cheat, then you know he never will
author: John D. MacDonald

poem: Integrity is the first step to true greatness
author: Charles Simmons

poem: A man should be upright, not be kept upright
author: Marcus Aurelius

poem: In great matters men show themselves as they wish to be seen; in small matters, as they are
author: Gamaliel Bradford

poem: Integrity has no need of rules
author: Albert Camus

poem: Integrity is not something that you should have to think about...nor consider doing...but something in the heart that is already done
author: Doug Firebaugh

poem: There is always room for those who can be relied upon to delivery the goods when they say they will
author: Napoleon Hill

poem: There is no better test of a man's integrity than his behavior when he is wrong
author: Marvin Williams

poem: People who fight fire with fire end up with only the ashes of their own integrity
author: Michael Josephson

poem: There can be no happiness if the things we believe in are different from the things we do
author: Freya Stark

poem: The only correct actions are those that demand no explanation and no apology
author: Red Auerbach

poem: Courage combined with integrity is the foundation of character
author: Brian Tracy

poem: That you may retain your self-respect, it is better to displease the people by doing what you know is right, than to temporarily please them by doing what you know is wrong
author: William Boetcker

poem: Never "for the sake of peace and quiet" deny your own experience or convictions
author: Dag Hammarskjold

poem: Jealousy is a disease, love is a healthy condition. The immature mind often mistakes one for the other, or assumes that the greater the love, the greater the jealousy - in fact, they are almost incompatible; one emotion hardly leaves room for the other
author: Robert A. Heinlein

poem: Jealousy, that dragon which slays love under the pretence of keeping it alive
author: Havelock Ellis

poem: The thermometer of success is merely the jealousy of the malcontents
author: Salvador Dal

poem: You can only be jealous of someone who has something you think you ought to have yourself
author: Margaret Atwood

poem: What sort of love is permeated by jealousy? You are jealous because you are unaware that everything you need is inside you
author: Peter Deunov

poem: A competent and self-confident person is incapable of jealousy in anything. Jealousy is invariably a symptom of neurotic insecurity
author: Robert A. Heinlein

poem: Jealousy is both reasonable and belongs to reasonable men, while envy is base and belongs to the base, for the one makes himself get good things by jealousy, while the other does not allow his neighbour to have them through envy
author: Aristotle

poem: The jealous are troublesome to others, but a torment to themselves
author: William Penn

poem: The jealous are possessed by a mad devil and a dull spirit at the same time
author: Johann Kaspar Lavater

poem: Jealousy is the tribute mediocrity pays to genius
author: Fulton J. Sheen

poem: Jealousy lives upon doubts. It becomes madness or ceases entirely as soon as we pass from doubt to certainty
author: Francois de la Rochefoucauld

poem: Love sees sharply, hatred sees even more sharp, but Jealousy sees the sharpest for it is love and hate at the same time
author: Arab Proverb

poem: To cure jealousy is to see it for what it is, a dissatisfaction with sel
author: Joan Didion

poem: To jealousy, nothing is more frightful than laughter
author: F. Sagan

poem: Jealousy is that pain which a man feels from the apprehension that he is not equally beloved by the person whom he entirely loves
author: Joseph Addison

poem: Never waste jealousy on a real man:_ it is the imaginary man that supplants us all in the long run
author: George Bernard Shaw

poem: Jealousy is simply and clearly the fear that you do not have value._ Jealousy scans for evidence to prove the point - that others will be preferred and rewarded more than you._ There is only one alternative - self-value._ If you cannot love yourself, you will not believe that you are loved._ You will always think it's a mistake or luck._ Take your eyes off others and turn the scanner within._ Find the seeds of your jealousy, clear the old voices and experiences._ Put all the energy into building your personal and emotional security._ Then you will be the one others envy, and you can remember the pain and reach out to them
author: Jennifer James

poem: Jealousy in romance is like salt in food._ A little can enhance the savor, but too much can spoil the pleasure and, under certain circumstances, can be life-threatening
author: Maya Angelou

poem: O jealousy! thou magnifier of trifles
author: Johann Christoph Friedrich von Schiller

poem: I've spent most of my life walking under that hovering cloud, jealousy, whose acid raindrops blurred my vision and burned holes in my heart. Once I learned to use the umbrella of confidence, the skies cleared up for me and the sunshine called joy became my faithful companion
author: Astrid Alauda

poem: Jealousy is the jaundice of the soul
author: John Dryden

poem: Jealousy is never satisfied with anything short of an omniscience that would detect the subtlest fold of the heart
author: George Eliot

poem: Comparison is a very foolish attitude, because each person is unique and incomparable. Once this understanding settles in you, jealousy disappears
author: Osho

poem: Jealousy would be far less torturous if we understood that love is a passion entirely unrelated to our merits
author: Paul Eldridge

poem: More men die of jealousy than of cancer
author: Joseph P. Kennedy

poem: Jealousy is not a barometer by which the depth of love can be read, it merely records the degree of the lover's insecurity
author: Margaret Mead

poem: Love may be blind but jealousy has 20-20 vision
author: Anonymous

poem: Jealousy is one of the wickedest of all the passions. It is that which has been the most fruitful mother of tragedies, murders, and wars. But reprehensible though it is, jealousy is almost rather to be pitied than blamed--its first victims are those who harbour the feeling
author: Arthur Lynch

poem: Jealousy is a kind of civil war in the soul, where judgment and imagination are at perpetual jars. This civil dissension in the mind, like that of the body politic, commits great disorders, and lays all waste. Nothing stands safe in its way; Nature, interest, religion, must yield to its fury. It violates contracts, dissolves society, breaks wedlock, betrays friends and neighbours. No body is good, and every one is either doing or designing them a mischief. It has a venom that more or less rankles wherever it bites: And as it reports fancies or facts, so it disturbs its own house as often as other folks
author: William Penn

poem: Jealousy is indeed a poor medium to secure love, but it is a secure medium to destroy one's self-respect. For jealous people, like dope-fiends, stoop to the lowest level and in the end inspire only disgust and loathing
author: Emma Goldman

poem: A rule isn't unfair if it applies to everyone
author: unknown

poem: Give good and get good
author: Estonian (on generosity)

poem: Laws catch flies but let hornets go free
author: Scottish (on justice)

poem: Little thieves are hanged but great ones escape
author: 14th Century French Proverb

poem: Quarrels never could last long, if on one side only lay the wrong
author: Ben Franklin (1706-1790)

poem: The deceitful have no friends
author: Hindi (Asian Indian) (on justice)

poem: The end doesn't justify the means
author: Ovid (c.43 BC-AD 18)

poem: Injustice anywhere is a threat to justice everywhere
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

poem: val(ez_write_tag([[300,250],'wiseoldsayings_com-medrectangle-4','ezslot_3'])); Where justice is denied, where poverty is enforced, where ignorance prevails, and where any one class is made to feel that society is an organized conspiracy to oppress, rob and degrade them, neither persons nor property will be safe
author: Frederick Douglass

poem: In matters of truth and justice, there is no difference between large and small problems, for issues concerning the treatment of people are all the same
author: Albert Einstein

poem: The dead cannot cry out for justice. It is a duty of the living to do so for them
author: Lois McMaster Bujold

poem: Social justice cannot be attained by violence. Violence kills what it intends to create
author: Pope John Paul II

poem: There may be times when we are powerless to prevent injustice, but there must never be a time when we fail to protest
author: Elie Weasel

poem: Justice will not be served until those who are unaffected are as outraged as those who are
author: Benjamin Franklin

poem: We are not to simply bandage the wounds of victims beneath the wheels of injustice, we are to drive a spoke into the wheel itself
author: Dietrich Bonhoeffer

poem: Men often mistake killing and revenge for justice. They seldom have the stomach for justice
author: Robert Jordan

poem: Justice? -- You get justice in the next world. In this one you have the law
author: William Gaddis

poem: Courage is of no value unless accompanied by justice; yet if all men became just, there would be no need for courage
author: Agesilaus the Second

poem: Justice is the constant and perpetual will to allot to every man his due
author: Domitus Ulpian

poem: Justice is a contract of expediency, entered upon to prevent men harming or being harmed
author: Epicurus

poem: Justice requires that to lawfully constituted Authority there be given that respect and obedience which is its due; that the laws which are made shall be in wise conformity with the common good; and that, as a matter of conscience all men shall render obedience to these laws
author: Pope Pius XI

poem: Justice consists not in being neutral between right and wrong, but in finding out the right and upholding it, wherever found, against the wrong
author: Theodore Roosevelt

poem: Justice is conscience, not a personal conscience but the conscience of the whole of humanity
author: Alexander Solzhenitsyn

poem: Equal justice under law is not merely a caption on the facade of the Supreme Court building, it is perhaps the most inspiring ideal of our society. It is one of the ends for which our entire legal system exists...it is fundamental that justice should be the same, in substance and availability, without regard to economic status
author: Lewis Powell, Jr.

poem: If we do not maintain justice, justice will not maintain us
author: Francis Bacon

poem: The failure to invest in civil justice is directly related to the increase in criminal disorder. The more people feel there is injustice the more it becomes part of their psyche
author: Wilhelm Joseph

poem: Throughout history, it has been the inaction of those who could have acted, the indifference of those who should have known better, the silence of the voice of justice when it mattered most, that has made it possible for evil to triumph
author: Haile Selassie

poem: Justice is the means by which established injustices are sanctioned
author: Anatole France

poem: You know, the courts may not be working any more, but as long as everyone is videotaping everyone else, justice will be done
author: Marge Simpson

poem: This thing that men call justice, this blind snake that strikes men down in the dark, mindless with fury, keep your hand back from it, pass by in silence
author: Maxwell Anderson

poem: If one really wishes to know how justice is administered in a country, one does not question the policemen, the lawyers, the judges, or the protected members of the middle class. One goes to the unprotected--those, precisely, who need the law's protection most!--and listens to their testimony
author: James Baldwin

poem: The just man is not the product of a day, but of a long brooding and a painful birth. To become a power for peace, a man must first pass through experiences which lead him to see things in their different aspects: it is necessary that he have a wide horizon, and breathe various atmospheres--in a word, from crossing, one after another, paths and points of view the most diverse, and sometimes the most contradictory, he must acquire the faculty of putting himself in the place of others and appreciating them
author: Charles Wagner

poem: The love of justice is, in most men, nothing more than the fear of suffering injustic
author: Francois de la Rochefoucauld

poem: The need for justice grows out of the conflict of human interests. That is to say, if there were no conflict of interests among mankind we should never have invented the word justice, nor conceived the idea for which it stands
author: Thomas Nixon Carver

poem: Justice is always violent to the party offending, for every man is innocent in his own eyes
author: Daniel Defoe

poem: Justice is the tolerable accommodation of the conflicting interests of society, and I don't believe there is any royal road to attain such accommodation concretely
author: Judge Learned Hand

poem: Justice is incidental to law and order
author: John Edgar Hoover

poem: Injustice is relatively easy to bear; it is justice that hurts
author: H.L. Mencken

poem: Extreme justice is often injustice
author: Jean Racine

poem: The foundation of justice is good faith
author: Cicero

poem: The whole history of the world is summed up in the fact that, when nations are strong, they are not always just, and when they wish to be just, they are no longer strong
author: Winston Churchill

poem: In the halls of justice, the only justice is in the halls
author: Lenny Bruce

poem: Justice should remove the bandage from her eyes long enough to distinguish between the vicious and the unfortunate
author: Robert G. Ingersoll

poem: Peace is not the absence of war but the presence of justice
author: Harrison Ford

poem: Justice has nothing to do with what goes on in a courtroom; Justice is what comes out of a courtroo
author: Clarence Darrow

poem: Justice in the life and conduct of the State is possible only as first it resides in the hearts and souls of the citizen
author: Plato

poem: Where there are too many policemen, there is no liberty. Where there are too many soldiers, there is no peace. Where there are too many lawyers, there is no justice
author: Lyn Yutang

poem: The administration of justice is the firmest pillar of governmen
author: George Washington

poem: Law in origin was merely a codification of the power of dominant groups, and did not aim at anything that to a modern man would appear to be justic
author: Bertrand Russell

poem: The best safeguard against fascism is to establish social justice to the maximum extent possible
author: Arnold Toynbee

poem: A sense of justice is a noble fancy
author: Esaias Tegn_r

poem: There's a natural law of karma that vindictive people, who go out of their way to hurt others, will end up broke and alone
author: Sylvester Stallone

poem: If you give a good thing to the world, then over time your karma will be good, and you'll receive good
author: Russell Simmons

poem: I believe in Karma. If the good is sown, the good is collected. When positive things are made, that returns well
author: Yannick Noah

poem: I try to live with the idea that karma is a very real thing. So I put out what I want to get back
author: Megan Fox

poem: Karma moves in two directions. If we act virtuously, the seed we plant will result in happiness. If we act non-virtuously, suffering results
author: Sakyong Mipham

poem: Still others commit all sorts of evil deeds, claiming karma doesn't exist. They erroneously maintain that since everything is empty, committing evil isn't wrong. Such persons fall into a hell of endless darkness with no hope of release. Those who are wise hold no such conception
author: Bohidharma

poem: As long as karma exists, the world changes. There will always be karma to be taken care of
author: Nina Hagen

poem: I never kill insects. If I see ants or spiders in the room, I pick them up and take them outside. Karma is everything
author: Holly Valance

poem: Contrary to popular misconception, karma has nothing to do with punishment and reward. It exists as part of our holographic universe's binary or dualistic operating system only to teach us responsibility for our creations-and all things we experience are our creations
author: Sol Luckman

poem: How people treat you is their karma; how you react is yours
author: Wayne Dyer

poem: As she has planted, so does she harvest; such is the field of karma
author: Sri Guru Granth Sahib

poem: Men are not punished for their sins, but by them
author: Elbert Hubbard

poem: Sin makes its own hell, and goodness its own heaven
author: Mary Baker Eddy

poem: People pay for what they do, and still more, for what they have allowed themselves to become. And they pay for it simply: by the lives they lead
author: Edith Wharton

poem: Realize that everything connectsto everything else
author: Leonardo DaVinci

poem: Karma comes after everyone eventually. You can't get away with screwing people over your whole life, I don't care who you are. What goes around comes around. That's how it works. Sooner or later the universe will serve you the revenge that you deserve
author: Jessica Brody

poem: If you're really a mean person you're going to come back as a fly and eat poop
author: Kurt Cobain

poem: Don't waste time on revenge. The people who hurt you will eventually face their own karma
author: Author Unknown

poem: What goes around comes back around
author: Author Unknown

poem: Do good and good will follow you
author: Author Unknown

poem: Karma bides it's time. You will always have to watch out. Karma is unforgiving and always gets payback
author: Benjamin Bayani

poem: You cannot do harm to someone because someone has done harm to you. You will pay just like they will
author: Ericka Williams

poem: Karma, simply put, is an action for an action, good or bad
author: Stephen Richards

poem: No need for revenge. Just sit back and wait. Those who hurt you will eventually screw up themselves and if you're lucky, God will let you watch
author: Author Unknown

poem: Karma has a surprising way of taking care of situations. All you have to do is to sit back and watch
author: Author Unknown

poem: You are free to choose, but you are not free from the consequence of your choice
author: Author Unknown

poem: Every action has equal and opposite reaction. This is law of the universe and spares none. Wrong done and injustice inflicted is paid back in the same coin. No one has escaped justice of the universe. It is only a matter of time
author: Anil Sinha

poem: Most times, how you treat your children is how they grow up to treat you
author: Terry Mark

poem: Whatever you give to life, it gives you back. Do not hate anybody. The hatred which comes out from you will someday come back to you. Love others. And love will comeback to you
author: Author Unknown

poem: Nobody deserves misery but sometimes it's just your turn
author: Author Unknown

poem: The ones you judge today, may be the judgments you endure tomorrow
author: Author Unknown

poem: Karma is like a boomerang, whatever you give out... will come back to you
author: Rashida Rowe

poem: For the innocent, the past may hold a reward. But for the treacherous, it's only a matter of time before the past delivers what they truly deserve
author: Kevin McCarty

poem: Karma is when you throw a banana in Mario Kart and you end up slipping on it
author: Author Unknown

poem: Nature runs a restuarant called Karma. It's a place where there is no need to place any order. You are autimatically served what you deserve
author: Author Unknown

poem: Don't envy those who make their wealth in an ungodly way. The wicked seem to prosper now and live without care but they will spend their eternity in terror and despair
author: Author Unknown

poem: Remember the unkindness, dishonesty, and deception you display toward others...dont be shocked when it comes back to bite you
author: Sarah Moore

poem: Every act done, no matter how insignificant, will eventually return to the doer with equal impact. Good will be returned with good; evil with evil
author: Nishan Panwar

poem: Karma is the universe's way of letting you know that you just thought you got away with it
author: Author Unknown

poem: Karma is not just about the troubles, but also about surmounting them
author: Rick Springfield

poem: Like gravity, karma is so basic we often don't even notice it
author: Sakyong Mipham

poem: My actions are my only true belongings.  I cannot escape the consequences of my actions.  My actions are the ground upon which I stand
author: Thich Nhat Hanh

poem: Forgive the person and their actions, never give in to hate. Let it go, set it free, and karma will take care of what is meant to be
author: Author Unknown

poem: If justice is denied, let the law of karma take the ride. Nothing in this world is done without a price
author: Author Unknown

poem: Karma has no problem getting back in touch with you when need be
author: Author Unknown

poem: When karma comes back to punch you in the face, I wanna be there just in case it needs help
author: Author Unknown

poem: I'm a true believer in karma. You get what you give wheter it's bad or good
author: Sandra Bullock

poem: Someone should have mentioned to him that karma was a venomous witch
author: Courtney Cole

poem: If karma doesn't catch up, God will surely pick up the slack
author: Anthony Liccione

poem: Revenge will never solve anything, karma will
author: Author Unknown

poem: A day of travelling will bring a basketful of learning
author: Vietnamese (on journeys)

poem: Brains are better than brawn
author: unknown

poem: Distance lends enchantment to the view
author: Thomas Campbell (1777-1844)

poem: Don't reinvent the wheel
author: unknown

poem: Doubt is the key to knowledge
author: Iranian (on education)

poem: Everyone is ignorant only on different subjects
author: Will Rogers (1879-1935)

poem: Example is the best precept
author: Aesop (c.620-560 BC)

poem: Hit the nail on the head
author: John Heywood (c.1497-1580)

poem: Human salvation lies in the hands of the creatively maladjusted
author: Martin Luther King  Jr.

poem: Instead of seeking new landscapes, develop new eyes
author: Marcel Proust (1871-1922)

poem: It is better to be born a beggar than a fool
author: Spanish Proverb

poem: It is better to be the head of a chicken than the rear of an ox
author: Japanese (on relative worth)

poem: Know thyself
author: Ancient Greek Proverb

poem: Knowledge is more than equivalent to force
author: Samuel Johnson (1709-1784)

poem: Knowledge is power
author: Francis Bacon (1561-1626)

poem: Learning is better than house and land
author: David Garrick (1716-1779)

poem: Mistakes are doorways to discovery
author: unknown

poem: Never stop learning
author: unknown

poem: People learn more on their own rather than being force fed
author: Socrates (469-399 BC)

poem: Presumption first blinds a man, then sets him a running
author: Ben Franklin (1706-1790)

poem: Put two and two together
author: unknown

poem: The shoe knows if the stocking has a hole
author: Bahamian (on knowledge and justice)

poem: What good is running when you're on the wrong road
author: German (on planning)

poem: What signifies knowing the names, if you know not the natures of things
author: Ben Franklin (1706-1790)

poem: When the pupil is ready, the teacher will come
author: Chinese Proverb

poem: When you're sad, learn something
author: Merlin

poem: Wise men learn by others' harms; fools by their own
author: Ben Franklin (1706-1790)

poem: Wit is the only wall between us and the dark
author: Mark Van Doren (1894-1972)

poem: With time even a bear can learn to dance
author: Yiddish (on education)

poem: A gentle hand may lead even an elephant by a hair
author: Iranian (on leadership)

poem: A great one must have a long heart
author: Ethiopian (on leadership)

poem: A ruler must sometimes humor as well as command
author: unknown

poem: An army of a thousand is easy to find but ah how difficult to find a general
author: Chinese Proverb>

poem: Even the largest army is nothing without a good general
author: Afghan (on leadership)

poem: Great chiefs prove their worthiness
author: Seneca Proverb

poem: He that cannot obey, cannot command
author: Ben Franklin (1706-1790)

poem: He who rules must fully humor as much as he commands
author: George Eliot (1819-1880)

poem: If the townspeople are happy, look to the chief
author: Liberian (on leadership)

poem: If you can't serve, you can't rule
author: Bulgarian (on leadership)

poem: Masterly retreat is in itself a victory
author: Norman Vincent Peale (1898-1993)

poem: One man can make a difference
author: unknown

poem: Take the bull by the horns
author: North American Saying

poem: The good will of the governed will be starved if not fed by the good deeds of the governors
author: Ben Franklin (1706-1790)

poem: The hand that rocks the cradle, rules the world
author: William Ross Wallace (1819-1881)

poem: The higher the monkey climbs, the more he shows his tail
author: John Wycliffe (c.1320-1384) alternate source:Belizean (on leadership)

poem: The master of the people is their servant
author: Yemeni (on leadership)

poem: Whatever the boss says goes
author: unknown

poem: When money speaks, truth keeps silent
author: Russian (on money)

poem: When we think we lead, we are most led
author: Henry James Byron (1834-1884)

poem: al(ez_write_tag([[336,280],'wiseoldsayings_com-box-4','ezslot_3']));“ If your actions inspire others to dream more, learn more, do more and become more, you are a leader
author: John Quincy Adams

poem: To handle yourself, use your head; to handle others, use your heart
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

poem: The greatest leader is not necessarily the one who does the greatest things. He is the one that gets the people to do the greatest things
author: Ronald Reagan

poem: Never give an order that can't be obeyed
author: General Douglas MacArthur

poem: Don't tell people how to do things, tell them what to do and let them surprise you with their results
author: George Patton

poem: Leadership is the art of getting someone else to do something you want done because he wants to do it
author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

poem: Example is not the main thing in influencing others. It is the only thing
author: Albert Schweiter

poem: You do not lead by hitting people over the head. That's assault, not leadership
author: Dwight Eisenhower

poem: Leaders must be close enough to relate to others, but far enough ahead to motivate them
author: John C. Maxwell

poem: No man will make a great leader who wants to do it all himself, or to get all the credit for doing it
author: Andrew Carnegie

poem: A man who wants to lead the orchestra must turn his back on the crowd

poem: To lead people, walk behind them

author: Louisa May Alcott

poem: Love is of all passions the strongest, for it attacks simultaneously the head, the heart and the senses
author: LaoTzu

poem: Love is to love someone for who they are, who they were, and who they will be
author: Chris Moore

poem: If a thing loves, it is infinite
author: William Blake

poem: Love is quite simply a natural high
author: Author Unknown

poem: The best and most beautiful things in this world cannot be seen or even heard, but must be felt with the heart
author: Helen Keller

poem: To love is nothing. To be loved is something. But to love and be loved, that's everything
author: T. Tolis

poem: We are most alive when we're in love
author: John Updike

poem: Love is like war: easy to begin but very hard to stop
author: H. L. Mencken

poem: Love is an untamed force. When we try to control it, it destroys us. When we try to imprison it, it enslaves us. When we try to understand it, it leaves us feeling lost and confused
author: Paulo Coelho

poem: There is only one happiness in life -- to love and to be loved
author: George Sand

poem: Where there is love there is life
author: Mahatma Gandhi

poem: Love is an act of endless forgiveness, a tender look which becomes a habit
author: Peter Ustinov

poem: Love is something eternal; the aspect may change, but not the essence
author: Vincent Van Gogh

poem: Love is like an hourglass, with the heart filling up as the brain empties
author: Jules Renard

poem: Love is the joy of the good, the wonder of the wise, the amazement of the Gods
author: Plato

poem: Love is a fire. But whether it is going to warm your hearth or burn down your house, you can never tell
author: Joan Crawford

poem: Love is the only sane and satisfactory answer to the problem of human existence
author: Erich Fromm

poem: Even when love isn't enough, somehow it is
author: Stephen King

poem: Absence sharpens love, presence strengthens it
author: Thomas Fuller

poem: Everything is clearer when you're in love
author: John Lennon

poem: Loyalty means nothing unless it has at its heart the absolute principle of self-sacrifice
author: Woodrow T. Wilson

poem: Total loyalty is possible only when fidelity is emptied of all concrete content, from which changes of mind might naturally arise
author: Hannah Arendt

poem: Loyalty is still the same, whether it win or lose the game; true as a dial to the sun, although it be not shined upon
author: Samuel Butler

poem: Loyalty means giving me your honest opinion, whether you think I'll like it or not. Disagreement, at this state, stimulates me. But once a decision is made, the debate ends. From that point on, loyalty means executing the decision as if it were your own
author: General Colin Powell

poem: If put to the pinch, an ounce of loyalty is worth a pound of cleverness
author: Elbert Hubbard

poem: Loyalty cannot be blueprinted. It cannot be produced on an assembly line. In fact, it cannot be manufactured at all, for its origin is the human heart-the center of self-respect and human dignity. It is a force which leaps into being only when conditions are exactly right for it-and it is a force very sensitive to betrayal
author: Maurice R. Franks

poem: You cannot buy loyalty; you cannot buy the devotion of hearts, minds, and souls. You have to earn these things
author: Clarence Francis

poem: Loyalty isn't grey. It's black and white. You're either loyal completely, or not loyal at all
author: Sharnay

poem: The only people I owe my loyalty to are those who never made me question theirs
author: Anonymous

poem: If loyalty is, and always has been, perceived as obsolete, why do we continue to praise it? Because loyalty is essential to the most basic things that make life livable. Without loyalty there can be no love. Without loyalty there can be no family. Without loyalty there can be no friendship. Without loyalty there can be no commitment to community or country. And without those things, there can be no society
author: Eric Felten

poem: Our modern, rootless times do seem to be a particularly inhospitable environment for loyalty. We come and go so relentlessly that our friendships can't but come and go too. What sort of loyalty is there in the age of Facebook, when friendship is a costless transaction, a business of flip reciprocity.... Friendship held together by nothing more permanent than hyperlinks is hardly the stuff of selfless fidelity
author: Eric Felten

poem: The highest spiritual quality, the noblest property of mind a man can have, is this of loyalty ... a man with no loyalty in him, with no sense of love or reverence or devotion due to something outside and above his poor daily life, with its pains and pleasures, profits and losses, is as evil a case as man can be
author: Algernon Charles Swinburne

poem: Don't let your loyalty become slavery. If they don't appreciate what you bring to the table, let them eat alone
author: Anonymous

poem: I'll take fifty percent efficiency to get one hundred percent loyalty
author: Samuel Goldwyn

poem: Loyalty is a fine quality, but in excess it fills political graveyards
author: Neil Kinnock

poem: You don't earn loyalty in a day. You earn loyalty day- by- day
author: Jeffrey Gitomer

poem: Unless you can find some sort of loyalty, you cannot find unity and peace in your active living
author: Josiah Royce

poem: Loyalty A will, a decision, a resolution of the soul
author: Pascal Mercier

poem: Loyalty to a petrified opinion never yet broke a chain or freed a human soul
author: Mark Twain

poem: Loyalty to the country always. Loyalty to the government when it deserves it
author: Mark Twain

poem: I have a loyalty that runs in my bloodstream, when I lock into someone or something, you can't get me away from it because I commit that thoroughly. That's in friendship, that's a deal, that's a commitment. Don't give me paper _ I can get the same lawyer who drew it up to break it. But if you shake my hand, that's for life.
author: Jerry Lewis

poem: Unlike the puerile loyalty to a conviction, loyalty to a friend is a virtue _ perhaps the only virtue, the last remaining one
author: Milan Kundera

poem: Loyalty to an unjust cause is a perversion of honor
author: Brian Herbert & Kevin J. Anderson

poem: Loyalty and friendship, which is to me the same, created all the wealth that I've ever thought I'd have
author: Ernie Banks

poem: Loyalty publicly results in leverage privately
author: Andy Stanley

poem: Loyal companions are an unequaled grace, stanching fear before it bleeds you numb, a reliable antidote for creeping despair
author: Dean Koontz

poem: Loyalty is a characteristic trait. Those who have it, give it free of charge
author: Ellen J. Barrier

poem: Those who don't know the value of loyalty can never appreciate the cost of betrayal
author: Anonymous

poem: Be loyal to those who are not present. In doing so, you build the trust of those who are present
author: Stephen Covey

poem: A woman's loyalty is tested when her man has nothing. A man's loyalty is tested when he has everything
author: Anonymous

poem: Loyalty means I am down with you whether you are wrong or right, but I will tell you when you are wrong and help you get it right
author: Anonymous

poem: Loyalty to the family must be merged into loyalty to the community, loyalty to the community into loyalty to the nation, and loyalty to the nation into loyalty to mankind. The citizen of the future must be a citizen of the world
author: Thomas Cochrane

poem: Confidentiality is a virtue of the loyal, as loyalty is the virtue of faithfulness
author: Cheryl Cole

poem: Within the hearts of men, loyalty and consideration are esteemed greater than success
author: Bryant H. McGill

poem: Anyone can sell product by dropping their prices, but it does not breed loyalty
author: Simon Sinek

poem: An intelligent and conscientious opposition is a part of loyalty to country
author: Bainbridge Colby

poem: Loyalty is what makes us trust, Trust is what makes us stay, Staying is what makes us love, and love is what gives us hope
author: Glenn van Dekken

poem: Loyalty is the highest virtue taught by abusers, and used as a control tool
author: Dr Bill Tollefson

poem: No more important duty can be urged upon those who are entering the great theater of life than simple loyalty to their best convictions.
author: Edwin Hubbell Chapin

poem: Fidelity purchased with money, money can destroy
author: Seneca

poem: Loyalty is something you give regardless of what you get back, and in giving loyalty, you're getting more loyalty; and out of loyalty flow other great qualities
author: Charles ''Tremendous'' Jones

poem: It is better to be faithful than famous
author: Theodore Roosevelt

poem: Loyalty ... is a realization that America was born of revolt, flourished in dissent, became great through experimentation
author: Henry S. Commager

poem: The greater the loyalty of a group toward the group, the greater is the motivation among the members to achieve the goals of the group, and the greater the probability that the group will achieve its goals
author: Rensis Likert

poem: We are all in the same boat, in a stormy sea, and we owe each other a terrible loyalty
author: G.K. Chesterton

poem: We must not confuse dissent with disloyalty. When the loyal opposition dies, I think the soul of America dies with it
author: Edward R. Murrow

poem: If a man asks me for my loyalty...I will give him my honesty. If a man asks me for my honesty...I will give him my loyalty
author: John Boyd

poem: The scholar does not consider gold and jade to be precious treasures, but loyalty and good faith
author: Confucius

poem: Be loyal and trustworthy. Do not befriend anyone who is lower than yourself in this regard
author: Confucius

poem: Where there is loyalty, weapons are of no use
author: Paulo Coelho

poem: The basic tool for the manipulation of reality is the manipulation of words. If you can control the meaning of words, you can control the people who must use the words
author: Philip K. Dick

poem: A lie told often enough becomes the truth
author: Vladimir Ilyich Lenin

poem: One must change one's tactics every ten years if one wishes to maintain one's superiority
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

poem: Any kind of manipulation with human embryos should be prohibited
author: Ian Wilmut

poem: One of the methods of manipulation is to inoculate individuals with the bourgeois appetite for personal success
author: Paulo Freire

poem: As I have said a thousand times, no manipulation can put stocks down and keep them down
author: Edwin Lefevre

poem: Everybody has the ability to be manipulative, to be hateful and deceitful
author: Neil LaBute

poem: Are you trying to manipulate me? It's working
author: Bridget Moynahan

poem: Manipulation, fueled with good intent, can be a blessing. But when used wickedly, it is the beginning of a magician's karmic calamity
author: T.F. Hodge

poem: Whoever controls the money controls you
author: Sharon Law Tucker

poem: If you want to know the outcome of a game before the game has even started, you need to control each side
author: David Icke

poem: Half of the people lie with their lips; the other half with their tears
author: Nassim Nicholas Taleb

poem: The best way to manipulate a man is to make him think he is manipulating you
author: John Smith

poem: Manipulation can give you anything in life you want, if you can afford it
author: M.F. Moonzajer

poem: Men are used as they use others
author: Bidpai

poem: The measure of a man is what he does with power
author: Greek Proverb

poem: Whosoever desires constant success must change his conduct with the times
author: Niccolo Machiavelli

poem: It's amazing how much manipulation is going on in parasites
author: Jacob Koella

poem: One man with a gun can control 100 without one
author: Vladimir Ilyich Lenin

poem: Manipulating people is what's so fun about poker. I love that you can just look into someone's eyes and lie - and it's perfectly acceptable
author: Cheryl Hines

poem: One should be able to control and manipulate experiences with an informed and intelligent mind
author: Sylvia Plath

poem: The art of pleasing is the art of deception
author: Luc De Clapiers

poem: When it comes to controlling human beings, there is no better instrument than lies. Because you see, humans live by beliefs. And beliefs can be manipulated. The power to manipulate beliefs is the only thing that counts
author: Michael Ende

poem: Foreknowledge of the future makes it possible to manipulate both enemies and supporters
author: Raymond Aron

poem: If you don't give education to people, it is easy to manipulate them
author: Pele

poem: When you know what a man wants you know who he is, and how to move him
author: George R.R. Martin

poem: It's so easy to manipulate an audience, but it's nearly always clear that you are being manipulated. I think even people that are not critically attuned are aware of cynical manipulation in film
author: John Boorman

poem: All writing is a form of manipulation, of course, but you realize that a plain sentence can actually do so much
author: Colm Toibin

poem: One of the methods of manipulation is to inoculate individuals with the bourgeois appetite for personal success
author: Paulo Freire

poem: Lying is not only a defense mechanism; it's also a coping mechanism and a survival technique
author: Monica Raymund

poem: A mother who radiates self-love and self-acceptance actually vaccinates her daughter against low self-esteem
author: Naomi Wolf

poem: A daughter is a mother's gender partner, her closest ally in the family confederacy, an extension of her self. And mothers are their daughters' role model, their biological and emotional road map, the arbiter of all their relationships
author: Victoria Secunda

poem: The more a daughter knows the details of her mother's life [ ] the stronger the daughter
author: Anita Diamant

poem: As mothers and daughters, we are connected with one another. My mother is the bones of my spine, keeping me straight and true. She is my blood, making sure it runs rich and strong. She is the beating of my heart. I cannot now imagine a life without her
author: Kristin Hannah

poem: Mothers of daughters are daughters of mothers and have remained so, in circles joined to circles, since time began
author: Signe Hammer

poem: A mother's treasure is her daughter
author: Catherine Pulsifer

poem: Mothers and daughters are closest, when daughters become mothers
author: unknown

poem: We mothers are learning to mark our mothering success by our daughters' lengthening flight
author: Letty Cottin Pogrebin

poem: A son is a son till he takes him a wife, a daughter is a daughter all of her life
author: Irish Saying

poem: The mother-daughter relationship is the most complex
author: Wynonna Judd

poem: A busy mother makes slothful daughters
author: Portuguese Proverb

poem: Of course mothers and daughters with strong personalities might see the world from very different points of view
author: Katherine Howe

poem: A daughter without her mother is a woman broken. It is a loss that turns to arthritis and settles deep into her bones
author: Kristin Hannah

poem: Mothers, look after your daughters, keep them near you, keep their confidence - that they may be true and faithful
author: Elmina S. Taylor

poem: I am not a perfect mother and I will never be. You are not a perfect daughter and you will never be. But put us together and we will be the best mother and daughter we would ever be
author: Zoraida Pesante

poem: Good daughters make good mothers
author: Abigail G. Whittlesey

poem: As is the mother, so is her daughter
author: Bible

poem: Suddenly, through birthing a daughter, a woman finds herself face to face not only with an infant, a little girl, a woman-to-be, but also with her own unresolved conflicts from the past and her hopes and dreams for the future.... As though experiencing an earthquake, mothers of daughters may find their lives shifted, their deep feelings unearthed, the balance struck in all relationships once again off kilter
author: Elizabeth Debold and Idelisse Malave

poem: A fluent tongue is the only thing a mother don't like her daughter to resemble her in
author: Richard Brinsley Sheridan

poem: What the daughter does, the mother did
author: Jewish Proverb

poem: Mothers sound so stupid when they praise their daughters to the skies
author: Colette

poem: The mother is only really the mistress of her daughter upon the condition of continually representing herself to her as a model of wisdom and type of perfection
author: Alexandre Dumas Pere

poem: Like mother, like daughter
author: Proverb

poem: Of all the haunting moments of motherhood, few rank with hearing your own words come out of your daughter's mouth
author: Victoria Secunda

poem: Because mothers and daughters can affirm and enjoy their commonalities more readily, they are more likely to see how they might ad vance their individual interests in tandem, without one having to be sacrificed for the other
author: Mary Field Belenky

poem: Unlike the mother-son relationship, a daughter's relationship with her mother is something akin to bungee diving. She can stake he r claim in the outside world in what looks like total autonomy--in some cases, even divorce her mother in a fiery exit from the family--but there is an invisible emotional cord that snaps her back. For always there is the memory of mother, whose judgments are so completely absorbed into the daughter's identity that she may wonder where Mom leaves off and she begins
author: Victoria Secunda

poem: What do girls do who haven't any mothers to help them through their trouble
author: Louisa May Alcott

poem: He that would the daughter win must with the mother first begin
author: English Proverb

poem: Mothers and daughters can stay very connected during teenage years. In the middle of your life, you can become very alone. Even though you're connected deeply to other family members, lovers, husbands, friends
author: Holly Hunter

poem: When a mother quarrels with a daughter, she has a double dose of unhappiness hers from the conflict, and empathy with her daughter's from the conflict with her. Throughout her life a mother retains this special need to maintain a good relationship with her daughter
author: Terri Apter

poem: A boy's best friend is his mother
author: Joseph Stefano

poem: A man loves his sweetheart the most, his wife the best, but his mother the longest
author: Irish Proverb

poem: al(ez_write_tag([[468,60],'wiseoldsayings_com-medrectangle-3','ezslot_7']));“ There has never been, nor will there ever be, anything quite so special as the love between the mother and a son
author: unknown

poem: There is an endearing tenderness in the love of a mother to a son that transcends all other affections of the heart
author: Washington Irving

poem: Happy is the son whose faith in his mother remains unchallenged
author: Louisa May Alcott

poem: To a mother, a son is never a fully grown man; and a son is never a fully grown man until he understands and accepts this about his mother
author: unknown

poem: A good son will never allow sorrow to befall her mother...and act as if he is an only child that cares...protects when no one dares...serves with his life in return...and most of all finds a wife that will love his mother too
author: HELEN REBIBIS RAMOS

poem: Winning isn't worthwhile unless one has something finer and nobler behind it
author: Amos A. Stagg

poem: The father is always a Republican toward his son, and his mother's always a Democrat
author: Robert Frost

poem: Mothers are inscrutable beings to their sons, always
author: A.E. Coppard

poem: Sons are the anchors of a mother's life
author: Sophocles

poem: Every mother hopes that her daughter will marry a better man than she did, and is convinced that her son will never find a wife as good as his father did
author: Martin Andersen Nexo

poem: If a man has been his mother's undisputed darling he retains throughout life the triumphant feeling, the confidence in success, which not seldom brings actual success along with it
author: Sigmund Freud

poem: It takes one woman twenty years to make a man of her son - and another woman twenty minutes to make a fool of him
author: Helen Rowland

poem: That strong mother doesn't tell her cub, Son, stay weak so the wolves can get you. She says, Toughen up, this is reality we are living in
author: Lauryn Hill

poem: al(ez_write_tag([[468,60],'wiseoldsayings_com-box-4','ezslot_1']));“ But a mother-son relationship is not a coequal one, is it? He is lonely with only you just as you are lonely with only him
author: Mary Balogh

poem: Even more than the time when she gave birth, a mother feels her greatest joy when she hears others refer to her son as a wise learned one
author: Thiruvalluvar

poem: Mother is her son's first god; she must teach him the most important lesson of all - how to love
author: T. F. Hodge

poem: Raising boys has made me a more generous woman than I really am. Undoubtedly, there are other routes to learning the wishes and dr eams of the presumably opposite sex, but I know of none more direct, or more highly motivating, than being the mother of sons
author: Mary Kay Blakely

poem: As the mother of a son, I do not accept that alienation from me is necessary for his discovery of himself. As a woman, I will not cooperate in demeaning womanly things so that he can be proud to be a man. I like to think the women in my son's future are counting on me
author: Letty Cottin Pogrebin

poem: ...to many a mother's heart has come the disappointment of a loss of power, a limitation of influence when early manhood takes the boy from the home, or when even before that time, in school, or where he touches the great world and begins to be bewildered with its controversies, trade and economics and politics make their imprint even while his lips are dewy with his mother's kiss
author: J. Ellen Foster

poem: When I was a child, my mother said to me, 'If you become a soldier, you'll be a general. If you become a monk you'll end up as the pope.' Instead I became a painter and wound up as Picasso
author: Pablo Picasso

poem: A man never sees all that his mother has been to him until it's too late to let her know that he sees it
author: W. D. Howells

poem: A wise son makes a glad father, But a foolish son is the grief of his mother... A wise son makes a father glad, But a foolish man despises his mother
author: The Proverbs of Solomon:

poem: For a mother the project of raising a boy is the most fulfilling project she can hope for. She can watch him, as a child, play the games she was not allowed to play; she can invest in him her ideas, aspirations, ambitions, and values -- or whatever she has left of them; she can watch her son, who came from her flesh and whose life was sustained by her work and devotion, embody her in the world. So while the project of raising a boy is fraught with ambivalence and leads inevitably to bitterness, it is the only project that allows a woman to be -- to be through her son, to live through her son
author: Andrea Dworkin

poem: My mother never saw the irony in calling me a son-of-a-bitch
author: Jack Nicholson

poem: All women become like their mothers. That is their tragedy. No man does. That's his
author: Oscar Wilde

poem: Let France have good mothers, and she will have good sons
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

poem: al(ez_write_tag([[250,250],'wiseoldsayings_com-banner-1','ezslot_0']));“ Mothers see the angel in us because the angel is there. If it's shown to the mother, the son has got an angel to show, hasn't he? When a son cuts somebody's throat the mother only sees it's possible for a misguided angel to act like a devil - and she's entirely right about that
author: Booth Tarkington

poem: Having a child makes you realize the importance of life - narcissism goes out the window. Heaven on earth is looking at my little boy. The minute he was born, I knew if I never did anything other than being a mom, I'd be fine
author: Jenny McCarthy

poem: A dripping June sets all in tune
author: unknown

poem: A short horse is soon curried
author: John Heywood (c. 1497-1580)

poem: Nature is the art of God
author: Latin (on nature)

poem: No man fears what he has seen grow
author: African Proverb

poem: Of all the plants that cover the earth and lie like a fringe of hair upon the body of our grandmother, try to obtain knowledge that you may be strengthened in life
author: Winnebago (Native American) (on nature)

poem: One step leads to another
author: unknown

poem: One swallow never makes a summer
author: John Heywood (c.1497-1580)

poem: The afternoon knows what the morning never expected
author: Swedish (on basic truths)

poem: The day has eyes; the night has ears
author: Scottish (on nature)

poem: The early bird gets the worm, the second mouse gets the cheese
author: unknown

poem: The earth has music for those who listen
author: unknown, thankyou to Guy Archer

poem: The sap rises in the spring
author: unknown

poem: The shoemaker's children have no shoes
author: unknown

poem: When the wind is in the east, tis neither good for man nor beast
author: unknown

poem: You can drive out nature with a pitchfork but she keeps on coming back
author: Horace (65-8 BC)

poem: Look deep into nature, and then you will understand everything better
author: Albert Einstein

poem: There is pleasure in the pathless woods, there is rapture in the lonely shore, there is society where none intrudes, by the deep sea, and music in its roar; I love not Man the less, but Nature more
author: Lord Byron

poem: Nature does not hurry, yet everything is accomplished
author: Lao Tzu

poem: Nature always wears the colors of the spirit
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

poem: In all things of nature there is something of the marvelous
author: Aristotle

poem: Adopt the pace of nature: her secret is patience
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

poem: I love to think of nature as an unlimited broadcasting station, through which God speaks to us every hour, if we will only tune in
author: George Washington Carver

poem: Climb the mountains and get their good tidings. Nature's peace will flow into you as sunshine flows into trees. The winds will blow their own freshness into you, and the storms their energy, while cares will drop off like autumn leaves. As age comes on, one source of enjoyment after another is closed, but Nature's sources never fail
author: John Muir

poem: I believe that there is a subtle magnetism in Nature, which, if we unconsciously yield to it, will direct us aright
author: Henry David Thoreau

poem: Never does nature say one thing and wisdom another
author: Juvenal

poem: I've always regarded nature as the clothing of God
author: Alan Hovhaness

poem: If you truly love nature, you will find beauty everywhere
author: Vincent Van Gogh

poem: Some of nature's most exquisite handiwork is on a miniature scale, as anyone knows who has applied a magnifying glass to a snowflake
author: Rachel Carson

poem: The beauty of the natural world lies in the details
author: Natalie Angier

poem: There is new life in the soil for every man. There is healing in the trees for tired minds and for our overburdened spirits, there is strength in the hills, if only we will lift up our eyes. Remember that nature is your great restorer
author: Calvin Coolidge

poem: All those who love Nature she loves in return, and will richly reward, not perhaps with the good things, as they are commonly called, but with the best things of this world-not with money and titles, horses and carriages, but with bright and happy thoughts, contentment and peace of mind
author: John Lubbock

poem: Man is Nature's sole mistake
author: W.S. Gilbert

poem: Munificent nature follows the methods of the divine and true, and rounds all things to her perfect law. While nations are convulsed with blood and violence, how quietly the grass grows
author: E.H. Chapin

poem: The best remedy for those who are afraid, lonely or unhappy is to go outside, somewhere where they can be quiet, alone with the heavens, nature and God. Because only then does one feel that all is as it should be and that God wishes to see people happy, amidst the simple beauty of nature
author: Anne Frank

poem: Nature is indifferent to our love, but never unfaithful
author: Edward Abbey

poem: Nature is full of wonders; every atom is a standing miracle, and endowed with such qualities, as could not be impressed on it by a power and wisdom less than infinite
author: Joseph Addison

poem: Chaos was the law of nature; Order was the dream of man
author: Henry Brooks Adams

poem: Lay aside all conceit. Learn to read the book of nature for yourself. Those who have succeeded best have followed for years some slim thread which has once in a while broadended out and disclosed some treasure worth a life-long searc
author: Jean Louis Rodolphe Agassiz

poem: Nature is the armory of genius. Cities serve it poorly, books and colleges at second hand; the eye craves the spectacle of the horizon; of mountain, ocean, river and plain, the clouds and stars; actual contact with the elements, sympathy with the seasons as they rise and roll
author: Amos Bronson Alcott

poem: Nature has been for me, for as long as I remember, a source of solace, inspiration, adventure, and delight; a home, a teacher, a companion
author: Lorraine Anderson

poem: Adapt or perish, now as ever, is nature's inexorable imperative
author: H.G. Wells

poem: You think Nature is some Disney movie? Nature is a killer.. It's feeding time out there 24 hours a day, every step that you take is a gamble with death. If it isn't getting hit with lightning today, it's an earthquake tomorrow or some deer tick carrying Lime disease. Either way, you're ending up on the wrong end of the food chain
author: Jeff Melvoin

poem: In nature there are neither rewards or punishments - there are consequences
author: Robert Green Ingersoll

poem: It's amazing how quickly nature consumes human places after we turn our backs on them. Life is a hungry thing
author: Scott Westerfeld

poem: Nature gives to every time and season some beauties of its own
author: Charles Dickens

poem: The fairest thing in nature, a flower, still has its roots in earth and manure
author: D. H. Lawrence

poem: Nature is an infinite sphere whose center is everywhere and circumference nowhere
author: Blaise Pascal

poem: We do not see nature with our eyes, but with our understandings and our hearts
author: William Hazlett

poem: Nature is not a place to visit. It is home
author: Gary Snyder

poem: Nature is pleased with simplicity. And nature is no dummy
author: Isaac Newton

poem: Spring is nature's way of saying, 'Let's party!
author: Robin Williams

poem: Nature is so powerful, so strong. Capturing its essence is not easy - your work becomes a dance with light and the weather. It takes you to a place within yourself
author: Annie Leibovitz

poem: Nature will bear the closest inspection. She invites us to lay our eye level with her smallest leaf, and take an insect view of its plain
author: Henry David Thoreau

poem: Mother Nature is always speaking. She speaks in a language understood within the peaceful mind of the sincere observer
author: Radhanath Swami

poem: Nature is an endless combination and repetition of a very few laws
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

poem: The laws of nature are written deep in the folds and faults of the earth. By encouraging men to learn those laws one can lead them further to a knowledge of the author of all laws
author: John Joseph Lynch

poem: Nature abhors a vacuum
author: Baruch Spinoza

poem: When one loses the deep intimate relationship with nature, then temples, mosques and churches become important
author: Jiddu Krishnamurti

poem: The least movement is of importance to all nature. The entire ocean is affected by a pebble
author: Blaise Pascal

poem: Nature uses human imagination to lift her work of creation to even higher levels
author: Luigi Pirandello

poem: Negativity is the enemy of creativity
author: David Lynch

poem: When someone tells me "no," it doesn't mean I can't do it, it simply means I can't do it with them
author: Karen E. Quinones Miller

poem: Seeing the glass as half empty is more positive than seeing it as half full. Through such a lens the only choice is to pour more. That is righteous pessimism
author: Criss Jami

poem: Nothing can doom man but the belief in doom, for this prevents the movement of return
author: Martin Buber

poem: Negativity is cannibalistic. The more you feed it, the bigger and stronger it grows
author: Bobby Darnell

poem: A lot of people will ignore positive words when they are down and accept negative words. Those people never get better
author: Travis J. Dahnke

poem: People who project negativity typically have low self-esteem. They feel badly about themselves, and their negativity is simply a reflection of those feelings
author: Hendrie Weisinger

poem: al(ez_write_tag([[250,250],'wiseoldsayings_com-medrectangle-4','ezslot_2']));“ Negativity is an addiction to the bleak shadow that lingers around every human form ... you can transfigure negativity by turning it toward the light of your soul
author: John O'Donohue

poem: Negativity can only feed on negativity
author: Elisabeth Kubler-Ross

poem: Sensitive souls draw in the negativity of others because they are so open
author: John Gray

poem: All negativity is an illusion created by the limited mind to protect and defend itself
author: Ambika Wauters

poem: Dwelling on the negative simply contributes to its power
author: Shirley MacLaine

poem: To expect defeat is nine-tenths of defeat itself
author: Francis Crawford

poem: The greatest griefs are those we cause ourselves
author: Sophocles

poem: Living in the past is a dull and lonely business; looking back strains the neck muscles, and causes you to bump into people not going your way
author: Ferber

poem: The worst loneliness is not to be comfortable with yourself
author: Mark Twain

poem: Forget your sadness, anger, grudges and hatred. Let them pass like smoke caught in a breeze. Do not indulge yourself in such feelings
author: Masaaki Hatsumi

poem: The heaviest thing I can carry is a grudge
author: unknown

poem: Some people grumble that roses have thorns; I am grateful that thorns have roses
author: Alphonse Karr

poem: Stop letting people who do so little for you control so much of your mind, feelings and emotions
author: Will Smith

poem: Worry deprives you of strength and makes everything much worse, than what actually is
author: Dr Anil Kr Sinha

poem: Nobody can motivate himself in a positive direction by continually using negative words
author: John C. Maxwell

poem: Fear is that little dark room where negatives are developed
author: Michael Pritchard

poem: He who has never hoped, can never despair
author: George Bernard Shaw

poem: The world is round and the place which may seem like the end may also be only the beginning
author: George Baker

poem: If you don't know the struggle, you don't know your strength
author: Mary Kay

poem: The mind acts like an enemy for those who do not control it
author: Bhagavad Gita

poem: Stop allowing other people to dilute or poison your day with their words or opinions
author: Steve Maraboli

poem: There are some people who always seem angry and continuously look for conflict. Walk away; the battle they are fighting isn't with you, it is with themselves
author: unknown

poem: Criticism does not make you smarter or better than the one you are criticizing. In fact, the stuff you are critical of in others is the same stuff you don't like about yourself
author: Iyanla Vanzant

poem: I will not let anyone walk through my mind with their dirty feet
author: Mahatma Gandhi

poem: A pessimist is a man who thinks everybody is as nasty as himself, and hates them for it
author: George Bernard Shaw

poem: A pessimist sees the difficulty in every opportunity; an optimist sees the opportunity in every difficulty
author: Winston S. Churchill

poem: The more you dwell on what you don't have, the more you get what you don't want
author: unknown

poem: Insanity: doing the same thing over and over again and expecting different results
author: Albert Einstein

poem: If you accept the expectations of others, especially negative ones, then you never will change the outcome
author: Michael Jordan

poem: The smaller the mind the greater the conceit
author: Aesop

poem: Don't believe in pessimism. If something doesn't come up the way you want, forge ahead. If you think it's going to rain, it will
author: Clint Eastwood

poem: I feel uncomfortable because I'm insecure about who I am
author: Trent Reznor

poem: Some men have thousands of reasons why they cannot do what they want to, when all they need is one reason why they can
author: Martha Graham

poem: Adopting the right attitude can convert a negative stress into a positive one
author: Dr Hans Selye

poem: However vast the darkness, we must supply our own Light
author: Stanley Kubrick

poem: Keep away from people who try to belittle your ambitions. Small people always do that, but the really great make you feel that you, too, can become great
author: Mark Twain

poem: Negative words are powerful boomerangs so be careful what you say about people and yourself
author: Mary J. Blige

poem: The cost of living is going up, and the chance of living is going down
author: Flip Wilson

poem: The mass of men lead lives of quiet desperation
author: Henry David Thoreau

poem: The chip on my shoulder's a little heavy. I have back problems now
author: Janeane Garofalo

poem: The best way of removing negativity is to laugh and be joyous
author: David Icke

poem: No one can create negativity or stress within you. Only you can do that by virtue of how you process your world
author: Wayne Dyer

poem: All negativity is caused by an accumulation of psychological time and denial of the present
author: Eckhart Tolle

poem: Without pain, there would be no suffering, without suffering we would never learn from our mistakes. To make it right, pain and suffering is the key to all windows, without it, there is no way of life
author: Angelina Jolie

poem: Your pain is the breaking of the shell that encloses your understanding
author: Khalil Gibran

poem: Pain is temporary. It may last a minute, or an hour, or a day, or a year, but eventually it will subside and something else will take its place. If I quit, however, it lasts forever
author: Lance Armstrong

poem: The marks humans leave are too often scars
author: John Green

poem: Turn your wounds into wisdom
author: Oprah Winfrey

poem: Some old wounds never truly heal, and bleed again at the slightest word
author: George R.R. Martin

poem: Wisdom is nothing more than healed pain
author: Robert Gary Lee

poem: I have found the paradox, that if you love until it hurts, there can be no more hurt, only more love
author: Mother Teresa

poem: We must all suffer from one of two pains: the pain of discipline or the pain of regret. The difference is discipline weighs ounces while regret weighs tons
author: Jim Rohn

poem: No pain, no palm; no thorns, no throne; no gall, no glory; no cross, no crown
author: William Penn

poem: Pain has its own noble joy, when it starts a strong consciousness of life, from a stagnant one
author: John Sterling

poem: Pain nourishes courage. You can't be brave if you've only had wonderful things happen to you
author: Mary Tyler Moore

poem: When you can't remember why you're hurt, that's when you're healed
author: Jane Fonda

poem: Nobody can hurt me without my permission
author: Mahatma Gandhi

poem: I have learned now that while those who speak about one's miseries usually hurt, those who keep silence hurt more
author: C. S. Lewis

poem: Pain is such an uncomfortable feeling that even a tiny amount of it is enough to ruin every enjoyment
author: Will Rogers

poem: The pain of the mind is worse than the pain of the body
author: Publilius Syrus

poem: There are no gains without pains
author: Benjamin Franklin

poem: There is no coming to consciousness without pain
author: Carl Jung

poem: Pain is inevitable. Suffering is optional
author: Buddhist proverb

poem: One of the greatest pains to human nature is the pain of a new idea
author: Walter Bagehot

poem: Out of pain and problems have come the sweetest songs, and the most gripping stories
author: Billy Graham

poem: Find a place inside where there's joy and the joy will burn out the pain
author: Joseph Campbell

poem: If you aren't in the moment, you are either looking forward to uncertainty, or back to pain and regret
author: Jim Carrey

poem: Pain is what the world inflicts upon us. Suffering is our emotional reaction when we fail to make the difficult conscious choice to choose Joy
author: Jonathan Lockwood Huie

poem: Pain is filtered in a poem so that it becomes finally, in the end, pleasure
author: Mark Strand

poem: God gave us pain to remind us we are alive, so we will learn to value the joys and beauty of the world
author: Tom Corr

poem: Much of your pain is the bitter potion by which the physician within you heals your sick self
author: Khalil Gibran

poem: We must embrace pain and burn it as fuel for our journey
author: Kenji Miyazawa

poem: Recovery begins with embracing our pain and taking the risk to share it with others. We do this by joining a group and talking about our pain
author: John Bradshaw

poem: Perfection is not attainable, but if we chase perfection we can catch excellence
author: Vince Lombardi

poem: Perfection is the child of time
author: Joseph Hall

poem: Looking for perfection is the only way to motivate yourself
author: Ronnie O'Sullivan

poem: The pursuit of perfection often impedes improvement
author: George Will

poem: Perfection itself is imperfection
author: Vladimir Horowitz

poem: If you look for perfection, you'll never be content
author: Leo Tolstoy

poem: Perfection is finally attained not when there is no longer anything to add but when there is no longer anything to take away, when a body has been stripped down to its nakedness
author: Antoine De Saint-Exupry

poem: When you aim for perfection, you discover it's a moving target
author: George Fisher

poem: The closest to perfection a person ever comes is when he fills out a job application form
author: Stanley J. Randall

poem: Always live up to your standards ? by lowering them, if necessary
author: Mignon McLaughlin

poem: It's not that perfection cannot be achieved. It's that it's so hard to stop there

poem: I beat myself up every day, without so much as a scratch

poem: To accomplish the perfect perfection, a little imperfection helps

poem: It is only imperfection that complains of what is imperfect. The more perfect we are the more gentle and quiet we become towards the defects of others

poem: Perfection is not just about control. It's also about letting go. Surprise yourself so you can surprise the audience

poem: Perfection irritates as well as it attracts, in fiction as in life

poem: Perfection is attained by slow degrees; it requires the hand of time

poem: Perfection cannot be defined or seen; it can only be found in your heart

poem: Perfection is a road, not a destination. Every time I live, I get an education
author: Burk Hudson

poem: Perfectionism is not a quest for the best. It is a pursuit of the worst in ourselves, the part that tells us that nothing we do will ever be good enough ? that we should try again

poem: To demand perfection is a sure way to be disappointed in everybody, for you will be bound to think ill of others
author: Monica Fairview

poem: Have no fear of perfection - you'll never reach it
author: Salvador Dali

poem: The condition of perfection is idleness: the aim of perfection is youth
author: Oscar Wilde

poem: Instead of waiting for perfection, run with what you do, and fix it along the way..

poem: Perfection is boring. If a face doesn't have mistakes, it's nothing
author: Kevyn Aucoin

poem: If you chase perfection, you often catch excellence
author: William Fowble

poem: Perfection doesn't exist in anyone. Striving for perfection in any part of our lives is a recipe for failure, since it can never be attained

poem: It is reasonable to have perfection in our eye that we may always advance toward it, though we know it can never be reached
author: Samuel Johnson

poem: Out of perfection nothing can be made. Every process involves breaking something up

poem: Perfection is a trifle dull. It is not the least of life's ironies that this, which we all aim at, is better not quite achieved
author: W. Somerset Maugham

poem: Perfection consists not in doing extraordinary things, but in doing ordinary things extraordinarily well
author: Angelique Arnauld

poem: Perfect is determined in shortened measures of time, not over long periods of time or lifetimes. It would be unnatural
author: Paul Acquasanta

poem: Perfect is determined in shortened measures of time, not over long periods of time or lifetimes. It would be unnatural
author: W. Somerset Maugham

poem: Perfection is terrible, it cannot have children
author: Sylvia Plath

poem: Perfection' is man's ultimate illusion. It simply doesn't exist in the universe.... If you are a perfectionist, you are guaranteed to be a loser in whatever you do
author: David D. Burns

poem: Perfection is perfectly simple; fouling things up requires true skill

poem: Perfection is worth striving for, even if it is ultimately unattainable in this life
author: Joseph B. Wirthlin

poem: So much perfection argues rottenness somewhere
author: Beatrice Potter Webb

poem: Fix your eyes on perfection and you make almost everything speed towards it
author: William Ellery Channing

poem: No one ever approaches perfection except by stealth, and unknown to themselves
author: William Hazlitt

poem: Perfection is an undiscovered jewel
author: Edward Counsel

poem: Producing perfection from imperfection is, after all, the highest of art forms

poem: A certain type of perfection can only be realized through a limitless accumulation of the imperfect
author: Haruki Murakami

poem: Perfection is immutable. But for things imperfect, change is the way to perfect them
author: Owen Feltham

poem: We adore perfection because we can't have it; it would disgust us if we had it. Perfect is inhuman, because human is imperfect
author: Fernando Pessoa

poem: The thing about perfection is it's unknowable. It's impossible. But it's always right in front of you

poem: The more perfect a thing is, the more susceptible to good and bad treatment it is
author: Dante Alighieri

poem: Perfectionism is the voice of the oppressor
