poem: The perfecting of one's self is the fundamental base of all progress and all moral development
author: Confucius

poem: The pursuit of perfection, then, is the pursuit of sweetness and light
author: Matthew Arnold

poem: Cognitive psychology tells us that the unaided human mind is vulnerable to many fallacies and illusions because of its reliance on its memory for vivid anecdotes rather than systematic statistics
author: Steven Pinker

poem: The purpose of psychology is to give us a completely different idea of the things we know best
author: Paul Valery

poem: Psychology keeps trying to vindicate human nature. History keeps undermining the effort
author: Mason Cooley

poem: The chief difficulty for those who begin the study of scientific psychology is that all men indulge in popular psychology
author: Karl Friedrich Munzinger

poem: A large part of the popularity and persuasiveness of psychology comes from its being a sublimated spiritualism: a secular, ostensibly scientific way of affirming the primacy of  spirit  over matter
author: Susan Sontag

poem: The separation of psychology from the premises of biology is purely artificial, because the human psyche lives in indissoluble union with the body
author: Carl Jung

poem: The brain is wider than the sky
author: Emily Dickinson

poem: Great spirits have often overcome violent opposition from mediocre minds
author: Albert Einstein

poem: The greatest discovery of my generation is that human beings can alter their lives by altering their attitudes of mind
author: William James

poem: The happiness of of your life depends upon the quality of your thoughts
author: Marcus Aurelius

poem: Life can show up no other way than that way in which you perceive it
author: Neale Donald Walsch

poem: Ultimately, man should not ask what the meaning of his life is, but rather must recognize that it is he who is asked. In a word, each man is questioned by life; and he can only answer to life by answering for his own life; to life he can only respond by being responsible
author: Victor Frankl

poem: But psychology is a more tricky field, in which even outstanding authorities have been known to run in circles, 'describing things which everyone knows in language which no one understands'

poem: Hence, wherever we meet with vital phenomena that present the two aspects, physical and psychical there naturally arises a question as to the relations in which these aspects stand to each other
author: Wilhelm Wundt

poem: It is easier to understand mankind in general than any individual man
author: Francois de la Rochefoucauld

poem: What you are will show in what you do
author: Thomas Edison

poem: The deepest principle in human nature is the craving to be appreciated
author: William James

poem: Introspection is always retrospection
author: Sartre

poem: Seeing ourselves as others see us would probably confirm our worst suspicions about them
author: Franklin P. Adams

poem: Perception is a clash of mind and eye, the eye believing what it sees, the mind seeing what it believes
author: Robert Brault

poem: It seems a pity that psychology has destroyed all our knowledge of human nature
author: G.K. Chesterton

poem: To the intelligent man with an interest in human nature it must often appear strange that so much of the energy of the scientific world has been spent on the study of the body and so little on the study of the mind
author: Edward Thorndike

poem: Knowing reality means constructing systems of transformations that correspond, more or less adequately, to reality
author: Jean Piaget

poem: No man's knowledge here can go beyond his experience
author: John Locke

poem: Nothing is so dangerous to the progress of the human mind than to assume that our views of science are ultimate, that there are no mysteries in nature, that our triumphs are complete and that there are no new worlds to conquer
author: Humphry Davy

poem: All truth passes through three stages. First, it is ridiculed. Second, it is violently opposed. Third, it is accepted as being self-evident
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

poem: Learn one way; react. Learn many ways; understand
author: Tadeu Dias

poem: When the mind is thinking it is talking to itself
author: Plato

poem: A large part of the popularity and persuasiveness of psychology comes from its being a sublimated spiritualism: a secular, ostensibly scientific way of affirming the primacy of ''spirit'' over matter
author: Susan Sontag

poem: Idleness is the parent of psychology
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

poem: Forget regret, or life is yours to miss
author: Jonathan Larson

poem: val(ez_write_tag([[300,250],'wiseoldsayings_com-medrectangle-3','ezslot_5'])); Make the most of your regrets; never smother your sorrow, but tend and cherish it till it comes to have a separate and integral interest. To regret deeply is to live afresh
author: Henry David Thoreau

poem: Many of us crucify ourselves between two thieves - regret for the past and fear of the future
author: Fulton Oursler

poem: Regret for the things we did can be tempered by time; it is regret for the things we did not do that is inconsolable
author: Sydney J. Harris

poem: Regret of neglected opportunity is the worst hell that a living soul can inhabit
author: Rafael Sabatini

poem: Life is too short, time is too precious, and the stakes are too high to dwell on what might have been
author: Hilary Clinton

poem: Regret is an appalling waste of energy, you can't build on it - it's only good for wallowing in
author: Katherine Mansfield

poem: Make it a rule of life never to regret and never to look back
author: Katherine Mansfield

poem: A man has cause for regret only when he sows and no one reaps
author: Charles Goodyear

poem: It's not what your are, it's what you don't become that hurts
author: Oscar Levant

poem: Maybe all one can do is hope to end up with the right regrets
author: Arthur Miller

poem: Nobody who ever gave his best regretted it
author: George Halas

poem: One doesn't recognize the really important moments in one's life until it's too late
author: Agatha Christie

poem: The bitterest tears shed over graves are for words left unsaid and deeds left undone
author: Harriet Beecher Stowe

poem: A man is not old until regrets take the place of dreams
author: John Barrymore

poem: When one door closes, another opens; but we often look so long and so regretfully upon the closed door that we do not see the one which has opened for us
author: Alexander Graham Bell

poem: Regrets are idle; yet history is one long regret. Everything might have turned out so differently
author: Charles Dudley Warner

poem: For of all sad words of tongue or pen, The saddest are these: 'It might have been
author: John Greenleaf Whittier

poem: Something you need most might be something you turn away from, something you turn away from might be something you regret, and something you regret, in the end, might cost you the one chance you ever had
author: Brian Judge

poem: Looking back, I have this to regret, that too often when I loved, I did not say so
author: David Grayson

poem: Never regret. If it's good, it's wonderful. If it's bad, it's experience
author: Victoria Holt

poem: Only in your imagination can you revise
author: Fay Wray

poem: We must all suffer one of two things: the pain of discipline or the pain of regretor disappointment
author: Jim Rohn

poem: It is human nature to want to go back and fix things or change things that weregret
author: John Gray

poem: If only. Those must be the two saddest words in the world
author: Mercedes Lackey

poem: We have to let go of all blame, all attacking, all judging, to free our inner selves to attract what we say we want
author: Joe Vitale

poem: Regret is ... an unavoidable result of any loss, for in loss we lose the tomorrow that we needed to make right our yesterday or today
author: Gerald Lawson Sittser

poem: Often regret is very false and displaced, and imagines the past to be totally other than it was
author: John O'Donohue

poem: Remorse is the poison of life
author: Charlotte Bronte

poem: In history as in human life, regret does not bring back a lost moment and a thousand years will not recover something lost in a single hour
author: Stefan Zweig

poem: We should regret our mistakes and learn from them, but never carry them forward into the future with us

poem: Nobody gets to live life backward. Look ahead, that is where your future lies
author: Ann Landers

poem: I have always found that each step we take in life is to be regretted-if we once begin to wonder how many other steps might have been possible
author: John Oliver Hobbes

poem: Let the dead Past bury its dead
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

poem: Reflect upon your present blessings, of which every man has many-not on your past misfortunes, of which all men have some
author: Charles Dickens

poem: They say you should not suffer through the past. You should be able to wear it like a loose garment, take it off and let it drop
author: Eva Jessye

poem: Regret is an odd emotion because it comes only upon reflection. Regret lacks immediacy, and so its power seldom influences events when it could do some good
author: William O'Rourke

poem: I have no regrets in my life. I think that everything happens to you for a reason. The hard times that you go through build character, making you a much stronger person
author: Rita Mero

poem: Never look back and regret, look back and smile at what you have learned
author: Michelle C. Ustaszeski

poem: Regrets only apply when we don't learn from a situation. No sense looking back, look forward with new knowledge and no regret
author: Catherine Pulsifer

poem: Consider mistakes nothing more than detours on the way to success. Learn from them, and then go on
author: Cindy Francis

poem: Regrets are the tears of choicesnot made and of good deeds left undone
author: Jonathan Lockwood Huie

poem: Regrets are idle; yet history is one long regret. Everything might have turned out so differently
author: Charles Dudley Warner

poem: When we lose one we love, our bitterest tears are called forth by the memory of hours when we loved not enough
author: Maurice Maeterlinck

poem: Every man is guilty of all the good he didn't do
author: Voltaire

poem: Spend time with those you love. One of these days you will say either, "I wish I had," or "I'm glad I did.
author: Zig Ziglar

poem: It's better to look ahead and prepare than to look back and regret
author: Jacki Joyner-Kersee

poem: Do not spend your youth, wandering, lost in your field of daydreams; you may wake up-spending the rest of your life-stranded on the path of regretful nightmares
author: Lucas Hunter

poem: Regret for wasted time is more wasted time
author: Mason Cooley

poem: If we spend our time with regrets over yesterday, and worries over what might happen tomorrow, we have no today in which to live
author: Thomas Sowell

poem: Regrets only apply when we don't learn from a situation. No sense looking back, look forward with new knowledge and no regret
author: Catherine Pulsifer

poem: I would rather regret the things that I have done than the things that I have not
author: Lucille Ball

poem: Live in the present tense, facing the duty at hand without regret for the past or worry over the future
author: William De Witt Hyde

poem: The bitterest tears shed over graves are for words left unsaid and deeds left undone
author: Harriet Beecher Stowe

poem: If only. Those must be the two saddest words in the world
author: Mercedes Lackey

poem: Some choices we live not only once but a thousand times over, remembering them for the rest of our lives
author: Richard Bach

poem: A man is not old until regrets take the place of dreams
author: John Barrymore

poem: When one door closes, another opens; but we often look so long and so regretfully upon the closed door that we do not see the one which has opened for us
author: Alexander Graham Bell

poem: Regret for time wasted can become a power for good in the time that remains, if we will only stop the waste and the idle, useless regretting
author: Arthur Brisbane

poem: Remorse is virtue's root; its fair increase are fruits of innocence and blessedness
author: William Cullen Bryant

poem: Remorse. Never yield to remorse, but at once tell yourself: remorse would simply mean adding to the first act of stupidity a second
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

poem: At the end of the day, let there be no excuses, no explanations, no regrets
author: Steve Maraboli

poem: Never regret. If it's good, it's wonderful. If it's bad, it's experience
author: Victoria Holt

poem: I regret that it takes a life to learn how to live
author: Jonathan Safran Foer

poem: We must all suffer from one of two pains: the pain of discipline or the pain of regret. The difference is discipline weighs ounces while regret weighs tons
author: Jim Rohn

poem: Many of us crucify ourselves between two thieves - regret for the past and fear of the future
author: Fulton Oursler

poem: I have no regrets in my life. I think that everything happens to you for a reason. The hard times that you go through build character, making you a much stronger person
author: Rita Mero

poem: I would much rather have regrets about not doing what people said, than regretting not doing what my heart led me to and wondering what life had been like if I'd just been myself
author: Brittany Ren_e

poem: Regret for the things we did can be tempered by time; it is regret for the things we did not do that is inconsolable
author: Sydney Smith

poem: Forget regret, or life is yours to miss
author: Jonathan Larson

poem: Regret is ... an unavoidable result of any loss, for in loss we lose the tomorrow that we needed to make right our yesterday or today
author: Gerald Lawson Sittser

poem: Often regret is very false and displaced, and imagines the past to be totally other than it was
author: John O'Donohue

poem: Remorse is the poison of life
author: Charlotte Bronte

poem: In history as in human life, regret does not bring back a lost moment and a thousand years will not recover something lost in a single hour
author: Stefan Zweig

poem: Is it really so difficult to tell a good action from a bad one? I think one usually knows right away or a moment afterward, in a horrid flash of regret
author: Mary Mccarthy

poem: The What-ifs and the should-have's will eat your brain
author: John O' Callaghan

poem: Don't let the past steal your present
author: Terri Guillemets

poem: Don't let yesterday use up too much of today
author: Will Rogers

poem: I think I don't regret a single 'excess' of my responsive youth--I only regret, in my chilled age, certain occasions and possibilities I didn't embrace
author: Henry James

poem: To feel today what one felt yesterday isn't to feel - it's to remember today what was felt yesterday, to be today's living corpse of what yesterday was lived and lost
author: Fernando Pessoa

poem: Footfalls echo in the memory Down the passage which we did not take Towards the door we never opened Into the rose-garden
author: Thomas Stearns Eliot

poem: I do not regret the things I've done, but those I did not do
author: Rory Cochrane

poem: Life is short. Break the rules, forgive quickly, kiss slowly, love truly, laugh uncontrollably, and never regret anything that made you smile
author: Audrey Hepburn

poem: Never regret anything that has happened in your life. It cannot be changed, undone, or forgotten. So take it as a lesson learned, and move on
author: unknown

poem: Never regret anything that makes you smile
author: Audrey Hepburn

poem: Always do your best. Your best is going to change from moment to moment. Under any circumstances, simply do your best and you will avoid self-judgement, self-abuse and regret
author: Miguel Angel Ruiz

poem: Regret for wasted time is more wasted time
author: Mason Cooley

poem: I see it all perfectly; there are two possible situations - one can either do this or that. My honest opinion and my friendly advice is this: do it or do not do it - you will regret both
author: Soren Kierkegaard

poem: Regret for wasted time can become a power for good in the time that remains, if we will only stop the waste and the idle, useless regretting
author: Arthur Brisbane

poem: We all make mistakes, have struggles, and even regret things in our past. But you are not your mistakes, you are not your struggles, and you are here NOW with the power to shape your day and your future
author: Steve Maraboli

poem: I have no regrets. I wouldn't have lived my life the way I did if I was going to worry about what people were going to say
author: Ingrid Bergman

poem: He who has regrets cannot look at himself in the mirror
author: Eric Cantona

poem: Regrets are the natural property of grey hairs
author: Charles Dickens

poem: Regrets and recriminations only hurt your soul
author: Armand Hammer

poem: You can have immediate regrets, but if you look at stuff and say, 'Things happen for a reason', there's a fatalistic thing about it. Something will happen that will justify it in some way
author: Martin Landau

poem: Regrets are the tears of good deeds left undon
author: Jonathan Lockwood Huie

poem: The regrets and resentments etched in a heart remain until they are cleansed away with love
author: Jonathan Lockwood Huie

poem: Be too busy to have time for regrets
author: Angela Wright

poem: Speak when you are angry--and you will make the best speech you'll ever regret
author: Laurence J. Peter

poem: You'll regret opening your mouth. You'll rarely regret keeping it shut
author: Max Lucado

poem: I guess that's just part of loving people: You have to give things up. Sometimes you even have to give them up
author: Lauren Oliver,Delirium

poem: Sometimes when you sacrifice something precious, you're not really losing it. You're just passing it on to someone else
author: Mitch Albom,The Five People You Meet in Heaven

poem: She taught me all about real sacrifice. That it should be done from love... That it should be done from necessity, not without exhausting all other options. That it should be done for people who need your strength because they don't have enough of their own
author: Veronica Roth,Allegiant

poem: Real magic can never be made by offering someone else's liver. You must tear out your own, and not expect to get it back
author: Peter S. Beagle,The Last Unicorn

poem: It's not hard to decide what you want your life to be about. What's hard, she said, is figuring out what you're willing to give up in order to do the things you really care about
author: Shauna Niequist,Bittersweet: Thoughts on Change, Grace, and Learning the Hard Way

poem: For God so loved the world that he gave his one and only Son, that whoever believes in him shall not perish, but have eternal life
author: Holy Bible: New International Version

poem: The ultimate test of man's conscience may be his willingness to sacrifice something today for future generations whose words of thanks will not be heard
author: Gaylord Nelson

poem: Nobody knows you as well as our spouse. And that means no one will be quicker to recognize a change when you deliberately start sacrificing your wants and wishes to make sure his or her needs are met.
author: Stephen Kendrick,The Love Dare

poem: Brotherhood means laying down your life for somebody, really willing to sacrifice yourself for somebody else
author: Tim Hetherington

poem: People who put themselves on the line and sacrifice their own safety for the greater good and for others, and anyone in any profession whose concern is the welfare for other people instead of the individual, are inspiring and important
author: Chris Hemsworth

poem: Some day you will find out that there is far more happiness in another's happiness than in your own
author: Honor de Balzac, Pere Goriot

poem: Doing the right thing for someone else occasionally means doing something that feels wrong to yo
author: Jodi Picoult,Handle with Care

poem: The most sublime act is to set another before you
author: William Blake

poem: Everyone knows the beautiful story of Abraham and the sacrifice of Isaac. How this noble father led his child to the slaughter; how Isaac meekly submitted; how the farce went on till the lad was bound and laid on the altar, and how God then stopped the murder, and blessed the intending murderer for his willingness to commit the crime
author: Annie Besant

poem: Sometimes_we have to step down to help somebody up, not because we failed to go up, but as a humble_sacrifice_to save a great sou
author: Terry Mark

poem: Giving yourself is the ultimate revolution
author: Bryant McGill,Voice of Reason

poem: Whenever you feel compelled to put others first at the expense of yourself, you are denying your own reality, your own identit
author: David Stafford,Codependency: How to break free and live your own life

poem: For I was sure of one thing, it wasn't always the hero who saved the world. It was the person most willing to die first
author: R.K. Ryals,Fist of the Furor

poem: As soon as sacrifice becomes a duty and necessity to mankind. I see no limit to the horizon which opens before him
author: Ernest Renan

poem: The sacrifice which causes sorrow to the doer of the sacrifice is no sacrifice. Real sacrifice lightens the mind of the doer and gives him a sense of peace and joy. The Buddha gave up the pleasures of life because they had become painful to him
author: Mahatma Gandhi

poem: One-half of knowing what you want is knowing what you must give up before you get it
author: Sidney Howard

poem: Regardless of the advertising campaigns may tell us, we can't have it all. Sacrifice is not an option, or an anachronism; it's a fact of life. We all cut off our own limbs to burn on some altar. The crucial thing is to choose an altar that's worth it and a limb you can accept losing. To go consenting to the sacrifice
author: Tana French,The Likeness

poem: Mom's eyes held yours for a moment. 'I don't like or dislike the kitchen. I cooked because I had to. I had to stay in the kitchen so you could all eat and go to school. How could you only do what you like? There are things you have to do whether you like it or not.' Mom's expression asked, What kind of question is that? And then she murmured, 'If you only do what you like, who's going to do what you don't like
author: Kyung-sook Shin,Please Look After Mom

poem: If people knew what they were missing, they would give up everything they have to achieve it
author: Belsebuub

poem: What we obtain too cheaply, we esteem too lightly; it's dearness only that gives everthing its value
author: Thomas Paine

poem: Greater love hath no man than this, that a man lay down his life for his friends
author: Bible

poem: What we do for ourselves dies with us. What we do for others and the world remains and is immortal.
author: Albert Pine

poem: al(ez_write_tag([[250,250],'wiseoldsayings_com-banner-1','ezslot_9']));“ The important thing is this: To be able, at any moment, to sacrifice what we are for what we could becom
author: Maharishi Mahesh Yogi

poem: Sacrifice is a part of life. It's supposed to be. It's not something to regret. It's something to aspire to. Little sacrifices. Big sacrifices. A mother works so her son can go to school. A daughter moves home to take care of her sick father
author: Mitch Albom,The Five People You Meet in Heaven

poem: Sometimes in life, you do things you don't want to. Sometimes you sacrifice, sometimes you compromise. Sometimes you let go and sometimes you fight. It's all about deciding what's worth losing and what's worth keepin
author: Lindy Zart,Complete

poem: Sacrifice, which is the passion of great souls, has never been the law of societies
author: Henri Frederic Amiel

poem: Sacrifice still exists everywhere, and everywhere the elect of each generation suffers for the salvation of the rest
author: Henri Frederic Amiel

poem: Life_becomes harder for us when we live for others, but it also becomes richer and happier
author: Zahid Abas

poem: The Lord requires sacrifice, meaning something above and beyond the minimum. The Master spoke of the 'second mile' and told us to go there. Why Because he wants to bless us, and he put all the blessings in the second mile
author: Hartman Rector, Jr.

poem: Occasionally_in this life, we must give up or lose the things that we want in order to gain the things we really need
author: David Kreger

poem: Self sacrifice is the real miracle out of which all the reported miracles grow
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

poem: All great things worth having require great sacrifice worth giving
author: Paullina Simons

poem: I am thankful that in the giving we receive, and what we receive is the satisfaction of knowing that whatever we give is always bigger once we've given it away
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough

poem: Where excess lies, usually someone had to give something up for the other to get it
author: A.J. Darkholme,Rise of the Morningstar

poem: A_wise man once said you can have anything in life, if you_sacrifice_everything else for it. What he meant is, nothing comes without a price. So before you go into battle you better decide how much you're willing to lose
author: Bernajoy Vaal

poem: Nothing great was ever achieved without a personal sacrifice. You have to pay the price to realize your goals
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

poem: There's something tightly woven throughout the fabric of our humanity that runs entirely opposite to the baser instinct of looking out for our own good
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough

poem: To put others in front of ourselves is to put God in front of everything
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough

poem: For you, and for any dear to you, I would do anything. I would embrace any sacrifice for you and for those dear to you. And when you see your own bright beauty springing up anew at your feet, think now and then that there is a man who would give his life, to keep a life you love beside you
author: Charles Dickens,A Tale of Two Cities

poem: In order for you to receive, someone else has to give. That's called sacrifice
author: Todd Stocker,REFINED: Turning Pain into Purpose

poem: Yet, there is a sense of some deep sort that runs entirely contrary to human nature, that in putting ourselves first, we must by necessity put others first
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough

poem: If_I let you go, it doesn't mean that I don't love you anymore. It means you are so important to me that I am willing to_sacrifice_my smiles for the sake of your happiness
author: Armee Taylo

poem: Love_is strengthened by loving the unlovable. Helping someone with no thanks in return; caring for the person who does not care for you; giving up what you want for the benefit of someone with an attitude; are the best ways to make love grow and the best way to influence those who do not love. It's what God does all the time
author: unknown

poem: Sacrifice is the most beautiful situation and solution for all social problems
author: Kartik Mehta

poem: They warn you that you're gonna have to make sacrifices, but i guess that means different things to different people, like giving up something you really want now for something you've wanted your whole life, or spending less time on yourself, so you can spend more time with someone you love. At some point you might even have to give up your own sense of safety and well being, but after a while it doesn't feel like you're giving up anything at al
author: Scrubs J.D

poem: Love lies in those unsent drafts in your mailbox. Sometimes you wonder whether things would have been different if you'd clicked 'Send'
author: Faraaz Kazi

poem: I will wait for you till the day I can forget you or till the day you realize you cannot forget m
author: Herryicm

poem: There is a distinct, awful pain that comes with loving someone more than they love you
author: Steve Maraboli

poem: Walking alone is not difficult but when we have walked a mile worth a thousand years with someone then coming back alone is what is difficult
author: Faraaz Kazi

poem: Life goes on... with or without you
author: Faraaz Kazi

poem: Some people are going to leave, but that's not the end of your story. That's the end of their part in your story
author: Faraaz Kazi

poem: Part of me aches at the thought of her being so close yet so untouchable
author: Nicholas Sparks

poem: Sometimes your eyes are not the only place the tears fall from
author: Faraaz Kazi

poem: There is no disguise which can hide love for long where it exists, or simulate it where it does not
author: La Rochefoucauld

poem: Ever has it been that love knows not its own depth until the hour of separation
author: Kahlil Gibran

poem: It is better to have loved and lost than never to have lost at all
author: Samuel Butler

poem: For all sad words of tongue and pen, the saddest are these, "It might have been.
author: John Greenleaf Whittier

poem: Some of us think holding on makes us strong; but sometimes it is letting go
author: Herman Hesse

poem: Love never dies a natural death. It dies because we don't know how to replenish its source. It dies of blindness and errors and betrayals. It dies of illness and wounds; it dies of weariness, of withering, of tarnishing
author: Anais Nin

poem: Heavy hearts, like heavy clouds in the sky, are best relieved by the letting of a little water
author: Christopher Morley

poem: The walls we build around us to keep sadness out also keeps out the joy
author: Jim Rohn

poem: Let no one who loves be unhappy even love unreturned has its rainbow
author: James Matthew Barrie

poem: Sometimes I wish I were a little kid again, skinned knees are easier to fix than broken hearts
author: unknown

poem: Sadness flies away on the wings of time
author: Jean De La Fontaine

poem: Sometimes you may feel that you are weak and therefore have given up but at times it only shows that you are strong enough to let go of things
author: unknown

poem: When love is lost, do not bow your head in sadness; instead keep your head up high and gaze into heaven for that is where your broken heart has been sent to heal
author: unknown

poem: In the arithmetic of love, one plus one equals everything, and two minus one equals nothing
author: Mignon McLaughlin

poem: Relationships are like glass. Sometimes it's better to leave them broken than try to hurt yourself putting it back together
author: unknown

poem: If we must part forever, Give me but one kind word to think upon, And please myself with, while my heart's breaking
author: Thomas Otway

poem: Love is like a puzzle. When you're in love, all the pieces fit but when your heart gets broken, it takes a while to get everything back together
author: unknown

poem: Count the garden by the flowers, never by the leaves that fall. Count your life with smiles and not the tears that roll
author: unknown

poem: Don't worry about losing. If it is right, it happens - The Main thing is not to hurry. Nothing good gets away
author: John Steinbeck, 10 November 1958

poem: You flew off with the wings of my heart and left me flightless
author: Terri Guillemets

poem: Ask me why I keep on loving you when it's clear that you don't feel the same way for me... the problem is that as much as I can't force you to love me, I can't force myself to stop loving you
author: unknown

poem: One day you'll love me as I love you. One day you'll think of me as I think of you. One day you'll cry for me as I cry for you. One day you'll want me, but I won't want you
author: unknown

poem: I wish I had the guts to walk away & forget about what we had, but I can't because I know you won't come after me & that's what hurts the most
author: unknown

poem: Since I can't be with you right now I will have to be content just dreaming about when we will be together again
author: Susan Polis Schutz

poem: There is one pain, I often feel, which you will never know. It's caused by the absence of you
author: Ashleigh Brilliant

poem: Loving can cost a lot but not loving always costs more, and those who fear to love often find that want of love is an emptiness that robs the joy from life
author: Merle Shan

poem: Let your tears come. Let them water your soul
author: Eileen Mayhew

poem: We must embrace pain and burn it as fuel for our journey
author: Kenji Miyazawa

poem: Turn your wounds into wisdom
author: Oprah Winfrey

poem: There is something beautiful about all scars of whatever nature. A scar means the hurt is over, the wound is closed and healed, done with
author: Harry Crews

poem: When one door closes another door opens; but we so often look so long and so regretfully upon the closed door, that we do not see the ones which open for us
author: Alexander Graham Bell

poem: They say follow your heart, but if your heart is in a million pieces which piece do you follow
author: unknown

poem: The soul would have no rainbow had the eyes no tears
author: John Vance Cheney

poem: I didn't ask for it to be over, but then again, I never asked for it to begin. For that is the way it is with life, as some of the most beautiful days come completely by chance. But even the most beautiful days eventually have their sunsets
author: unknown

poem: Remember me with smiles and laughs, for that's how I'll remember you. If you can only remember me with sadness and tears, then don't remember me at all
author: unknown

poem: It's sad when someone you know becomes someone you knew
author: unknown

poem: When you think your first falling in love, just then you realize your falling out of love
author: David Grayson

poem: The flame of love is now just a cold loneliness
author: Uniek Swain

poem: It happens to everyone as they grow up. You find out who you are and what you want, and then you realize that people you've known forever don't see things the way you do. So you keep the wonderful memories, but find yourself moving on
author: Nicholas Sparks

poem: Cry. Forgive. Learn. Move on. Let your tears water the seeds of your future happiness
author: Steve Maraboli

poem: Time heals griefs and quarrels, for we change and are no longer the same persons
author: Pascal

poem: They say that time heals all wounds but all it's done so far is give me more time to think about how much I miss you
author: unknown

poem: A busy, vibrant, goal-oriented woman is so much more attractive than a woman who waits around for a man to validate her existence
author: Mandy Hale

poem: Single is no longer a lack of options - but a choice. A choice to refuse to let your life be defined by your relationship status but to live every day Happily and let your Ever After work itself out
author: Mandy Hale

poem: If you can't take care of yourself, you can't take care of someone else
author: Sahithi Setikam

poem: My alone feels so good, I'll only have you if you're sweeter than my solitude
author: Warsan Shire

poem: I love being single. I can come and go as I please and stay out as late as I want to
author: Eric Dickerson

poem: I never found a companion that was so companionable as solitude
author: Henry David Thoreau

poem: Being single doesn't necessarily mean you're available. Sometimes you have to put up a sign that says, "Do Not Disturb" on your heart
author: Wiz Khalifa

poem: Single is not a status. It is a word that best describes a person who is strong enough to live and enjoy life without depending on others
author: unknown

poem: Being single doesn't mean that you know nothing about love. Sometimes being solo is wiser than being in a false relationship
author: unknown

poem: I think it's very healthy to spend time alone. You need to know how to be alone and not defined by another person
author: Oscar Wilde

poem: If we seek paradise outside ourselves, we cannot have paradise in our hearts
author: Thomas Merton

poem: Single is an opportunity to live life on your own terms and not apologize
author: Mandy Hale

poem: He sleeps fastest who sleeps alone
author: Richard Avedond

poem: He who knows others is wise. He who knows himself is enlightened
author: Lao Tzu

poem: I don't like to be labeled as lonely just because I am alone
author: Delta Burke

poem: You do not need to be loved, not at the cost of yourself. The single relationship that is truly central and crucial in a life is the relationship to the self. Of all the people you will know in a lifetime, you are the only one you will never lose
author: Jo Coudert

poem: If you really are going to be a happy single, you have to stop treating being single as the annoying time that you pass between relationships and embrace it. Rather than focusing on what you lack, focus on what you have: You
author: Natalie Lue

poem: I like being single, I'm always there when I need me
author: Art Leo

poem: I celebrate myself, and sing myself
author: Walt Whitman

poem: Freedom is nothing else but a chance to be better
author: Albert Camus

poem: If you aren't good at loving yourself, you will have a difficult time loving anyone, since you'll resent the time and energy you give another person that you aren't even giving to yourself
author: Barbara De Angelis

poem: When we cannot bear to be alone, it means we do not properly value the only companion we will have from birth to death-ourselves
author: Eda Leshan

poem: Being single entitles you to not ask someone's opinion before you do something to mess up your own room, your credit report or even your life
author: Sayali Patil

poem: I think, therefore I'm single
author: Liz Winston

poem: Some people think it's wrong, being single isn't right. But you hurt the right person you'll be wrong all your life
author: Tyga

poem: Being single is about celebrating and appreciating your own space that you're in
author: Kelly Rowland

poem: That we find a crystal or a poppy beautiful means that we are less alone, that we are more deeply inserted into existence than the course of a single life would lead us to believe
author: John Berger

poem: To go out with the setting sun on an empty beach is to truly embrace your solitude
author: Jeanne Moreau

poem: Solitude is the place of purification
author: Martin Buber

poem: Nowhere can man find a quieter or more untroubled retreat than in his own soul
author: Marcus Aurelius

poem: A sister can be seen as someone who is both ourselves and very much not ourselves - a special kind of double
author: Toni Morrison

poem: A sister is a gift to the heart, a friend to the spirit, a golden thread to the meaning of lif
author: Isadora James

poem: A sister is a little bit of childhood that can never be lost
author: Marion C. Garretty

poem: A sister is both your mirror - and your opposite
author: Elizabeth Fishel

poem: A Sister is God's way of proving He doesn't want us to walk alon
author: unknown

poem: A sister is one who reaches for your hand and touches your heart
author: unknown

poem: A sister is your family. a sister takes in pride with you. a sister is your respectability. a sister is like a bra in your closet. she is like a girl you can trust with all of your secrets. a sister is always by your side
author: Kortney Cobbley

poem: A sister smiles when one tells stories - for she knows where the decoration has been added
author: Chris Montaigne

poem: For there is no friend like a sister, in calm or stormy weather, to cheer one on the tedious way, to fetch one if one goes astray, to lift one if one totters down, to strengthen whilst one stand
author: Christina G. Rossetti

poem: Having a sister is like having a best friend you can't get rid of. You know whatever you do, they'll still be there
author: Amy Li

poem: How the hell do you sum up your sister in three minutes? She's your twin and your polar opposite. She's your constant companion and your competition. She's your best friend and the biggest bitch in the world. She's everything you wish you could be and everything you wish you weren't
author: M. Molly Backes

poem: If you don't understand how a woman could both love her sister dearly and want to wring her neck at the same time, then you were probably an only child
author: Linda Sunshine

poem: In the cookies of life, sisters are the chocolate chips
author: unknown

poem: Is solace anywhere more comforting than in the arms of a sister
author: Alice Walker

poem: More than Santa Claus, your sister knows when you've been bad and good
author: Linda Sunshine

poem: Of two sisters one is always the watcher, one the dancer
author: Louise Gluck

poem: Sister is our first friend and second mothe
author: Sunny Gupta

poem: Sister is probably the most competitive relationship within the family, but once the sisters are grown, it becomes the strongest relationship
author: Margaret Mead

poem: Sister. She is your mirror, shining back at you with a world of possibilities. She is your witness, who sees you at your worst and best, and loves you anyway. She is your partner in crime, your midnight companion, someone who knows when you are smiling, even in the dark. She is your teacher, your defense attorney, your personal press agent, even your shrink. Some days, she's the reason you wish you were an only child
author: unknown

poem: Sisters annoy, interfere, criticize. Indulge in monumental sulks, in huffs, in snide remarks. Borrow. Break. Monopolize the bathroom. Are always underfoot. But if catastrophe should strike, sisters are there. Defending you against all comers
author: Pam Brown

poem: Sisters are always drying their hair. Locked into rooms, alone, they pose at the mirror, shoulders bare, trying this way and that their hair, or fly importunate down the stair to answer the telephone
author: Phyllis McGinley

poem: Sisters are best friends, they are advisors, they are teachers, and best of all they are people with whom you can talk with about anything - someone you have a special bond wit
author: Catherine Pulsifer

poem: Sisters are different flowers from the same garde
author: unknown

poem: Sisters are for sharing laughter and wiping tears
author: unknown

poem: al(ez_write_tag([[336,280],'wiseoldsayings_com-banner-1','ezslot_9']));“ Sisters are splendid and incredible siblings who tower our life with exuberance and responsiveness at all times
author: JD Ghai

poem: Sisters don't need words. They have perfected a language of snarls and smiles and frowns and winks - expressions of shocked surprise and incredulity and disbelief. Sniffs and snorts and gasps and sighs - that can undermine any tale you're tellin
author: Pam Brown

poem: Sisters function as safety nets in a chaotic world simply by being there for each other
author: Carol Saline

poem: Sisters may share the same mother and father but appear to come from different families
author: unknown

poem: Sisters never quite forgive each other for what happened when they were five
author: Pam Brown

poem: Sisters share the scent and smells - the feel of a common childhood
author: Pam Brown

poem: Sisters touch your heart in ways no other could. Sisters share... their hopes, their fears, their love, everything they have. Real friendship springs from their special bonds
author: Carrie Bagwell

poem: Sisters, as you know, also have a unique relationship. This is the person who has known you your entire life, who should love you and stand by you no matter what, and yet it's your sister who knows exactly where to drive the knife to hurt you the most
author: Lisa See

poem: Sweet is the voice of a sister in the season of sorrow
author: Benjamin Disraeli

poem: The mildest, drowsiest sister has been known to turn tiger if her sibling is in troubl
author: Clara Ortega

poem: There is no better friend than a sister.  And there is no better sister than you
author: unknown

poem: We acquire friends and enemies,but our sisters come with the territory
author: Evelyn Loeb

poem: We are sisters. We will always be sisters.Our differences may never go away, but neither, for me, will our song
author: Elizabeth Fishel

poem: What are sisters for if not to point out the things the rest of the world is too polite to mention
author: Claire Cook

poem: What's the good of news if you haven't a sister to share it
author: Jenny DeVries

poem: When sisters stand shoulder to shoulder, who stands a chance against us
author: Pam Brown

poem: You can kid the world, but not your sister
author: Charlotte Gray

poem: You keep your past by having sisters. As you get older, they're the only ones who don't get bored if you talk about your memories
author: Deborah Moggach

poem: The snow doesn't give a soft white damn whom it touches
author: E.E. Cummings

poem: A lot of people like snow. I find it to be an unnecessary freezing of water
author: Carl Reiner

poem: Snow falling soundlessly in the middle of the night will always fill my heart with sweet clarit
author: Novala Takemoto

poem: January brings the snow, makes our feet and fingers glow
author: Sara Coleridge

poem: Silently, like thoughts that come and go, the snowflakes fall, each one a gem
author: William Hamilton Gibson

poem: The very fact of snow is such an amazement
author: Roger Ebert

poem: When snow falls, nature listens
author: Antoinette van Kleef

poem: A snow day literally and figuratively falls from the sky - unbidden - and seems like a thing of wonder
author: Susan Orlean

poem: Snow provokes responses that reach back to childhood
author: Andy Goldsworthdy

poem: There's just something beautiful about walking in snow that nobody else has walked on. It makes you believe you're special
author: Carol Rifka Brunt

poem: The snow itself is lonely or, if you prefer, self-sufficient. There is no other time when the whole world seems composed of one thing and one thing only
author: Joseph Wood Krutch

poem: Snowflakes are kisses from heaven
author: unknown

poem: Snowflakes are one of nature's most fragile things, but just look what they can do when they stick together
author: Vista M. Kelly

poem: The snow is sparkling like a million little suns
author: Lama Willa Miller

poem: I leaned out one last time and caught a snowflake on my tongue. They tasted so good, so pure and so divine, like nothing I had ever tasted from the sky
author: Shannon A. Thompson

poem: I miss the snow. I miss looking at it, walking in it, tasting it. I used to love those days when it was so cold everyone else would be tucked away inside trying to stay warm. I would be the only one out walking, so I could look across the fields and see miles of snow without a single footprint in it. It would be completely silent - no cars, no birds singing, no doors slamming. Just silence and snow
author: Damien Echols

poem: The first fall of snow is not only an event, it is a magical even
author: unknown

poem: Snowing is an attempt of God to make the dirty world look clean
author: Mehmet Murat ildan

poem: Thank goodness for the first snow. It was a reminder - no matter how old you became and how much you'd seen, things could still be new if you were willing to believe they still mattered
author: Candace Bushnell

poem: Be like snow - cold, but beautiful
author: Lana Del Rey

poem: Snowmen fall from heaven....... unassembled
author: unknown

poem: With every falling flake, a unique spark of interest falls from heaven
author: P. Miller

poem: Nature is full of genius, full of the divinity; so that not a snowflake escapes its fashioning hand
author: Henry David Thoreau

poem: The snow did not even whisper its way to earth, but seemed to salt the night with silence
author: Dean Koontz

poem: Snow makes cities innocent again, reveals the frailty of the human gesture against the void
author: Glen Duncan

poem: There's one good thing about snow, it makes your lawn look as nice as your neighbor's
author: Clyde Moore

poem: Life is like a blanket of snow.  Be careful how you step on it.  Every step will show
author: unknown

poem: A snowman is the perfect man.  He's very well rounded and comes with his own broom
author: unknown

poem: The wonder of a single snowflake outweighs the wisdom of a million meteorologists
author: unknown

poem: Softball has given me so much in life. It's taught me the kind of person I want to be, and given me a sweet sisterhood. It even led me to my husband
author: Jennie Finch

poem: (In softball) Go hard every play. You don't want to leave anything behind and regret it years down the road that you didn't give it all when you could have
author: Ashley DeBuhr

poem: We play this game (softball) with emotion and love._ Coach always says 'Emotionally, physically, mentally -- come to the field prepared.'_ Because if you don't bring that to the field, you're going to get beat
author: Laura Berg

poem: It's (softball is) a game of making great pitches at the right time, being opportunistic by getting a run at the right time and playing good defense
author: Mike Candrea

poem: The softball gods giveth and the softball gods taketh away, but that evens out over the season
author: Yvette Girouard

poem: It's not just any sport, it's not just throwing a ball, hitting and running._ I live with the cheering of my players while I'm up to bat. I live with the red stitches of the softball rubbing against my fingers when I snap my wrist and let it fly._ I live with mistakes every day in it, and I live learning them._ I live on the pitchers mound where I need complete confidence in my self._ I live with snapping my wrist to the catcher and getting the batter out, a perfect strike._ I live not only for my teammates, but for my self._ I live for fastpitch softball
author: K.M

poem: Softball: Where good girls stea
author: Anonymous

poem: (Like softball) Life will always throw you curves, just keep fouling them off, the right pitch will come and when it does be prepared to run the bases
author: Sara Ann Nielsen

poem: When I step into batter's box, the fans, the noise, the cheers, they all disappear._ For that moment, the world is just a battle between me and the pitcher._ And more than anything, I want to win
author: Mary W.

poem: It doesn't sparkle but I guard this diamond with my life
author: Anonymous

poem: This game is about the long run. LIFE is about the long run._Pick successes that can build your confidence_over time_and stay in the process. There is always light at the end of the tunnel, but you can't see the light if you fall into the trap of all the failures trying to pull you down
author: Amanda Scarborough

poem: Realize this: We aren't going to be perfect with our outcomes/results, in this game of failure we call softball. However, every time you are in a pressure situation it's a chance to prove that you're in the 'perfect' frame of mind. The 'success' and 'failure' comes from being in the right frame of mind and giving yourself a_chance to have success when the big moment comes; it doesn't always necessarily come with the outcome, despite what all eyes watching might think. Results will come once the frame of mind has been altered
author: Amanda Scarborough

poem: Take it one pitch at a time. Take it one day at at time
author: Amanda Scarborough

poem: Never let the fear of striking out keep you from playing the game
author: Anonymous

poem: Try not to get lost in comparing yourself to others. Discover your gifts and let them shine! Softball is amazing that way as a sport. Everyone on the field has a slightly different ability that makes them perfect for their position
author: Jennie Finch

poem: Sweat dries, blood clots, bones heal, suck it up princess. This is softball
author: Anonymous

poem: Softball isn't a one woman sport, there's 11 other girls who become your sisters. And don't forget that you win as a team and lose as a team
author: Anonymous

poem: I want my (softball) team to be more detached from the wins and losses and be more focused on doing the little things well. When you focus on getting the win, it can suffocate you, especially during the playoffs when the pressure gets thick
author: Sue Enquist

poem: There is a way to play this game (softball) physically, but it's the mental part that's going to separate gold from silver and silver from bronze
author: Lisa Fernandez

poem: This game (softball) is a game of inches. Sometimes they are going to go our way, and sometimes they aren't
author: Ashley Hansen

poem: That's part of fast pitch softball, being able to move runners and execute the short game. _It's a very quick game. _Sixty feet, you bobble it once, and these kids are going to be safe. You have to play quick, but you can't be in a hurry
author: John Rittman

poem: What I love about the game (softball) is that the game doesn't know who is supposed to win
author: Sue Enquist

poem: Everybody knows that pitching and defense win championships. It's all about defense. _It's that way in pretty much every sport. So if we can pitch and play defense we have a chance at a championship. _But you can also win quite a few games by hitting
author: Ehren Earleywine

poem: One pitch can be the difference between a win and a loss, an error could be the difference
author: Lisa Fernandez

poem: The values learned on the playing field - how to set goals, endure, take criticism and risks, become team players, use our beliefs, stay healthy, and deal with stress - prepare us for life
author: Donna de Verona

poem: The team with the best athletes doesn't usually win._ It's the team with the athletes who play best together
author: Lisa Fernandez

poem: One of the most awesome things about sports, particularly team sports, is that everything you need to do to be successful on the playing field carries over directly into life._ In a team sport you have to learn how to work together, to set goals, and then work toward those goals in a productive way._ You learn to be responsible and you learn how to not only depend on others, but also be independent so you can support others
author: Sheila Cornell Douty

poem: I'm not exceptionally fast or overly powerful._ But I have a good work ethic, and I make up for it by using technique and trying to be smarter
author: Dot Richardson

poem: Softball player- a girl who, once steps onto the field, is transformed from daddy's-little-girl_into a fierce, unrelenting competitor who will stop at nothing in order to win a game. Characteristically_with dirt all across her face, ratted sweaty hair, bloody knees, and dirt stained socks and uniform. She's diligent hard worker who knows the real meaning of teamwork, spirit, and fearing nothing. Contradictorily she personifies all of this while she still wears cute, color coordinated hair ribbons and sleeve straps
author: Anonymous

poem: I am now, and will always be me. But when it comes time to step out onto that field, me gets a little more dedicated, a little more serious, and nobody stands in my way
author: Caitlin Sumpter

poem: Soldiers usually win the battles and generals get the credit for them
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

poem: The soldier above all others prays for peace, for it is the soldier who must suffer and bear the deepest wounds and scars of war
author: Douglas Macarthur

poem: Soldiers, when committed to a task, can't compromise. It's unrelenting devotion to the standards of duty and courage, absolute loyalty to others, not letting the task go until it's been done
author: John Keegan

poem: With courage and character, American soldiers continue to put themselves on the line to defend our freedom, and so many have paid the ultimate sacrifice
author: Dan Lipinski

poem: Soldiers are not policemen, and it's very unfair, even for those soldiers who have some police training, to burden them with police duties. It's not what they're trained for, or equipped for
author: P. J. O'Rourke

poem: One doesn't become a soldier in a week - it takes training, study and discipline.There is no question that the finest Army in the world is found in the United States
author: Daniel Inouye

poem: Soldiers are citizens of death's grey land, drawing no dividend from time's tomorrows
author: Siegfried Sassoon

poem: The courage of a soldier is heightened by his knowledge of his profession
author: Publius Flavius Vegetius Renatus

poem: To be a soldier one needs that special gene, that extra something, that enables a person to jump into one on one combat, something, after all, that is unimaginable to most of us, as we are simply not brave enough
author: Rupert Everett

poem: Every soldier thinks something of the moral aspects of what he is doing. But all war is immoral and if you let that bother you, you're not a good soldier
author: Curtis LeMay

poem: A soldier will fight long and hard for a bit of colored ribbon
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

poem: Old soldiers never die; they just fade away
author: Douglas Macarthur

poem: Soldiers willingly, sometimes foolishly, risk their own lives to keep their comrades out of enemy hands
author: Alex Berenson

poem: Everyone knows what can happen to soldiers who are in front line units
author: Richard Engel

poem: All soldiers who serve their country and put their lives at risk need to know that if something happens to them, their families will be well taken care of. That's the bond we have with our military men and women and their families
author: Jeff Sessions

poem: A handful of soldiers is always better than a mouthful of arguments
author: Georg C. Lichtenberg

poem: Any soldier worth his salt should be antiwar. And still there are things worth fighting for
author: Norman Schwarzkopf

poem: That soldiers do terrible things during wartime should not surprise us
author: Nick Flynn

poem: You cannot expect soldiers to change people's minds. That has to be done in other ways
author: Mike Jackson

poem: Every soldier should learn survival on land, sea, and in the air
author: Louis Zamperini

poem: Our soldiers and their families are benefiting. They deserve good, quality housing and they need it
author: Jim Walsh

poem: I think soldiers are not just one homogenous group, just like Americans aren't. They all have different feelings about the war
author: Emily Robison

poem: Being a soldier, fighting for this country, is neither Republican nor Democrat
author: Max Cleland

poem: The first virtue in a soldier is endurance of fatigue; courage is only the second virtue
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

poem: A professional soldier understands that war means killing people, war means maiming people, war means families left without fathers and mothers
author: Norman Schwarzkopf

poem: There's something about an American soldier you can't explain. They're so grateful for anything, even a film actress coming to see them
author: Marlene Dietrich

poem: The courage of a soldier is found to be the cheapest and most common quality of human nature
author: Edward Gibbon

poem: Soldiers are men...most apt for all manner of services and best able to support and endure the infinite toils and continual hazards of war
author: Henry Knyvett

poem: A soldier is he whose blood makes the glory of the general
author: Henry G. Bohn

poem: Soldiers have many faults, but they have one redeeming merit; they are never worshippers of force. Soldiers more than any other men are taught severely and systematically that might is not right
author: G. K. Chesterton

poem: Ten soldiers wisely led will beat a hundred without a head
author: Euripides

poem: If our soldiers are not overburdened with money, it is not because they have a distaste for riches; if their lives are not unduly long, it is not because they are disinclined to longevity
author: Sun Tzu

poem: Good soldiers never pass up a chance to eat or sleep. They never know how much they'll be called on to do before the next chance
author: Lois McMaster Bujold

poem: Austrian soldiers are like horses: brave but easily frightened
author: Franz Grillparzer

poem: The most vital quality a soldier can possess is self-confidence, utter, complete and bumptious
author: George Patton

poem: You can always tell an old soldier by the inside of his holsters and cartridge boxes. The young ones carry pistols and cartridges: the old ones, grub
author: George Bernard Shaw

poem: When goods do not cross borders, soldiers will
author: Frederic Bastiat

poem: If my soldiers were to begin to think, not one of them would remain in the army
author: Frederick The Great

poem: Our soldiers have nobly fought to protect freedom since our country's birth, and have fought to protect those that could not protect themselves, even in foreign lands when called upon
author: John Linder

poem: I mean the only thing us dead soldiers got in common is that none of us was good enough or lucky enough to survive the fight. We're a host of failures
author: Steven Erikson

poem: I believe German soldiers are good and decent, and if they did anything wrong it was because of military necessity
author: Wilhelm Keitel

poem: The soldier's heart, the soldier's spirit, the soldier's soul, are everything. Unless the soldier's soul sustains him he cannot be relied on and will fail himself and his commander and his country in the end
author: George Marshall

poem: Although a soldier by profession, I have never felt any sort of fondness for war, and I have never advocated it, except as a means of peace
author: Ulysses S. Grant

poem: Soldiers are dreamers; when the guns begin they think of firelit homes, clean beds, and wives
author: Siegfried Sassoon

poem: al(ez_write_tag([[336,280],'wiseoldsayings_com-box-4','ezslot_3']));“ I am a Soldier, I fight where I am told, and I win where I fight
author: General George S. Patton

poem: The soldier's main enemy is not the opposing soldier, but his own commander
author: Ramman Kenoun

poem: Self-denial and self-discipline, however, will be recognized as the outstanding qualities of a good soldier
author: William Lyon Mackenzie King

poem: To the soldier, luck is merely another word for skill
author: Patrick MacGill

poem: Do you know what a soldier is, young man? He's the chap who makes it possible for civilised folk to despise war
author: Allan Massie

poem: Every soldier must know, before he goes into battle, how the little battle he is to fight fits into the larger picture, and how the success of his fighting will influence the battle as a whole
author: Bernard Law Montgomery

poem: It isn't always a change of scenery needed to make life better. Sometimes it simply requires opening your eyes
author: Richelle E. Goodrich

poem: That last page turned is a perfect excuse to write a whole new book
author: Toni Sorenson

poem: Be willing to be a beginner every single morning
author: Meister Eckhart

poem: There are some things one can only achieve by a deliberate leap in the opposite direction
author: Franz Kafka

poem: Don't worry about being worried. You're heading out on an adventure and you can always change your mind along the way and try something else
author: Tracy Kidder

poem: Take the first step in faith. You don't have to see the whole staircase, just take the first step
author: Martin Luther King

poem: We must be willing to get rid of the life we've planned, so as to have the life that is waiting for us. The old skin has to be shed before the new one can come
author: Joseph Campbell

poem: If I must start somewhere, right here and now is the best place imaginable
author: Richelle E. Goodrich

poem: If God closes a door AND a window, consider the fact that it might be time to build a whole new house
author: Mandy Hale

poem: A journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step
author: Lao Tzu

poem: Recreate your life, always, always. Remove the stones, plant rose bushes and make sweets.Begin again
author: Cora Coralina

poem: Arriving at one goal is the starting point to another
author: John Dewey

poem: You are never too old to set another goal or to dream a new dream
author: C. S. Lewis

poem: Learn from yesterday, live for today, hope for tomorrow
author: Albert Einstein

poem: For last year's words belong to last year's language And next year's words await another voice. And to make an end is to make a beginning
author: T.S. Eliot

poem: Celebrate endings, for they precede new beginnings
author: Jonathan Lockwood Huie

poem: New beginnings are often disguised as painful endings
author: Lao Tzu

poem: Oh, my friend, it's not what they take away from you that counts. It's what you do with what you have left
author: Hubert Humphrey

poem: Although no one can go back and make a brand new start, anyone can start from now and make a brand new ending
author: Carl Bard

poem: Never forget, Today, you have 100% of your life left
author: Tom Hopkins

poem: The beginning is always today
author: Mary Shelley

poem: Start by doing what's necessary: then do what's possible: and suddenly you're doing the impossible
author: St Francis Of Assisi

poem: If you don't like the road you're walking, start paving another one
author: Dolly Parton

poem: I have always been delighted at the prospect of a new day, a fresh try, one more start, with perhaps a bit of magic waiting somewhere behind the morning
author: J. B. Priestly

poem: The secret to living the life of your dreams is to start living the life of your dreams today, in every little way you possibly can
author: Mike Dooley

poem: You raze the old to raise the new
author: Justina Chen Headley

poem: Rather than turning the page, it's much easier to just throw the book away
author: Anthony Liccione

poem: Do not wait until the conditions are perfect to begin. Beginning makes the conditions perfect
author: Alan Cohen

poem: The beginning is the most important part of the work
author: Plato

poem: Do what you can, with what you have, where you are
author: Theodore Roosevelt

poem: If all you can do is crawl, start crawling
author: Rumi

poem: A Sunrise is God's way of saying, "Let's start again
author: Todd Stocker

poem: It's humbling to start fresh. It takes a lot of courage. But it can be reinvigorating. You just have to put your ego on a shelf & tell it to be quiet
author: Jennifer Ritchie Payette

poem: Sometimes, all you have to do is forget what you feel and remember what you deserve
author: unknown

poem: Every day is a new beginning. Treat it that way. Stay away from what might have been, and look at what can be
author: Marsha Petrie Sue

poem: The secret to change is to focus all of your energy, not on fighting the old, but on building the new
author: Socrates

poem: Every new beginning comes from some other beginnings end
author: Seneca

poem: You don't have to be great to start, but you have to start to be great
author: Joe Sabah

poem: Starting all over again is not that bad because when you restart, you get another chance to make things right
author: Ryan Ferreras

poem: The first step towards getting somewhere is to decide you're not going to stay where you are
author: John Pierpont Morgan

poem: It's never too late - never too late to start over, never too late to be happy
author: Jane Fonda

poem: Begin your life today, and again tomorrow
author: Jonathan Lockwood Huie

poem: To change ones life: Start immediately. Do it flamboyantly
author: William James

poem: Whatever you can do, or dream you can, Begin it. Boldness has genius, power and magic in it, Begin it now
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

poem: The distance is nothing; it's only the first step that is difficult
author: Marquise Du Deffand

poem: The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing
author: Walt Disney

poem: Starting over can be challenging, but also it can be a great opportunity to do things differently
author: Catherine Pulsifer

poem: Making the beginning is one third of the work
author: Irish Proverb

poem: You leave old habits behind by starting out with the thought, 'I release the need for this in my life'
author: Wayne Dyer

poem: It is no disgrace to start all over. It is usually an opportunity
author: George Matthew Adams

poem: Optimism is a happiness magnet. If you stay positive, good things and good people will be drawn to you
author: Mary Lou Retton

poem: The most important thing is to stay positive
author: Saku Koivu

poem: It makes a big difference in your life when you stay positive
author: Ellen DeGeneres

poem: STAYING POSITIVE does not mean that things will turn out okay. Rather it is knowing that YOU will be okay no matter how things turn out
author: unknown

poem: Stay positive, all other choices are pointless punishments to your psyche
author: Joe Peterson

poem: If you are positive, you'll see opportunities instead of obstacles
author: Widad Akrawi

poem: Always turn a negative situation into a positive situation
author: Michael Jordan

poem: Positive anything is better than negative nothing
author: Elbert Hubbard

poem: Positive thinking will let you do everything better than negative thinking will
author: Zig Ziglar

poem: No matter what you're going through, there's a light at the end of the tunnel and it may seem hard to get to it but you can do it and just keep working towards it and you'll find the positive side of things
author: Demi Lovato

poem: People deal too much with the negative, with what is wrong. Why not try and see positive things, to just touch those things and make them bloom
author: Nhat Hanh

poem: A lot of times people look at the negative side of what they feel they can't do. I always look on the positive side of what I can do
author: Chuck Norris

poem: Keep your thoughts positive, because your thoughts become your words. Keep your words positive, because your words become your behavior. Keep your behavior positive, because your behavior become your habits. Keep your habits positive, because your habit
author: Mahatma Gandhi

poem: You cannot change reality, but you can control the manner in which you look at things. Your attitude is under your own control. Weed out the negative and focus on the positive
author: Helen Steiner Rice

poem: When it rains, it pours? but soon, the sun shines again. Stay positive. Better days are on their way
author: unknown

poem: The positive thinker sees the invisible, feels the intangible, and achieves the impossible
author: Winston Churchill

poem: Stay positive in every situation and everything you do, never stop trying, have faith don't stop due to failure
author: Anurag Prakash Ray

poem: Dwell on the beauty of life. Watch the stars, and see yourself running with them
author: Marcus Aurelius

poem: Positive thinking is empowering, positive action is achieving
author: Dr T.P.Chia.

poem: If you absolutely can't stay positive, don't go negative, just cruise neutral for a while until you can get back up
author: Terri Guillemets

poem: An attitude of positive expectation is the mark of the superior personality
author: Brian Tracy

poem: Keep your face to the sunshine and you cannot see a shadow
author: Helen Keller

poem: If you have a positive attitude and constantly strive to give your best effort, eventually you will overcome your immediate problems and find you are ready for greater challenges
author: Pat Riley

poem: Surround yourself with positive people and situations, and avoid negativity
author: Doreen Virtue

poem: Wherever you go, no matter what the weather, always bring your own sunshine
author: Anthony J. D'Angelo

poem: Believe you can and you're halfway there
author: Theodore Roosevelt

poem: The pessimist sees difficulty in every opportunity. The optimist sees the opportunity in every difficulty
author: Winston Churchill

poem: You will never succeed if you do not believe that you deserve what you want. Visualize your goal. Make an effort to go for it and always stay positive that it can be yours
author: Dr Anil Kr Sinha

poem: Positivity will block the negative thoughts that overwhelm you during tough times. Stay positive and you'll achieve more than what you set yourself for
author: Anurag Prakash Ray

poem: The positivity in our life is a function of our thinking. So think positive, stay positive
author: Simi Ngr

poem: Be fanatically positive and militantly optimistic. If something is not to your liking, change your liking
author: Rick Steves

poem: Work hard, stay positive, and get up early. It's the best part of the day
author: George Allen

poem: Delete the negative; accentuate the positive
author: Donna Karan

poem: Love yourself. It is important to stay positive because beauty comes from the inside out
author: Jenn Proske

poem: When you go through a negative situation, don't think about it. Make it positive
author: Yoko Ono

poem: Be positive with every idea surrounding your dreams. Think about the possibility of what you plan to do and approach it with an optimistic action. Stay positively
author: Israelmore Ayivor

poem: By choosing positivity you become a contender for the human spirit giving hope to those in need
author: Bryant McGill

poem: No matter what you face, don't forget if you're positive, positivity will find you and embrace you
author: Widad Akrawi

poem: Negative people need drama like oxygen. Stay positive, it'll take their breath away
author: Tony Gaskins

poem: Have fun, be yourself, enjoy life and stay positive
author: Tatiana Maslany

poem: A fantastic positive ATTITUDE makes a great day! SMILE
author: Mary D. Bradford

poem: Positive thoughts lead to positive results
author: Maria V. Snyder

poem: If you tell yourself you feel fine, you will
author: Jodi Picoult

poem: You can, you should, and if you're brave enough to start, you will
author: Stephen King

poem: Even in a bad situation, there's always a positive side. Even if you can't see it yet
author: Susane Colasanti

poem: I try and stay positive; being negative isn't good for my personality. I don't just bring myself down, I bring everyone around me down. It's like a dark cloud, 'Uh oh, here we go,' and have to snap out of it
author: Catherine Zeta-Jones

poem: I have the ability to build myself up or break myself down. I stay positive. Strength comes from within
author: Hayley Williams

poem: Strength does not come from winning. Your struggles develop your strengths. When you go through hardships and decide not to surrender, that is strength
author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

poem: You never know how strong you are until being strong is the only choice you have
author: Cayla Mills

poem: Anyone can hide. Facing up to things, working through them, that's what makes you strong
author: Sarah Dessen

poem: Stay strong, be brave, love hard and true, and you will have nothing to lose
author: Demi Lovato

poem: You've got to stay strong to be strong in tough times
author: Tilman J. Fertitta

poem: There's so many things that life is, and no matter how many breakthroughs, trials will exist and we're going to get through it. Just be strong
author: Mary J. Blige

poem: Always be courageous and strong, and don't fear
author: Gabby Douglas

poem: Build up your weaknesses until they become your strong points
author: Knute Rockne

poem: Be strong because things will get better. It may be stormy now but it never rains forever
author: Evan Carmichael

poem: Be strong, believe in who you are; be strong, believe in what you feel
author: Melissa Etheridge

poem: Do not pray for easy lives. Pray to be stronger men
author: John F Kennedy

poem: If you feel lost, disappointed, hesitant, or weak, return to yourself, to who you are, here and now and when you get there, you will discover yourself, like a lotus flower in full bloom, even in a muddy pond, beautiful and strong
author: Masaru Emoto

poem: Flexibility makes buildings to be stronger, imagine what it can do to your soul
author: Carlos Barrios

poem: Character cannot be developed in ease and quiet. Only through experience of trial and suffering can the soul be strengthened, vision cleared, ambition inspired, and success achieved
author: Helen Keller

poem: Never give in.. never, never, never, never, in nothing great or small, large or petty, never give in except to convictions of honor and good sense. Never yield to force.. never yield to the apparently overwhelming might of the enemy
author: Winston Churchill

poem: Pain is temporary- The pain you feel today is only to get strength to face tomorrow
author: Sivaprakash Sidhu

poem: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts
author: Winston Churchill

poem: Build upon strengths, and weaknesses will gradually take care of themselves
author: Joyce C. Lock

poem: He who conquers others is strong; He who conquers himself is mighty
author: Lao Tzu

poem: Life is, at times, tough. And all we need to do is to prove that we are tougher than it
author: Sanhita Baruah

poem: Life's challenges are not supposed to paralyze you, they're supposed to help you discover who you are
author: Bernice Johnson Reagon

poem: Nothing great was ever achieved without enthusiasm
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

poem: Our greatest glory is not in never falling but in rising every time we fall
author: Confucius

poem: When the world says, "Give up," Hope whispers, "Try it one more time.
author: unknown

poem: When you come to the end of your rope, tie a knot and hang on
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

poem: It doesn't matter who you are, where you come from. The ability to triumph begins with you. Always
author: Oprah Winfrey

poem: You have to accept whatever comes and the only important thing is that you meet it with courage and with the best that you have to give
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

poem: Forget about all the reasons why something may not work. You only need to find one good reason why it will
author: Dr. Robert Anthony

poem: Tough times never last, but tough people do
author: Robert H Schuller

poem: Being strong doesn't mean that you can handle every difficult situation on your own, it means that you have the sense to ask God and others for help
author: Nishan Panwar

poem: Courage doesn't always roar. Sometimes courage is the quiet voice at the end of the day saying, 'I will try again tomorrow.
author: Mary Anne Radmacher

poem: Never say never, because limits, like fears, are often just an illusion
author: Michael Jordan

poem: Change is never easy. You fight to hold on. You fight to let go
author: Daniel Stern

poem: The first step is you have to say that you can
author: Will Smith

poem: Believe you can and you're halfway there
author: Theodore Roosevelt

poem: Our greatest glory is not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall
author: Confucius

poem: The ultimate measure of a man is not where he stands in moments of comfort and convenience, but where he stands at times of challenge and controversy
author: Martin Luther King

poem: When the going gets tough, the tough get going
author: Joseph Kennedy

poem: If you fell down yesterday, stand up today
author: H.G. Wells

poem: Problems are not stop signs; they are guidelines
author: Robert Schuller

poem: Life's challenges are not supposed to paralyze you; they're supposed to help you discover who you are
author: Bernice Johnson Reagon

poem: For a tree to become tall it must grow tough roots among the rocks
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

poem: Obstacles don't have to stop you. If you run into a wall, don't turn around and give up. Figure out how to climb it, go through it, or work around it
author: Michael Jordan

poem: No one saves us but ourselves. No one can and no one may. We ourselves must walk the path
author: Buddha

poem: When everything seems to be going against you, remember that the airplane takes off against the wind, not with it
author: Henry Ford

poem: Inside of a ring or out, ain't nothing wrong with going down. It's staying down that's wrong
author: Muhammad Ali

poem: Facing it, always facing it, that's the way to get through. Face it
author: Joseph Conrad

poem: Arise, awake and stop not till the goal is reached
author: Swami Vivekananda

poem: We must embrace pain and burn it as fuel for our journey
author: Kenji Miyazawa

poem: I am not afraid of storms, for I am learning how to sail my ship
author: Louisa May Alcott

poem: A chain is no stronger than its weakest link
author: Sir Leslie Stephen (1832-1904)
