poem: A firm tree does not fear the storm
author: Dayak (Indonesian) (on strength and weakness)

poem: A single arrow is easily broken; a bundle of ten is not
author: Japanese (on strength and weakness)

poem: Control your emotions or they will control you
author: Chinese Proverb

poem: Eagles don't catch flies
author: Desiderius Erasmus (1465-1536)

poem: He that cannot endure the bad will not live to see the good
author: Jewish Proverb

poem: If you ford a river in a crowd, the crocodiles won't get you. (Ed. note: If your lucky!
author: Malagasy (on strength and weakness)

poem: It ain't over til it's over
author: Yogi Berra

poem: It takes a village to raise a child
author: unknown

poem: Little strokes fell great oaks
author: Ben Franklin (1706-1790)

poem: Our handicaps exist only in our minds
author: Franklin Delano Roosevelt (1882-1945)

poem: Persuasion is better than force
author: Aesop (c.620-560 BC)

poem: Rocks need no protection from the rain. (Ed. Note: Except over time!
author: Malay (on strength and weakness)

poem: Some of us think holding on makes us strong; but sometimes it is letting go
author: Hermann Hesse

poem: No one saves us but ourselves. No one can and no one may. We ourselves must walk the path
author: Buddha

poem: The best way out is always through
author: Robert Frost

poem: We gain strength, and courage, and confidence by each experience in which we really stop to look fear in the face... we must do that which we think we cannot
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

poem: Strength does not come from physical capacity. It comes from an indomitable will
author: Mahatma Gandhi

poem: That which does not kill us makes us stronger
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

poem: The weak can never forgive. Forgiveness is the attribute of the strong
author: Mahatma Gandhi

poem: We are only as strong as we are united, as weak as we are divided
author: J.K. Rowling

poem: In the depth of winter, I finally learned that within me there lay an invincible summer
author: Albert Camus

poem: Better to be strong than pretty and useless
author: Lilith Saintcrow

poem: You have power over your mind - not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength
author: Marcus Aurelius

poem: We may get knocked down on the outside, but the key to living in victory is to learn how to get up on the inside
author: Joel Osteen

poem: Sometimes you don't realize your own strength until you come face to face with your greatest weakness
author: Susan Gale

poem: Anyone can give up, it's the easiest thing in the world to do. But to hold it together when everyone else would understand if you fell apart, that's true strength
author: Unknown Author

poem: Fall down seven times, get up eight
author: Japanese Proverb

poem: The most beautiful people I've known are those who have known trials, have known struggles, have known loss, and have found their way out of the depths
author: Elisabeth Kubler-Ross

poem: Strong people don't put people down. They lift them up
author: Unknown Author

poem: You gotta stop wearing your wishbone where your backbone ought to be
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

poem: What lies behind us and what lies before us are tiny matters compared to what lies within us
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

poem: Never bend your head. Always hold it high. Look the world right in the eye
author: Helen Keller

poem: We acquire the strength we have overcome
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

poem: Strength is a matter of a made up mind
author: John Beecher

poem: Few men during their lifetime come anywhere near exhausting the resources dwelling within them. There are deep wells of strength that are never used
author: Richard E. Byrd

poem: He who believes is strong; he who doubts is weak. Strong convictions precede great actions
author: J.F. Clarke

poem: Never say never, because limits, like fears, are often just an illusion
author: Michael Jordan

poem: You were given this life, because you are strong enough to live it
author: Robin Sharma

poem: Life will break you. Nobody can protect you from that, and living alone won't either, for solitude will also break you with its yearning. You have to love. You have to feel. It is the reason you are here on earth. You are here to risk your heart. You are here to be swallowed up. And when it happens that you are broken, or betrayed, or left, or hurt, or death brushes near, let yourself sit by an apple tree and listen to the apples falling all around you in heaps, wasting their sweetness. Tell yourself you tasted as many as you could
author: Louise Erdrich

poem: If you always put limit on everything you do, physical or anything else. It will spread into your work and into your life. There are no limits. There are only plateaus, and you must not stay there, you must go beyond them
author: Bruce Lee

poem: If one dream should fall and break into a thousand pieces, never be afraid to pick one of those pieces up and begin again
author: Flavia Weedn

poem: Pain is inevitable. Suffering is optional
author: M. Kathleen Casey

poem: An attitude of positive expectation is the mark of the superior personality
author: Brian Tracy

poem: The only place where your dream becomes impossible is in your own thinking
author: Robert H. Schuller

poem: No matter what the situation, remind yourself 'I have a choice.
author: Deepak Chopra

poem: Look at a day when you are supremely satisfied at the end. It's not a day when you lounge around doing nothing; it's when you've had everything to do, and you've done i
author: Margaret Thatcher

poem: Where there is no struggle, there is no strengt
author: Oprah Winfrey

poem: Only those who will risk going too far can possibly find out how far one can go
author: T.S. Elliot

poem: Only two things are infinite, the universe and human stupidity, and I'm not sure about the former
author: Albert Einstein

poem: Only the wisest and stupidest of men never change
author: Confucius

poem: When a stupid man is doing something he is ashamed of, he always declares that it is his duty
author: George Bernard Shaw

poem: The problem with educating stupid people was that they didn't know they were stupid. The same went for curing crazy people
author: Chuck Palahniuk,Phoenix

poem: Stupid people will mistake your confidence for arrogance
author: Habeeb Akande

poem: The problem with the world is that everyone does not have a brain, but everyone does have a tongue
author: Raheel Farooq

poem: Talk sense to a fool and he calls you foolish
author: Euripides

poem: A brainiac notices everything, an ignoramus comments about everything
author: Heinrich Heine

poem: Never argue with stupid people, they will drag you down to their level and then beat you with experience
author: Mark Twain

poem: Genius may have its limitations, but stupidity is not thus handicapped
author: Elbert Hubbard

poem: Get all the fools on your side and you can be elected to anything
author: Frank Dane

poem: He is not only dull himself, but the cause of dulness in others
author: Samuel Johnson

poem: Unintelligent people always look for a scapegoat
author: Ernest Bevin

poem: It costs to be stupid. The stupider you are, the more it costs
author: Sherrill Brown

poem: An empty head is not really empty; it is stuffed with rubbish. Hence the difficulty of forcing anything into an empty head
author: Eric Hoffer

poem: I just hate stupid people. They should have to wear signs that say 'I'm Stupid.' That way you wouldn't rely on them, and you wouldn't ask them for nothing
author: Bill Engvall

poem: The biggest cause of trouble in the world today is that the stupid people are so sure about things and the intelligent folks are so full of doubts
author: Bertrand Russell

poem: Stupid people always think they are right. Wise people listen to advice
author: Proverb

poem: Better to remain silent and be thought a fool than to speak and to remove all doubt
author: Abraham Lincoln

poem: Showing off is the fool's idea of glory
author: Bruce Lee

poem: Although it is not true that all conservatives are stupid people, it is true that most stupid people are conservative
author: John Stuart Mill

poem: The real war is not between the West and the East. The real war is between intelligent and stupid people
author: Marjane Satrapi

poem: If you think your boss is stupid, remember: you wouldn't have a job if he was any smarter
author: John Gotti

poem: If there are no stupid questions, then what kind of questions do stupid people ask? Do they get smart just in time to ask questions
author: Scott Adams

poem: Only stupid people don't change their minds
author: Boutros Boutros-Ghali

poem: Stupid people do make me lose my temper and most people are stupid, fortunately for me. It's made it easier for me to make a living
author: Albert Gubay

poem: Wise men create proverbs and fools repeat them
author: Samuel Palmer

poem: Most people would sooner die than start to think. In fact - they do so
author: Bertrand Russell

poem: No matter who or what you support, I believe in supporting fairness first
author: Jennette Mccurdy

poem: We can't help everyone, but everyone can help someone
author: Ronald Reagan

poem: Encourage, lift and strengthen one another. For the positive energy spread to one will be felt by us all. For we are connected, one and all
author: Deborah Day

poem: If you want to support others you have to stay upright yourself
author: Peter Heg

poem: Your small support could accomplish a big dream
author: Mohammad Rishad sakhi

poem: He stands erect by bending over the fallen. He rises by lifting others
author: Robert Green Ingersoll

poem: It is a kingly act to assist the fallen
author: Ovid

poem: It is an eternal obligation toward the human being not to let him suffer from hunger when one has a chance of coming to his assistance
author: Simone Weil

poem: Never reach out your hand unless you're willing to extend an arm
author: Elizabeth Fuller

poem: To keep a lamp burning we have to keep putting oil in it
author: Mother Teresa

poem: When a person is down in the world, an ounce of help is better than a pound of preaching
author: Edward G. Bulwer-Lytton

poem: The truest help we can render an afflicted man is not to take his burden from him, but to call out his best energy, that he may be able to bear the burden
author: Phillips Brooks

poem: val(ez_write_tag([[336,280],'wiseoldsayings_com-box-4','ezslot_4'])); If you have much, give of your wealth; if you have little, give of your heart
author: Arabian Proverb

poem: Support the strong, give courage to the timid, remind the indifferent, and warn the opposed
author: Whitney M. Young

poem: Make a habit of two things: to help; or at least to do no harm
author: Hippocrates

poem: Help others achieve their dreams and you will achieve yours
author: Les Brown

poem: Our prime purpose in this life is to help others. And if you can't help them, at least don't hurt them
author: Dalai Lama

poem: Sometimes the only thing you could do for people was to be there
author: Terry Pratchett

poem: Helping others isn't a chore; it is one of the greatest gifts there is
author: Liya Kebede

poem: Helping someone is what life is all about
author: Willie Stargell

poem: Support the sick, but not the idle
author: unknown

poem: To give aid to every poor man is far beyond the reach and power of every man. Care of the poor is incumbent on society as a whole
author: Baruch Spinoza

poem: To aid life, leaving it free, however, that is the basic task of the educator
author: Maria Montessori

poem: Helping people getting a great start in life, a great foundation, is an investment
author: Gerry Schwartz

poem: Give, but give until it hurts
author: Mother Teresa

poem: No act of kindness, no matter how small, is ever wasted
author: Aesop

poem: Look up and not down. Look forward and not back. Look out and not in, and lend a hand
author: Edward Everett Hale

poem: Never look down on anybody unless you helping him up
author: Jesse Jackson

poem: When you cease to make a contribution, you begin to die
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

poem: Kind words can be short and easy to speak, but their echoes are truly endless
author: Mother Teresa

poem: Everybody can be great...because anybody can serve. You don't have to have a college degree to serve. You don't have to make your subject and verb agree to serve. You only need a heart full of grace. A soul generated by love
author: Martin Luther King

poem: You give but little when you give of your possessions. It is when you give of yourself that you truly give
author: Kahlil Gibran

poem: I am only one, but still I am one. I cannot do everything, but still I can do something; and because I cannot do everything, I will not refuse to do something I can do
author: Edward Everett Hale

poem: The greatest good you can do for another is not just share your riches, but reveal to them their own
author: Disraeli

poem: No one can whistle a symphony. It takes a whole orchestra to play it
author: H.E. Luccock

poem: It takes community to maintain a human
author: Earon Davis

poem: It is not enough to help the feeble up, but to support him after
author: William Shakespeare

poem: Help one another; there's no time like the present and no present like the time
author: James Durst

poem: A friend is the one who comes in when the whole world has gone out
author: Grace Pulpit

poem: Never worry about numbers. Help one person at a time, and always start with the person nearest you
author: Mother Teresa

poem: val(ez_write_tag([[336,280],'wiseoldsayings_com-box-4','ezslot_4'])); No one is useless in this world who lightens the burdens of another
author: Charles Dickens

poem: If you're in the luckiest one per cent of humanity, you owe it to the rest of humanity to think about the other 99 per cent
author: Warren Buffett

poem: It is literally true that you can succeed best and quickest by helping others to succeed
author: Napolean Hill

poem: The best way to find yourself is to lose yourself in the service of others
author: Mahatma Gandhi

poem: There is no use whatever trying to help people who do not help themselves. You cannot push anyone up a ladder unless he is willing to climb himself
author: Andrew Carnegie

poem: You can have everything you want in life if you just help enough people get what they want in life
author: Zig Ziglar

poem: Life's most urgent questions is: What are you doing for others
author: Martin Luther King

poem: Those who are happiest are those who do the most for others
author: Booker T. Washington

poem: Doing nothing for others is the undoing of ourselves
author: Horace Mann

poem: There is no exercise better for the heart than reaching down and lifting people up
author: John Andrew Holmes Jr.

poem: Surfing is for life
author: Bruce Jenkins

poem: The joy of surfing is so many things combined, from the physical exertion of it, to the challenge of it, to the mental side of the sport
author: Kelly Slater

poem: The best surfer out there is the one having the most fun
author: Duke Kahanamoku

poem: Surfing's one of the few sports that you look ahead to see what's behind
author: Laird Hamilton

poem: You cannot stop the waves, but you can learn to surf
author: Jon Kabat-Zinn

poem: There are a million ways to surf, and as long as you're smiling you're doing it right
author: unknown

poem: My passion for surfing was more than my fear of sharks
author: Bethany Hamilton

poem: Life is a lot like surfing...When you get caugh in the impact zone, you've got to just get back up. because you never know what may be the next wave
author: Bethany Hamilton

poem: Surfing is attitude dancing
author: Gerry Lopez

poem: We're all equal before a wave
author: Laird Hamilton

poem: Your surfing can get better on every turn, on every wave you catch. Learn to read the ocean better. A big part of my success has been wave knowledge
author: Kelly Slater

poem: If you're having a bad day, catch a wave
author: Frosty Hesson

poem: One of the greatest things about the sport of surfing is that you need only three things: your body, a surf-board, and a wave
author: Naima Green

poem: Surfing is such an amazing concept. You're taking on Nature with a little stick and saying, 'I'm gonna ride you!' And a lot of times Nature says, 'No you're not!' and crashes you to the bottom
author: Jolene Blalock

poem: Surfing is not an organized sport, but it does have rules. The surfer closest to the curl has the right of way
author: Matt Armstrong

poem: Surfing, alone among sports, generates laughter at its very suggestion, and this is because it turns not a skill into an art, but an inexplicable and useless urge into a vital way of life
author: Matt Warshaw

poem: Surfing expresses ... a pure yearning for visceral, physical contact with the natural world
author: Matt Warshaw

poem: The balance and patience factors are much more critical in surfing than they are in snowboarding ... if you're out surfing serious waves and you wipe out, you don't land on soft snow. It's usually either very sharp coral, or you get raked across the beach gravel and sand while you're tumbling underwater
author: Frederick Lenz

poem: Surfing equates to living in the very moment of  now'. When you ride a wave you leave behind all things important and unimportant, the purity of the moment is upon you
author: Bill Hamilton

poem: Three most important things in life, surf, surf and surf
author: Jack O'Neill

poem: Surf and feel your life be changed forever
author: Nossa Company

poem: There's an independence to surfing, it's just you and the ocean. There aren't a bunch of rules
author: Lee Clow

poem: One thing you learn from surfing is how to operate in the present. It's really what the surfing experience is all about
author: Gerry Lopez

poem: There is wisdom in waves. Some surfers see it right away, others never do. To find success in surfing, we must learn to be in harmony with nature. This will bring a sense of peace. By sharing this peace, and contributing to other people's happiness, we can find the true meaning of life. Keep surfing . .
author: Gerry Lopez

poem: Surfing is good for the soul, worries seems to drift away as you scan the horizon for the next wave
author: Ed Daley

poem: Surfing is like life. Every wave and every day are different
author: unknown

poem: For a surfer, the fluidity of the ocean - of being in it - is what matters
author: Alan 'Fuz' Bleakley

poem: I still feel like my best surfing is ahead of me
author: Kelly Slater

poem: Surfing gets your soul, once you feel the wave lift you up and thrust you forward you begin to realise how powerful but beautiful mother nature is and how vast the universe really is, this cant help but smile on your face in absolute awe of how beautiful it is to have participated in life
author: Fisher Cannon

poem: Surfing is like golf: You're always battling, and it keeps knocking you down. There are a lot of wipeouts. But when you stay with it and catch that wave, you really taste it. It's magic
author: Dennis Quaid

poem: The rule of surfing is never tell anyone where you go
author: John Slattery

poem: When the surfs up, your life is too
author: Wilhelm Sverdvik

poem: The only one whom can whisper to you the ways of the surf, is the wind
author: Wilhelm Sverdvik

poem: There are no more committed people on the planet than surfers. We fall down a lot. We turn around, paddle back out, and do it over and over again. Unlike anything else in life, the stoke of surfing is so high that the failures quickly fade from memory
author: Gary Sirota

poem: Not to sound too deep or weird, but I think that the times when you really appreciate surfing are the times you're really sort of becoming one with nature. Surfing's as raw of a sport as it gets
author: Kelly Slater

poem: When life hands you lemons, you make lemonade. But when life hands you hurricanes, you go surfing
author: Jon Foreman

poem: Waves are toys from God
author: Clay Marzo

poem: When life gives you rough waves, surf'em
author: unknown

poem: Sometimes in the morning, when it's a good surf, I go out there, and I don't feel like it's a bad world
author: Kary Mullis

poem: I feel my absolute best physically, mentally and spiritually when I'm surfing every day
author: Marisa Miller

poem: If in doubt, paddle out
author: Nat Young

poem: There is nothing, nothing, more sad than a surfer who used to surf
author: Old Surfer Sage

poem: Never drive away from good surf
author: Roger Sharp

poem: I've always thought surfing is a reflection of who you are
author: Kelly Slater

poem: I don't think anyone gets to the end of their life and wishes they had surfed less
author: Bradley Hook

poem: In surfing, coming to terms with death -- or at least the possibility -- is an ongoing crisis in big waves. The set is building outside, and it's so beautiful, aesthetically. People are watching in awe from the beach: the blue water, the stiff offshore winds, the 40-foot walls charging in from the open ocean. If you're out there with nothing but your body, your wits and a surfboard, that set can be your coffin
author: Bruce Jenkins

poem: Surfing is the most blissful experience you can have on this planet, a taste of heaven
author: John McCarthy

poem: It looks easy, like surfing, but surfing is hard too
author: George Eads

poem: I'm surfing the giant life wave
author: William Shatner

poem: A man, as a general rule, owes very little to what he is born with, a man is what he makes himself
author: Alexander Graham Bell

poem: Nobody is stronger, nobody is weaker than someone who came back. There is nothing you can do to such a person because whatever you could do is less than what has already been done to him. We have already paid the price
author: Elie Wiesel

poem: In spite of everything that was done to me and my race, in spite of the adversity and the bitter moments, again we rise
author: Maya Angelou

poem: In a mad world, only the mad are sane
author: Akiro Kurosawa

poem: Peace is the one condition of survival in this nuclear age
author: Adlai Stevenson

poem: All I'm trying to do is not join my ancestral spirits just yet
author: Joshua Nkomo

poem: Hunger, love, pain, fear are some of those inner forces which rule the individual's instinct for self preservation
author: Albert Einstein

poem: If you live among wolves you have to act like a wolf
author: Nikita Khrushchev

poem: To survive it is often necessary to fight and to fight you have to dirty yourself
author: George Orwell

poem: Once one determines that he or she has a mission in life, that's it's not going to be accomplished without a great deal of pain, and that the rewards in the end may not outweigh the pain --if you recognize historically that always happens, then when it comes, you survive it
author: Richard M. Nixon

poem: Man can live about forty days without food, about three days without water, about eight minutes without air, but only for one second without hope
author: Charles Darwin

poem: Survival is nothing more than recovery
author: Dianne Feinstein

poem: The ability to delude yourself may be an important survival tool
author: Jane Wagner

poem: Through humor, you can soften some of the worst blows that life delivers. And once you find laughter, no matter how painful your situation might be, you can survive it
author: Bill Cosby

poem: In a world where change is inevitable and continuous, the need to achieve that change without violence is essential for survival
author: Andrew Young

poem: For Harmony. A chance at life. To fight on other days
author: Janet Morris

poem: The consciousness of being deemed dead, is next to the presumable unpleasantness of being so in reality. One feels like his own ghost unlawfully tenanting a defunct carcass
author: Herman Melville

poem: Nature's stern discipline enjoins mutual help at least as often as warfare. The fittest may also be the gentlest
author: Theodosius Dobzhansky

poem: The faster you can signal for rescue, the faster you get out of that situation
author: Joseph Teti

poem: You don't know if you're going to be rescued in a day or a month; gotta prepare for the long haul; gotta make the place your home
author: Matt Graham

poem: The man who goes afoot, prepared to camp anywhere and in any weather, is the most independent fellow on earth
author: Horace Kephart

poem: Perhaps catastrophe is the natural human environment, and even though we spend a good deal of energy trying to get away from it, we are programmed for survival amid catastrophe
author: Germaine Greer

poem: Tis the last rose of summer Left blooming alone; All her lovely companions Are faded and gone
author: Thomas More

poem: Every day I run scared. That's the only way I can stay ahead
author: John H. Johnson

poem: The condition of man... is a condition of war of everyone against everyone
author: Thomas Hobbes

poem: And while the law of competition may be sometimes hard for the individual, it is best for the race, because it ensures the survival of the fittest in every department
author: Andrew Carnegie

poem: It is not the strongest of the species that survives, nor the most intelligent, but rather the one most adaptable to change
author: Clarence Darrow

poem: Resilience is the maintenance of high levels of positive affect and well-being in the face of adversity. It is not that resilient individuals never experience negative affect, but rather that the negative affect does not persist
author: Richard J. Davidson

poem: Self-preservation is the first principle of our nature
author: Alexander Hamilton

poem: In truth, we exist and survive, not because of the ego, but in spite of it
author: David R. Hawkins

poem: Surviving means being born over and over again
author: Erica Jong

poem: Only the strong survive
author: Namibian Proverb

poem: Rule of survival: Pack your own parachute
author: T.L. Hakala

poem: Victory at all costs, victory in spite of all terror, victory however long and hard the road may be; for without victory, there is no survival
author: Winston Churchill

poem: We shall draw from the heart of suffering itself the means of inspiration and survival
author: Winston Churchill

poem: Survival is triumph enough
author: Harry Crews

poem: Love and compassion are necessities, not luxuries. Without them humanity cannot survive
author: Dalai Lama

poem: It takes but one positive thought when given a chance to survive and thrive to overpower an entire army of negative thoughts
author: Robert H. Schuller

poem: Confront them with annihilation, and they will then survive; plunge them into a deadly situation, and they will then live. When people fall into danger, they are then able to strive for victory
author: Sun Tzu

poem: Every man is wise when attacked by a mad dog; fewer when pursued by a mad woman; only the wisest survive when attacked by a mad notion
author: Robertson Davies

poem: Notice that the stiffest tree is most easily cracked, while the bamboo or willow survives by bending with the wind
author: Bruce Lee

poem: Hunger, love, pain, fear are some of those inner forces which rule the individual's instinct for self preservation
author: Albert Einstein

poem: val(ez_write_tag([[336,280],'wiseoldsayings_com-box-4','ezslot_4'])); Self-preservation, nature's first great law, all the creatures, except man, doth awe
author: Andrew Marvell

poem: We are survival machines -- robot vehicles blindly programmed to preserve the selfish molecules known as genes
author: Richard Dawkins

poem: Survival is the ability to swim in strange water
author: Frank Herbert

poem: Survival often feels like an indignity
author: Guillermo Del Toro

poem: In the greater part of humankind there resides an instinct for survival. It is this which can clutch at straws and effect a rescue from them. It is this which can, now and then, outwit fate
author: Tanith Lee

poem: Survival ... is an infinite capacity for suspicion
author: John Le Carre

poem: When you come to the end of your rope, tie a knot and hang on
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

poem: What does not kill us makes us stronger
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

poem: Do you want to be safe and good, or do you want to take a chance and be great
author: Jimmy Johnson

poem: Just keep taking chances and having fun
author: Garth Brooks

poem: I love taking chances
author: Wayne Newton

poem: He who takes no chances wins nothing
author: Danish Proverb

poem: If you are never scared, embarrassed or hurt, it means you never take chances
author: Julia Soul

poem: If you aren't making some mistakes, you aren't taking enough chances
author: John Sculley

poem: If you're not scared then you're not taking a chance. If you're not taking a chance then what the hell are you doing anyway
author: Ted Mosby

poem: I've got to take chances and get out there. What are you going to do, sit home and knit? I don't knit
author: Cybill Shepherd

poem: I believe in taking chances and living your life. Sometimes doors open and others close and you have to figure out which one you're going to take. I'm always for the one that's challenging
author: Gisele Bundchen

poem: Be passionate about your life. Learn to live without the fear of failing. Take a chance, you just might surprise yourself
author: Nishan Panwar

poem: Take a chance! All life is a chance. The man who goes farthest is generally the one who is willing to do and dare
author: Dale Carnegie

poem: Our lives improve only when we take chances -- and the first and most difficult risk we can take is to be honest with ourselves
author: Walter Anderson

poem: Necessity is the mother of taking chances
author: Mark Twain

poem: If you want to achieve a high goal, you're going to have to take some chances
author: Alberto Salazar

poem: Every chance taken is another chance to win
author: unknown

poem: Nothing important was ever achieved without someone taking a chance
author: H Jackson Brown Jr

poem: In life we take chances to prove to ourselves that we are strong enough to be here
author: Shaylee Schmidt

poem: Take a chance. You never know how perfect something might turn out to be
author: unknown

poem: Take chances, make mistakes. That's how you grow. Pain nourishes your courage. You have to fail in order to practice being brave
author: Mary Tyler Moore

poem: To dare is to lose one's footing momentarily. To not dare is to lose oneself
author: Sren Kierkegaard

poem: A lifetime isn't forever, so take the first chance, don't wait for the second one! Because sometimes, there aren't second chances! And if it turns out to be a mistake? So what! This is life! A whole bunch of mistakes! But if you never get a second chanc
author: C. JoyBell C.

poem: Never regret taking a chance, even if you fall on your face; It's better to know you tried and failed than to wonder the great "what if?"
author: Devin Frye

poem: When we allow ourselves to become vulnerable, to take chances, and to risk our pride, that is when we find our own glory
author: Richard Corman

poem: Life's not about sitting at home in front of the TV waiting for your life to begin. Get out there and take some chances
author: Queen Latifah

poem: Taking chances on opportunities, even if they aren't right for you, gives you a clearer picture of where you want to go with your life and career
author: Lauren Bush Lauren

poem: You learn so much from taking chances, whether they work out or not. Either way, you can grow from the experience and become stronger and smarter
author: John Legend

poem: The successful man is the one who had the chance and took it
author: Roger Babson

poem: You can't go through life protecting yourself from everything. You have to take chances. Because if you don't, then you might as well not be living
author: unknown

poem: I've found that luck is quite predictable. If you want more luck, take more chances
author: Brian Tracy

poem: Every day, you'll have opportunities to take chances and to work outside your safety net. Sure, it's a lot easier to stay in your comfort zone.. in my case, business suits and real estate.. but sometimes you have to take risks. When the risks pay off, th
author: Donald Trump

poem: The great thing about taking big chance when you're younger is you have less to lose and you don't know as much. So you take big swings
author: Amy Poehler

poem: al(ez_write_tag([[468,60],'wiseoldsayings_com-medrectangle-3','ezslot_6']));“ Take a chance as it is a once in a lifetime opportunity. Have a positive mind set and all will go according to plan
author: Ruwaida Fourie

poem: I always try to take the chance even though my past wasn't the greatest. I take a person and accept them for who they are and whatever past, present or future they hold. Even the scariest of chances could be the greatest
author: Jacki Grenier

poem: The important thing is not being afraid to take a chance. Remember, the greatest failure is to not try. Once you find something you love to do, be the best at doing it
author: Debbi Fields

poem: We all need to decide whether to "play it safe" in life and worry about the downside, or instead take a chance, by being who we really are and living the life our heart desires. Which choice are you making
author: Charlie Badenhop

poem: Your regrets aren't what you did, but what you didn't do. So I take every opportunity
author: Cameron Diaz

poem: In the end, what we regret most are the chances we never took
author: Frasier Crane

poem: Chance favors only those who court her
author: Charles Nicolle

poem: A wise man turns chance into good fortune
author: Thomas Fuller

poem: If you know you can do it - if you can already chart every day in your future - then why bother? Choose to do something you have more trouble imagining. Take a chance
author: Gina Barreca

poem: The only safe thing is to take a chance
author: Mike Nichols

poem: Everything you want lies on the other side of learning to trust yourself. Take a chance. Have faith. You already know who you are, what you want, and where you want to go
author: Vironika Tugaleva

poem: If I had not try and taken chances, I would have miss many great opportunities in life
author: Lailah Giftyakita

poem: Somebody must take a chance. The monkeys who became men, and the monkeys who didn't are still jumping around in trees making faces at the monkeys who did
author: Lincoln Steffens

poem: In an instant, we can make the choice to let our hearts stay broken or we can take a chance in living, and allow this beautiful adventure called life, set our hearts on fire
author: Lrae Brown

poem: You never know what life is going to throw at you so don't be afraid to take a chance because it might just be the best thing to happen to you
author: Abhishek Tiwari

poem: Sometimes you just have to have Faith and take a Chance...even when your heart is shaking! Have Faith in the blessings that God has planned for you
author: Nishan Panwar

poem: Any time you take a chance you better be sure the rewards are worth the risk because they can put you away just as fast for a ten dollar heist as they can for a million dollar job
author: Stanley Kubrick

poem: The moon is a friend for the lonesome to talk to
author: Carl Sandburg

poem: The moon puts on an elegant show, different every time in shape, colour and nuance
author: Arthur Smith

poem: Aim for the moon. If you miss, you may hit a star
author: W. Clement Stone

poem: The moon is very rugged
author: Alan Bean

poem: I like to think that the moon is there even if I am not looking at it
author: Albert Einstein

poem: You can be the moon and still be jealous of the stars
author: Gary Allan

poem: The moon was a ghostly galleon tossed upon cloudy seas
author: Alfred Noyes

poem: The Moon is the first milestone on the road to the stars
author: Arthur C. Clarke

poem: Ten years ago the Moon was an inspiration to poets and an opportunity for lovers. Ten years from now it will be just another airport
author: Emmanuel G. Mesthene

poem: The moon is a silver pin-head vast, That holds the heaven's tent-hangings fast
author: William R. Alger

poem: The moon lives in the lining of your skin
author: Pablo Neruda

poem: The moon is brighter since the barn burned
author: Matsuo Basho

poem: The moon is essentially gray, no color. It looks like plaster of Paris, like dirty beach sand with lots of footprints in it
author: James A. Lovell

poem: We'll go back to the moon by not learning anything new
author: Burt Rutan

poem: The moon was reigning over their world, glowing its full splendor to all those willing to look up
author: Irina Serban

poem: The moon rested right above the mountains, a place I call home
author: Daniel Wallock

poem: The full moon - the mandala of the sky
author: Tom Robbins

poem: It is no secret that the moon has no light of her own, but is, as it were, a mirror, receiving brightness from the influence of the sun
author: Vitruvius

poem: When the moon is not full, the stars shine more brightly
author: Proverb

poem: The Moon is opposing Jupiter. Don't get involved, it's their problem
author: Jim Critchfield

poem: The moon will guide you through the night with her brightness, but she will always dwell in the darkness, in order to be seen
author: Shannon L. Alder

poem: Every one is a moon, and has a dark side which he never shows to anybod
author: Mark Twain

poem: The moon, like a flower In heaven's high bower, With silent delight Sits and smiles on the night
author: William Blake

poem: The moon can never breathe, but it can take our breath away with the beauty of its cold, arid orb
author: Munia Khan

poem: The moon is beautiful only when the mind is seeking beauty and the heart is loving
author: Debasish Mridha, M.D.

poem: The wisdom of the Moon is greater than the wisdom of the Earth, because the Moonsees the universe better than the Earth can see it
author: Mehmet Murat ildan

poem: There is something haunting in the light of the moon; it has all the dispassionateness of a disembodied soul, and something of its inconceivable mystery
author: Joseph Conrad

poem: The moon looks upon many night flowers; the night flowers see but one moon
author: Jean Ingelow

poem: There is no dark side of the moon really. Matter of fact it's all dark
author: Pink Floyd

poem: The moon is the reflection of your heart and moonlight is the twinkle of your love
author: Debasish Mridha

poem: THIS MUST BE THURSDAY. I NEVER COULD GET THE HANG OF THURSDAYS
author: Douglas Adams

poem: I wish you a tolerable Thursday. That's all any of us can hope for
author: April Winchell

poem: Thursday, I forecast as mostly sunny. It's a much-needed break
author: John Farley

poem: Thursday is perhaps the worst day of the week. It's nothing in itself; it just reminds you that the week has been going on too long
author: Nicci French

poem: Thursday is end day in weekend.  Today you are so tired and will think about how was your week and how will go on Thursday.  With everything that has happened to you, you can either feel sorry for yourself, or treat what has happened as a gift.  Everythi
author: Wayne Dyer

poem: Thursday. The most useless day. it only exists as a reminder that it's been a really long week...and it's still not over
author: unknown

poem: If 40 is the new 30 and 50 is the new 40, why can't Thursday be the new Friday
author: unknown

poem: Nothing screws up your Friday like realizing its Thursday
author: unknown

poem: Thursday is my favorite day to plan how I'm going to get out of the plans I already made for the weekend
author: unknown

poem: Wednesday is hump day which makes thursday 'I wonder if he'll call' day
author: unknown

poem: People who think Thursday is the new Friday have serious mental problems
author: unknown

poem: I wait until Thursday to ask people about their weekend plans so there's a better chance they're already busy
author: unknown

poem: Happy Thursday! You're only one day away from being two days away from doing the same work you're doing right now
author: unknown

poem: Beter days are just around the corner. They are called Friday, Saturday and Sunday
author: unknown

poem: All that really belongs to us is time; even he who has nothing else has that
author: Baltasar Gracian

poem: No use thinking of the past for its gone, don't think of the future because it has to come, think of the present because thats where you are
author: Kazi Shams

poem: Time is what we want most, but... what we use worst
author: William Penn

poem: Time is a cruel thief to rob us of our former selves. We lose as much to life as we do to death
author: Elizabeth Forsythe Hailey

poem: If time flies when you're having fun, it hits the afterburners when you don't think you're having enough
author: Jef Mallett

poem: We must use time as a tool, not as a crutch
author: John F. Kennedy

poem: If we take care of the moments, the years will take care of themselves
author: Maria Edgeworth

poem: Regret for wasted time is more wasted time
author: Mason Cooley

poem: Lost time is never found again
author: Benjamin Franklin

poem: The only reason for time is so that everything doesn't happen at once
author: Albert Einstein

poem: Yesterday's the past, tomorrow's the future, but today is a gift. That's why it's called the present
author: Bil Keane

poem: Time changes everything except something within us which is always surprised by change
author: Thomas Hardy

poem: Know the true value of time; snatch, seize, and enjoy every moment of it. No idleness, no laziness, no procrastination: never put off till tomorrow what you can do today
author: Philip Stanhope, 4th Earl of Chesterfield

poem: Time is the most valuable thing a man can spend
author: Theophrastus

poem: Time flies over us, but leaves its shadow behind
author: Nathaniel Hawthorne

poem: Time is the longest distance between two places
author: Tennessee Williams

poem: Those who make the worst use of their time are the first to complain of its brevity
author: Jean De La Bruyere

poem: Time is an illusion
author: Albert Einstein

poem: Time is a created thing. To say 'I don't have time,' is like saying, 'I don't want to
author: Lao Tzu

poem: The timeless in you is aware of life's timelessness. And knows that yesterday is but today's memory and tomorrow is today's dream
author: Kahlil Gibran

poem: The future is something which everyone reaches at the rate of sixty minutes an hour, whatever he does, whoever he is
author: C.S. Lewis

poem: Time takes it all, whether you want it to or not
author: Stephen King

poem: Better three hours too soon, than one minute too late
author: William Shakespeare

poem: Time is the wisest counselor of all
author: Pericles

poem: Time is the school in which we learn, time is the fire in which we burn
author: Delmore Schwartz

poem: Nothing is a waste of time if you use the experience wisely
author: Rodin

poem: Time = life; therefore, waste your time and waste of your life, or master your time and master your life
author: Alan Lakein

poem: The common man is not concerned about the passage of time, the man of talent is driven by it
author: Shoppenhauer

poem: Don't be fooled by the calendar. There are only as many days in the year as you make use of. One man gets only a week's value out of a year while another man gets a full year's value out of a week
author: Charles Richards

poem: The key is in not spending time, but in investing it
author: Stephen R. Covey

poem: We all have our time machines. Some take us back, they're called memories. Some take us forward, they're called dreams
author: Jeremy Irons

poem: Time ripens all things; with Time all things are revealed; Time is the father of truth
author: Francois Rabelais

poem: Suspect each moment, for it is a thief, tiptoeing away with more than it brings
author: John Updike

poem: Old Time, that greatest and longest established spinner of all!.... his factory is a secret place, his work is noiseless, and his hands are mutes
author: Charles Dickens

poem: Time brings all things to pass
author: Aeschylus

poem: Men talk of killing time, while time quietly kills them
author: Dion Boucicault

poem: For disappearing acts, it's hard to beat what happens to the eight hours supposedly left after eight of sleep and eight of work
author: Doug Larson

poem: You must have been warned against letting the golden hours slip by; but some of them are golden only because we let them slip by
author: J.M. Barrie

poem: It's a strange thing, but when you are dreading something, and would give anything to slow down time, it has a disobliging habit of speeding up
author: J.K. Rowling

poem: Who forces time is pushed back by time; who yields to time finds time on his side
author: The Talmud

poem: Time is like the wind, it lifts the light and leaves the heavy
author: Dominico Cieri Estrada

poem: val(ez_write_tag([[336,280],'wiseoldsayings_com-box-4','ezslot_4'])); There is one kind of robber whom the law does not strike at, and who steals what is most precious to men: time
author: Napoleon I

poem: You can't make up for lost time. You can only do better in the future
author: Ashley Ormon

poem: Yesterday is gone. Tomorrow has not yet come. We have only today. Let us begin
author: Mother Teresa

poem: I must govern the clock, not be governed by it
author: Golda Meir

poem: We must use time wisely and forever realize that the time is always ripe to do right
author: Nelson Mandela

poem: Time is the coin of your life. It is the only coin you have, and only you can determine how it will be spent. Be careful lest you let other people spend it for you
author: Carl Sandburg

poem: Determine never to be idle. No person will have occasion to complain of the want of time who never loses any. It is wonderful how much can be done if we are always doing
author: Thomas Jefferson

poem: A man who dares to waste one hour of life has not discovered the value of life
author: Charles Darwin

poem: Time is a brisk wind, for each hour it brings something new... but who can understand and measure its sharp breath, its mystery and its design
author: Paracelsus

poem: A true friend freely, advises justly, assists readily, adventures boldly, takes all patiently, defends courageously, and continues a friend unchangeably
author: William Penn

poem: A true friend is one who overlooks your failures and tolerates your success
author: Doug Larson

poem: A true friend is someone who is there for you when he'd rather be anywhere else
author: Len Wein

poem: A true friend is someone who thinks that you are a good egg even though he knows that you are slightly cracked
author: Bernard Meltzer

poem: True friends are those who came into your life, saw the most negative part of you, but are not ready to leave you, no matter how contagious you are to them
author: Michael Bassey Johnson

poem: True friends can communicate with their eyes
author: Mary Rose Magnaye

poem: True friends walks in when the rest of the world has walked out
author: Walter Winchell

poem: True friends are not mirrors where we can always see ourselves reflected in a positive light
author: Shannon L. Alder

poem: The friend who holds your hand and says the wrong thing is made of dearer stuff than the one who stays away
author: Barbara Kingsolver

poem: You can always tell a real friend: when you've made a fool of yourself he doesn't feel you've done a permanent job
author: Laurence J. Peter

poem: Don't walk behind me; I may not lead. Don't walk in front of me; I may not follow. Just walk beside me and be my friend
author: Albert Camus

poem: Lots of people want to ride with you in the limo, but what you want is someone who will take the bus with you when the limo breaks down
author: Oprah Winfrey

poem: Only your real friends will tell you when your face is dirty
author: Sicilian Proverb

poem: Many people will walk in and out of your life, but only true friends will leave footprints in your heart
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

poem: A loyal friend laughs at your jokes when they're not so good, and sympathizes with your problems when they're not so bad
author: Arnold H. Glasgow

poem: The friend is the man who knows all about you, and still likes you
author: Elbert Hubbard

poem: A true friend never gets in your way unless you happen to be going down
author: Arnold Glasow

poem: Cherish the friend who tells you a harsh truth, wanting ten times more to tell you a loving lie
author: Robert Brault

poem: A friend can tell you things you don't want to tell yourself
author: Frances Ward Weller

poem: It's the ones you can call up at 4:00 a.m. that really matter
author: Marlene Dietrich

poem: 10. A friend shares the good times and helps out by listening during the bad times
author: Molly Oliver

poem: A true friend is someone you can disagree with and still remain friends. For if not, they weren't true friends in the first place
author: Sandy Ratliff

poem: A true friend  encourages us, comforts us, supports us like a big easy chair, offering us a safe refuge from the world
author: H. Jackson Brown

poem: A friend knows the song in my heart and sings it to me when my memory fails
author: Donna Roberts

poem: Ah, how good it feels! The hand of an old friend
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

poem: One measure of friendship consists not in the number of things friends can discuss, but in the number of things they need no longer mention
author: Clifton Fadiman

poem: Our most difficult task as a friend is to offer understanding when we don't understand
author: Robert Brault

poem: Tell me something only you know and make a new friend
author: Dejan Stojanovic

poem: What draws people to be friends is that they see the same truth. They share it
author: C.S. Lewis

poem: The most beautiful discovery true friends make is that they can grow separately without growing apart
author: Elizabeth Foley

poem: When a friend is in trouble, don't annoy him by asking if there is anything you can do. Think up something appropriate and do it
author: Edgar Watson Howe

poem: The greatest good you can do for another is not just to share your riches but to reveal to him his own
author: Benjamin Disraeli

poem: One friend in a lifetime is much; two are many; three are hardly possible
author: Henry Adams

poem: The essence of true friends is to make allowances for another's  little lapses
author: David Storey

poem: We need old friends to help us grow old and new friends to  help us stay young
author: Letty Cottin Pogrebin

poem: A friend is one who knows us, but loves us anyway
author: Jerome Cummings

poem: Don't be dismayed at good-byes. A farewell is necessary before you can meet again. And meeting again, after moments or lifetimes, is certain for those who are friends
author: Richard Bach

poem: Never shall I forget the days I spent with you. Continue to be my friend, as you will always find me yours
author: Ludwig van Beethoven

poem: I cannot even imagine where I would be today were it not for that handful of friends who have given me a heart full of joy. Let's face it, friends make life a lot more fun
author: Charles R. Swindoll

poem: If you live to be a hundred, I want to live to be a hundred minus one day so I never have to live without you
author: A. A. Milne

poem: Good friends help you to find important things when you have lost them your smile, your hope, and your courage
author: Doe Zantamata

poem: Are we not like two volumes of one book
author: Marceline Desbordes-Valmore

poem: We have been friends together In sunshine and in shade
author: Caroline Sheridan Norton

poem: We all take different paths in life, but no matter where we go, we take a little of each other everywhere
author: Tim McGraw

poem: Surround yourself only with people who are going to lift you higher
author: Oprah Winfrey

poem: Friends are born, not made
author: Henry Adams

poem: Man's best friend is one who wishes well to the object of his wish for his sake, even if no one is to know of it
author: Aristotle

poem: A sure friend is known in unsure circumstances
author: Quintus Ennius

poem: Have friends, not for the sake of receiving, but of giving
author: Joseph Roux

poem: Our triumphs seem hollow unless we have friends to share them, and our failures are made bearable by their understanding
author: James Rachels

poem: Do not trust all men, but trust men of worth; the former course is silly, the latter a mark of prudence
author: Democritus

poem: Trust is like a vase.. once it's broken, though you can fix it, the vase will never be same again
author: Walter Anderson

poem: Trust is something that is difficult to establish. It is very fragile that needs to be taken care of. Once trust breaks or shatters into pieces, it is very difficult to rebuild it
author: K. Cunningham

poem: Trust is the easiest thing in the world to loose, and the hardest thing in the world to get back
author: R. Williams

poem: Respect people who trust you. It takes a lot for people to trust you, so treat their trust like precious porcelain
author: Brandon Cox

poem: Trust is always earned, never given
author: R. Williams

poem: Trust is only gained when one person risks and doesn't get harmed. It grows as both people increasingly risk and don't get harmed in the process
author: Glen Williams

poem: Trust is involved in all the basic elements of a healthy relationship: namely, love (respect and consideration for another person), communication, commitment and honesty
author: Harold Duarte-Bernhardt

poem: It is an equal failing to trust everybody, and to trust nobody
author: English Proverb

poem: In order to establish trust, it is first important that you be trustworthy. This means you should be forthright with all your dealings
author: Paul Melendez

poem: Trust, but verify
author: Ronald Reagan

poem: Put more trust in nobility of character than in an oath
author: Solon

poem: Trust is like blood pressure. It's silent, vital to good health, and if abused it can be deadly
author: Frank Sonnenberg

poem: Trust is the lubrication that makes it possible for organizations to work
author: Warren Bennis

poem: He who does not trust enough will not be trusted
author: Lao Tzu

poem: You may be deceived if you trust too much, but you will live in torment if you don't trust enough
author: Frank Crane

poem: The best way to find out if you can trust somebody is to trust them
author: Ernest Hemingway

poem: Trust is letting go of needing to know all the details before you open your heart
author: Unknown Author

poem: Trust is the glue of life. It's the most essential ingredient in effective communication. It's the foundational principle that holds all relationships
author: Stephen Covey

poem: We're never so vulnerable than when we trust someone - but paradoxically, if we cannot trust, neither can we find love or joy
author: Walter Anderson

poem: Trust opens up new and unimagined possibilities
author: Robert C. Solomon

poem: Building trust means thinking about trust in a positive way
author: Robert C. Solomon

poem: Trust in God for great things. With your five loaves and two fishes He will show you a way to feed thousands
author: Horace Bushnell

poem: Trust is a skill learned over time so that, like a well-trained athlete, one makes the right moves, usually without much reflection
author: Robert C. Solomon

poem: A man who doesn't trust himself can never truly trust anyone else
author: Cardinal de Retz

poem: The best proof of love is trust
author: Joyce Brothers

poem: The toughest thing about the power of trust is that it's very difficult to build and very easy to destroy
author: Thomas J. Watson

poem: Deciding whether or not to trust a person is like deciding whether or not to climb a tree, because you might get a wonderful view from the highest branch, or you might simply get covered in sap, and for this reason many people choose to spend their time alone and indoors, where it is harder to get a splinter
author: Lemony Snicket

poem: Trust is the fruit of a relationship in which you know you are loved
author: Wm. Paul Young

poem: Trust yourself, you will start to trust others
author: Santosh Kalwar

poem: I trust everyone. I just don't trust the devil inside them
author: Troy Kennedy-Martin

poem: Volleyball: Invented by men, perfected by wome
author: Unknown Author

poem: Volleyball: It's in your heart; or it's in your face
author: Unknown Author

poem: Volleyball is one of the most interactive games going. It is a game of intuition, imagination, improvisation - but most of all, of reciprocity - of teamwork. There is no way to free-lance in volleyball
author: Marv Dunphy

poem: Volleyball anchored me at a time in my life when I needed it. It gave me a reason for being this big, big girl
author: Gabrielle Reece

poem: Volleyball is not just a sport, it's a way to express your anger without hurting someone
author: Unknown Author

poem: It takes a lot of hard work and dedication just like any pro sport. Especially for beach volleyball you don't have to be tall or as fast as other sports. You just have to have the skills
author: Misty May

poem: Kerri and I stay motivated because we hate to lose. What's great about beach volleyball is you can always find something to get better at. I don't think about losing. It could happen. I just go out there and play. I couldn't tell you any numbers or winning streaks. I just go out and do it
author: Misty May

poem: I love that our sport is sexy. I think it is appropriately so
author: Kerri Walsh

poem: Breathe, believe, and battle. My former coach, Troy Tanner, told us that before each match. Breathe - be in the moment. Believe - have faith that you can rise above it. Battle - you gotta be prepared to go for as long as it takes
author: Kerri Walsh

poem: Don't ever let the ball hit the ground without a body hitting the ground with it
author: Unknown Author

poem: No volleyball play can begin without a serve, and the serve is the only technique that is totally under your control. In other endeavors, you cannot succeed without believing in yourself, and that belief is completely under your control
author: Karch Kiraly

poem: A good team can win a volleyball game when they are ahead, but only a great team can win when they are behind
author: Unknown Author

poem: Volleyball is more than a sport, it's a way of lif
author: Unknown Author

poem: My coach tells me to give about 75% to volleyball. If I give 100%, my serve will kill someone, and my coach doesn't want to deal with the paperwork
author: Unknown Author

poem: Be a leader. A setter should be high energy. It's important that you learn how to give positive, constructive criticism. It's crucial that you make your teammates feel comfortable. You should never be the most silent player in the gym
author: Lindsey Berg

poem: There is pressure on every play. You can't make a mistake, but that also means your opponent can't make a mistake. It makes the matches more exciting to watch
author: Holly McPeak

poem: I got the nickname Spitfire for a reason. I burned inside to play volleyball. I loved the competition of it
author: Summer Altice

poem: Volleyball is the sport through which I am able to express my God-given talents of being an athlete. It is a sport which involves relating, pushing, and encouraging your teammates
author: David Beard

poem: The beach game taught me great lessons about how to elevate the play of my teammate, or teammates, and how to anticipate and expect the ball so much more than the indoor game ever could. It taught me - even forced me - to be a much better-all-around player
author: Karch Kiraly

poem: Anyone serious about playing indoor, you should play outdoor

poem: It was unbelievable. It was so great to work like that and be able to pull it out at the very end. We played so well together, helping each other out at just the right time.
